original: 'on kyang tshogs pa las kyang yongs su gyur pa dag las skye la /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa las kyang yongs su gyur pa dag las skye la /
translated: But some arise from a transformation of the assemblage.

original: yang la la ni rang gi nye bar len pa tshogs pa tsam las te /
analyzed: yang la la ni rang gi nye bar len pa tshogs pa tsam las te /
translated: And some arise from the mere assemblage of their own appropriated aggregates.

original: mi sdod par skyed pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa las skyes ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi sdod par skyed pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa las skyes ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: They have the nature of arising from the assemblage of causes that give rise to them without delay.

original: rgyu rnams kyang kha cig ni yongs su 'gyur bar nye bar 'gro ba na 'bras bu nye bar skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang kha cig ni yongs su 'gyur bar nye bar 'gro ba na 'bras bu nye bar skyed par byed kyi /
translated: Some causes give rise to effects when they approach transformation.

original: tshogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: But not from the mere assemblage.

original: de dag ni brgyud bas rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la brten la /
analyzed: de dag ni brgyud bas rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha snyad la brten la /
translated: They are called causes indirectly.

original: yang kha cig ni phan tshun tshogs pa tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dag yin te /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni phan tshun tshogs pa tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dag yin te /
translated: And some give rise to effects from the mere mutual assemblage.

original: de dag ni rgyu dngos su tha snyad gdags pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu dngos su tha snyad gdags pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang yod do //
translated: They are called actual causes. They have the nature of giving rise to effects in that way.

original: 'di nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ngo bo nyid tha dad pa rnams kyi thug pa med pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ngo bo nyid tha dad pa rnams kyi thug pa med pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it completely eliminates the infinite regress of causes and effects that are different in nature.

original: de la lhan cig byed pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi tshe lhan cig byed pa dag las rgyun gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de la lhan cig byed pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi tshe lhan cig byed pa dag las rgyun gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs pa la brten nas /
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúThe first moment of the effect arises from the assemblage of causes and conditions.‚ÄùüîΩWhen the first moment of the effect arises from the assemblage of causes and conditions, it is the cause of the subsequent effect.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dang po gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dag las mi skye'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dang po gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dag las mi skye'o //
translated: The first moment of the effect that is produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions does not arise from the distinctive features produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: 'dir chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi dpe ni /
analyzed: 'dir chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi dpe ni /
translated: Here, an example of a dissimilar case is

original: 'bras bu mjug thogs can lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: 'bras bu mjug thogs can lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin te ;
translated: ‚Äúlike the effect that immediately follows.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rgyu'i chos 'bras bu mjug thogs can lhan cig byed pa dag las rgyun gyi khyad par 'byung ba la brten nas 'bras bu bskyed pa ltar 'di ni de lta bu ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu'i chos 'bras bu mjug thogs can lhan cig byed pa dag las rgyun gyi khyad par 'byung ba la brten nas 'bras bu bskyed pa ltar 'di ni de lta bu ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not like the case of a cause that produces an effect in dependence on a special transformation of the continuum that arises from the assemblage of its simultaneous conditions.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di chos mthun pa can nyid kyi dpe kho na yin te /üîΩji ltar rgyu'i tshogs 'bras bu bu mjug thogs pa skad cig ma de la byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa dag gis phan ma btags pa'i ngo bo kho nas 'bras bu skyed pa de bzhin du khyad par dang po yang phan tshun phan ma btags pa'i ngo bo
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'di chos mthun pa can nyid kyi dpe kho na yin te / ji ltar rgyu'i tshogs 'bras bu bu mjug thogs pa skad cig ma de la byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa dag gis phan ma btags pa'i ngo bo kho nas 'bras bu skyed pa de bzhin du khyad par dang po yang phan tshun phan ma btags pa'i ngo bo
translated: Or, alternatively, this is just an example that illustrates a similarity:

original: nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dag las skye'o //üîΩrgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa ni rgyun gyis phan @142a * //
analyzed: nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dag las skye'o // rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa ni rgyun gyis phan @142a * //
translated: Just as the assemblage of causes produces an effect in the moment that the effect is about to arise, without being assisted by its simultaneous conditions, in the same way, the first transformation arises from its simultaneous conditions without being assisted by each other.

original: 'dogs pa la ltos pa'o //üîΩ'bras bu'i rgyu ni 'bras bu'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dogs pa la ltos pa'o // 'bras bu'i rgyu ni 'bras bu'i rgyu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin dependence on the assistance of the continuum‚Äù means in dependence on the assistance of the continuum.üîΩThe cause of the effect is the cause of the effect.

original: de skye ba ni 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba'o //
analyzed: de skye ba ni 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of that is the arising of the cause of the effect.

original: de ni rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa yang yin la /
translated: It is also related to the benefit that is conferred by a continuum.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu skye ba yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: And it is the cause of the effect that is generated.

original: 'di la lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dag las skye ba yod pas 'di ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par las skye ba can no //
analyzed: 'di la lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dag las skye ba yod pas 'di ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par las skye ba can no //
translated: Since there is generation from the differences that are made by the cooperating causes in this case, this is generation from the differences that are made by the cooperating causes.

original: gang las 'bras bu mjug thogs yod pa de ni 'bras bu mjug thogs can te /
analyzed: gang las 'bras bu mjug thogs yod pa de ni 'bras bu mjug thogs can te /
translated: That which has an effect that is immediately antecedent is one that has an effect that is immediately antecedent.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'jug pas na de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'jug pas na de lta bu'o //
translated: It is like that because it functions in that way.

original: yang de las gzhan pa'i sgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de las gzhan pa'i sgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the establishment that is different from that?

original: de'i phyir / de phan chad kyi khyad par gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de phan chad kyi khyad par gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúWhatever differences there are after that‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par dang po phan chad kyi khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dag las skye ste /
analyzed: khyad par dang po phan chad kyi khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par dag las skye ste /
translated: Whatever differences there are after the first difference are generated from the differences that are made by the cooperating causes.

original: 'di dag la de lta bu las skye ba yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dag la de lta bu las skye ba yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúarising‚Äù is applied to these because they arise from such and such causes.

original: 'di ni sa la sogs pa skad cig ma brgyud de 'byung ba thams cad so sor blos gcig pa nyid du bzung ba rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sa la sogs pa skad cig ma brgyud de 'byung ba thams cad so sor blos gcig pa nyid du bzung ba rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs par shes par bya ste /
translated: The arising of all things that occur in a succession of moments, such as earth, etc., is to be understood as mutually assisting each other, even though they are apprehended as being the same.

original: 'di ltar sa bon skad cig ma brgyud de 'byung ba la zlos gcig pa nyid du yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon skad cig ma brgyud de 'byung ba la zlos gcig pa nyid du yongs su bzung nas /
translated: Thus, the arising of a seed in a succession of moments is apprehended as being the same.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma dag las dang chu la sogs pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin par blta bar bya la /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma dag las dang chu la sogs pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin par blta bar bya la /
translated: It is to be seen that the subsequent moments assist the seed in relation to the earth, water, etc.

original: de bzhin du sa dang chu la sogs pa yang so so'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma dag la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang chu la sogs pa yang so so'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma dag la /
translated: In the same way, the subsequent moments of earth, water, etc.,

original: de las gzhan pa dag las phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa blta bar bya'o //üîΩyang ci'i phyir khyad par dang po yang gzhan du skye la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag las phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa blta bar bya'o // yang ci'i phyir khyad par dang po yang gzhan du skye la /
translated: are to be seen as assisting the other elements in relation to the other elements.üîΩWhy does the first distinctive feature arise from another?

original: de las gzhan pa dag kyang gzhan du skye zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag kyang gzhan du skye zhe na /
translated: Why do the others arise from another?

original: de'i phyir / de dang de dag ni de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dang de dag ni de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThose are its intrinsic natures, etc.‚Äù

original: khyad par dang po ni phan ma btags pa'i lhan cig byed pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la de las gzhan pa'i khyad par dag phan tshun phan gdags pa'i lhan cig byed pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dag yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang po ni phan ma btags pa'i lhan cig byed pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la de las gzhan pa'i khyad par dag phan tshun phan gdags pa'i lhan cig byed pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid dag yin no //
translated: The first difference is the intrinsic nature that is to be generated by the nonbenefiting co-operating causes, and the other differences are the intrinsic natures that are to be generated by the mutually benefiting co-operating causes.

original: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Intrinsic nature is intrinsic reality.

original: de dang de dag la rang bzhin de yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dang de dag la rang bzhin de yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Since those have that intrinsic nature, the words are to be connected in this way.

original: de'i phyir gong du thug pa med par brjod pa gang yin pa de yang 'di kho nas bkag @142b par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gong du thug pa med par brjod pa gang yin pa de yang 'di kho nas bkag @142b par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the previously mentioned infinite regress should be seen as refuted by this alone.

original: de la 'di snyam du ji ltar khyad par dang po khyad par du gyur pa ma skyes pa'i lhan cig byed pa dag gis skyed ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ji ltar khyad par dang po khyad par du gyur pa ma skyes pa'i lhan cig byed pa dag gis skyed ba de bzhin du /
translated: If you think in this way, ‚ÄúJust as the first difference is generated by the non-arisen co-operating causes that are the differences,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang khyad par du gyur pa ma bskyed pa kho nar 'bras bu bskyed pa la 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang khyad par du gyur pa ma bskyed pa kho nar 'bras bu bskyed pa la 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But even those that are not momentary would generate an effect without generating a special quality.

original: de'i phyir / gal te khyad par dang po'i rgyu bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te khyad par dang po'i rgyu bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúIf it is like the cause of the first special quality,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te khyad par dang po bzhin du dngos po skad cig ma yin la lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi khyad par du gyur pa ma bskyed pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩskyed pa ni rag ste /
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang po bzhin du dngos po skad cig ma yin la lhan cig byed pa rnams kyi khyad par du gyur pa ma bskyed pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhe na / skyed pa ni rag ste /
translated: If, like the first special quality, things are momentary, then even without generating a special quality of the co-arisen causes, an effect would be generated.

original: 'gog par byed pa su zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'gog par byed pa su zhig yod de /
translated: If it is generated, then what prevents it?

original: dngos po skad cig ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo de ci'i phyir /üîΩmi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can zhig gam /
analyzed: dngos po skad cig ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo de ci'i phyir / mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can zhig gam /
translated: Why does that thing that is not momentary not remain?üîΩIs it that it is generated as something that does not remain?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes 'di ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes 'di ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Or is it not?

original: gal te mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can yin na ni /
translated: If it is generated as something that does not remain,üîΩthen it would not remain for a second moment.

original: de'i tshe so sor byed pa srid pas rtag par 'dod pa de 'ba' zhig gis kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes de skad du bshad zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe so sor byed pa srid pas rtag par 'dod pa de 'ba' zhig gis kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes de skad du bshad zin pa kho na'o //
translated: At that time, since it is possible that each one acts, then even by just the one that is asserted to be permanent, the effect would be generated.

original: rnam par brtag pa gnyis pa la nyes pa /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa gnyis pa la nyes pa /
translated: In the second analysis, the error is

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is not of the nature of that, then at that time, even though it is a co-operator, it is not a cause.

original: gal te mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni /
translated: If it is not of the nature of generating without abiding,

original: de'i tshe 'di lhan cig byed pa dang / lhan cig kyang byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di lhan cig byed pa dang / lhan cig kyang byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: then at that time, even though it is a co-operator, it is not a cause.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude,üîΩhe says,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i rgyu dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i rgyu dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: with regard to causes that are not momentary,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par brtag pa gnyi ga la yang nyes pa yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par brtag pa gnyi ga la yang nyes pa yod pa de'i phyir /
translated: because in both analyses in that way there is an error,

original: rgyu gang dag skad cig ma ma yin pa de dag ni 'ga' yang don gcig byed pas lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag skad cig ma ma yin pa de dag ni 'ga' yang don gcig byed pas lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges pa med do //
translated: there is no certainty that those causes that are not momentary are co-operators by producing a single effect.

original: 'o na khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the characteristic of arising is a distinction,

original: de'i phyir / rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then to respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúNor is it that they assist through a continuum,‚Äù and so on.

original: lhan cig pa nyid rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang rtag pa rnams la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: lhan cig pa nyid rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang rtag pa rnams la mi 'thad de /
translated: That which is coexistent and is the characteristic of arising as a distinction by way of assisting through a continuum is also untenable for permanent things.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi lhan cig byed pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi lhan cig byed pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, they have no co-producing causes at all.

original: ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig gis kyang bskyed par 'gyur bas nyes pa de so na 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig gis kyang bskyed par 'gyur bas nyes pa de so na 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: Why is it that they are not produced by the permanent ones alone? That fault remains.

original: @143a * // yang ci'i phyir dngos po rtag pa yang gdon mi za bar lhan cig byed pa dag las khyad par bskyed do zhe na /
analyzed: @143a * // yang ci'i phyir dngos po rtag pa yang gdon mi za bar lhan cig byed pa dag las khyad par bskyed do zhe na /
translated: Again, why is it that a permanent thing necessarily produces a distinction from co-producing causes?

original: dngos po'i rgyun tshogs pa la gnas pa can no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyun tshogs pa la gnas pa can no //
translated: It is the continuum of things that is based on a collection.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
translated: To respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúFor the most part,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po'i rgyu lus can ni phan cher lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag gis khyad par bskyed pas 'bras bu skyes pa mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu lus can ni phan cher lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag gis khyad par bskyed pas 'bras bu skyes pa mthong ste /
translated: The cause of an entity is seen to generate an effect by producing a specific transformation through the power of the cooperative conditions.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyun lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyun lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the continuum of a seed.

original: de bzhin du gal te rgyu rtag par smra ba'i yang dngos po rtag par 'dod pa rkyen gzhan dag la ltos nas 'bras bu bskyed na de'i tshe gdon mi za bar de'i skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te rgyu rtag par smra ba'i yang dngos po rtag par 'dod pa rkyen gzhan dag la ltos nas 'bras bu bskyed na de'i tshe gdon mi za bar de'i skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, if the cause of a permanent entity is asserted to be permanent, and it generates an effect in dependence on other conditions, then at that time, without a doubt, another nature that generates it would occur.

original: phan gdags par bya ba yin dang ltos pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba yin dang ltos pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthat which is to be benefited‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which possesses dependence.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa ni cha shas 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni cha shas 'dus pa'o //
translated: An assemblage is a collection of parts.

original: 'di la tshogs pa la gnas pa'i ngang tshul yod pas /
analyzed: 'di la tshogs pa la gnas pa'i ngang tshul yod pas /
translated: Since it has the nature of abiding in an assemblage,

original: 'di ni tshogs pa la gnas pa can no //üîΩ'bras bu la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni tshogs pa la gnas pa can no // 'bras bu la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it possesses an assemblage.üîΩ‚ÄúIn dependence on an effect‚Äù means

original: phan gdags par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äúthat which is to be benefited.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir dngos po rtag pa la lhan cig byed pa dag las skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan skye bar klan ka btsal zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dngos po rtag pa la lhan cig byed pa dag las skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan skye bar klan ka btsal zhe na /
translated: Again, why is it that one should be criticized for saying that a permanent thing generates an essential nature that is a co-originator?

original: skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon yang yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon yang yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf the essential nature that generates existed previously, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rtag pa la skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon yang yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa la skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon yang yod na ni /
translated: If the essential nature that generates existed previously in a permanent thing,

original: de'i tshe mi skyed pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi skyed pa mi rung ste /
translated: then at that time it would be illogical that it does not generate,

original: sngon yang bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon yang bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it would have generated previously.

original: de ltar lhan cig byed pa'i zhar la brgyud de 'ongs pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar lhan cig byed pa'i zhar la brgyud de 'ongs pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having completed the digression on co-originators,

original: dkyus ma'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyus ma'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to conclude the main point,

original: de lta bas na gang gi bdag nyid gang yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi bdag nyid gang yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, that which is of such a nature, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sa bon la sogs pas ma nges so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su spang pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sa bon la sogs pas ma nges so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su spang pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because in this way the refutation that ‚Äúthe seed, etc. are not ascertained‚Äù is rejected, therefore,

original: dngos po gang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de yod pa tsam kho nas de lta bur 'gyur gyi /üîΩdang po yod par gyur nas phyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de yod pa tsam kho nas de lta bur 'gyur gyi / dang po yod par gyur nas phyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Whatever the intrinsic reality of a thing is, it becomes that just by the mere existence of that.

original: gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gal te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no // gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gal te /
translated: Having existed from the start, later it does not need to rely on the activity of another in order to establish its intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid kho nas mi gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid kho nas mi gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo zhig yin na ni /
translated: Therefore, if a thing has an intrinsic reality that does not endure,

original: de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dag cung zad kyang mi dgos so //
analyzed: de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dag cung zad kyang mi dgos so //
translated: then it does not need a cause of destruction at all.

original: 'on te 'dir rang bzhin @143b brtan pa can du khas len na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dir rang bzhin @143b brtan pa can du khas len na /
translated: But if you accept that it has a stable intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe dngos po gnas pa'i chos can la yang ngo bo nyid gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas 'jig pa'i rgyu dag shin tu mi dgos te rdo rje la shing srin gyis cung zad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po gnas pa'i chos can la yang ngo bo nyid gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas 'jig pa'i rgyu dag shin tu mi dgos te rdo rje la shing srin gyis cung zad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: then even though the thing has the property of enduring, it is not possible to make it another intrinsic reality, and so it definitely does not need a cause of destruction, just as a termite cannot do anything to a diamond.

original: 'di la mi gnas pa'i chos yod pas 'di ni mi gnas pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: 'di la mi gnas pa'i chos yod pas 'di ni mi gnas pa'i chos can te /
translated: Here, because it has the property of not enduring, it is one that has the property of not enduring.

original: g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning is, ‚Äúhaving the nature of movement.‚Äù

original: 'di la gnas pa'i chos yod pas 'di ni gnas pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa'i chos yod pas 'di ni gnas pa'i chos can te /
translated: It is a ‚Äúdharma of abiding‚Äù because it exists in that,

original: rang bzhin brtan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin brtan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning is, ‚Äúhaving a stable nature.‚Äù

original: de la 'di snyam du gnas pa'i chos can yang ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gnas pa'i chos can yang ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that a dharma of abiding is just a transformation of its own nature,

original: ci'i phyir / 'on te gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / 'on te gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIf it transforms into something else,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gzhan nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If it transforms into something else,

original: de ltar yin na ni rang bzhin rtag pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni rang bzhin rtag pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be permanent by nature.

original: de'i phyir chos 'gal ba gnyis 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'gal ba gnyis 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is not tenable for two contradictory properties to be related,

original: de nyid rtag pa snga ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid rtag pa snga ma ste /
translated: it is just that the former is permanent,

original: mi gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin par zad de /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin par zad de /
translated: and the latter is a dharma of nonabiding.

original: brtag pa de la yang lan btab zin to //
analyzed: brtag pa de la yang lan btab zin to //
translated: We have already responded to that idea.

original: de la 'di snyam du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang de kho na'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang de kho na'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the transformation itself is just the nature of that,

original: de'i phyir / pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: That which is different from the other is just different.

original: de la pha rol 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin la /
analyzed: de la pha rol 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin la /
translated: Here that which is different from the cause of destruction of the other is just different.

original: gang zhig gzhan yin pa de ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan yin pa de ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs par 'gyur /
translated: But how could that which is different be designated as the nature of that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir / dngos po tha dad pa ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po tha dad pa ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Different things have the characteristic of different natures.

original: dngos po rnams tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: The difference of things has the characteristic of different natures.

original: 'dir gal te ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin na /
translated: Here if they have different natures,

original: ji ltar dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur /
translated: how could they not be different things?

original: de la 'di snyam du pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur pa gang yin pa ngo bo nyid gzhan yin du zad mod /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur pa gang yin pa ngo bo nyid gzhan yin du zad mod /
translated: But if you think that that which is different from another is a different intrinsic reality,

original: de lta yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: then what is the error in that?

original: de lta na dngos po snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, the former thing . . . ‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin la /
translated: If that which is different from another is just another,

original: de lta yin na dngos po rang bzhin brtan pa can snga ma gang yin pa de ni nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid la gnas pas de sus kyang gzhan du @144a * //üîΩ'gyur ba byas ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin na dngos po rang bzhin brtan pa can snga ma gang yin pa de ni nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid la gnas pas de sus kyang gzhan du @144a * // 'gyur ba byas ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: then in that case, the former thing that has a stable essence would remain in its reality without being destroyed, and no one could make it another.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams don med pa de'i so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams don med pa de'i so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the causes of destruction would remain purposeless.

original: zangs la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams kho na me la sogs pa las snyi ba nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan 'byung bar mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na ;
analyzed: zangs la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnams kho na me la sogs pa las snyi ba nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan 'byung bar mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na ;
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that the specific intrinsic reality of copper, etc., arises as another intrinsic reality, such as malleability, etc., from fire, etc.?

original: de'i phyir / 'dis ni zangs la sogs pa'i sgra ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dis ni zangs la sogs pa'i sgra ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúHere, the hardness of copper, etc., when heated by fire, etc.,‚Äù

original: pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba ngo bo nyid gzhan yin no zhes smos pa 'dis ni zangs kyi sra ba me dang nye na snyi ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba gsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba ngo bo nyid gzhan yin no zhes smos pa 'dis ni zangs kyi sra ba me dang nye na snyi ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba gsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and so on. This passage makes it clear that the hardness of copper, etc., when heated by fire, etc., is a different intrinsic nature.

original: sogs pa smos ba ni /
analyzed: sogs pa smos ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù

original: chu'i snyi ba lhags pa nye na sra ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba gsal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i snyi ba lhags pa nye na sra ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba gsal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: makes it clear that the hardness of water, etc., when frozen by cold, etc., is a different intrinsic nature.

original: ji ltar gsal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsal zhe na /
translated: How is this clear?

original: de'i phyir / de la yang snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la yang snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúAnd that previous‚Äù and so on.

original: zangs la sogs pa de la yang sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid snga ma gang yin pa de rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zangs la sogs pa de la yang sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid snga ma gang yin pa de rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That previous intrinsic nature, such as hardness, etc., of that copper, etc., is destroyed by its own intrinsic nature.

original: me la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang / zangs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu las snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan kho na zhig 'byung gi / gnas pa snga ma kho na'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: me la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang / zangs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu las snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan kho na zhig 'byung gi / gnas pa snga ma kho na'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: The nature of softness, etc. arises from the other conditions such as fire, and from the other causes that are the appropriated entities of the moment of copper, etc.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The prior state does not transform into something else.

original: yang pha rol pos brgal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang pha rol pos brgal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to respond to the opponent‚Äôs objection, he says,

original: de ni rang gi gnas pa'i chos can kho na yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni rang gi gnas pa'i chos can kho na yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a phenomenon that endures in its own state, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po de ni rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i chos can kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po de ni rang gi ngo bo gnas pa'i chos can kho na yin te /
translated: That entity is a phenomenon that endures in its own nature,

original: 'di ltar ji srid du 'jig pa'i rgyu nye bar ma gyur ba de srid du gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du 'jig pa'i rgyu nye bar ma gyur ba de srid du gnas so //
translated: because as long as the cause of destruction does not occur, it endures.

original: de lta bu de ni gzhan gyis 'jig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bu de ni gzhan gyis 'jig par 'gyur la /
translated: That which is like that is destroyed by another.

original: rgyu de yang ngo bo nyid gzhan med kyi /
analyzed: rgyu de yang ngo bo nyid gzhan med kyi /
translated: That cause also does not have another nature.

original: 'on kyang dngos po 'pho ba kho na 'jig pa zhes bya bas gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po 'pho ba kho na 'jig pa zhes bya bas gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: But the opponent‚Äôs position is that the mere passing away of a thing is called ‚Äúdestruction,‚Äù and it is not something else.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smras bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smras bas /
translated: The master responds:

original: lan 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lan 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is as follows.

original: smras pa / dag ba'i lan 'di ni rnam par brtag pa gnyis las mi 'da'o /
analyzed: smras pa / dag ba'i lan 'di ni rnam par brtag pa gnyis las mi 'da'o /
translated: The response is as follows: This response does not go beyond two alternatives.

original: rnam par brtag pa gnyis po de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa gnyis po de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate those two alternatives, he says:üîΩIs the thing permanent by its very essence?

original: ci dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: kye ci dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa zhig gam /
analyzed: kye ci dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa zhig gam /
translated: Oh, is the thing permanent by its very essence?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or is it not?

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from this?

original: brtag @144b par bya ba las sngar rtag par gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brtag @144b par bya ba las sngar rtag par gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Prior to being investigated, it is permanent.

original: de lta bur brtag par byas ba la /üîΩgal te sngar rtag par gyur nas /
analyzed: de lta bur brtag par byas ba la / gal te sngar rtag par gyur nas /
translated: If one investigates it in this way,üîΩif one says that it is permanent prior to being destroyed,

original: phyis 'jig pa'i rgyu dang nye na mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes smras na /
analyzed: phyis 'jig pa'i rgyu dang nye na mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes smras na /
translated: and later it becomes impermanent when it comes into contact with the cause of destruction,

original: de'i tshe / rtag par 'dod pa snga ma thams cad du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa tha dad pa can gyi dngos po gnyis su yang rab tu smra la /
analyzed: de'i tshe / rtag par 'dod pa snga ma thams cad du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa tha dad pa can gyi dngos po gnyis su yang rab tu smra la /
translated: At that time, you would also be advocating that all things that are asserted to be permanent are both permanent and impermanent and different.

original: rang gis 'jig pa dang mi 'jig par yang rab tu smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gis 'jig pa dang mi 'jig par yang rab tu smras pa yin no //
translated: You would also be advocating that they both disintegrate and do not disintegrate.

original: 'di la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag yod pas 'di ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa can gyi dngos po gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag yod pas 'di ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa can gyi dngos po gnyis so //
translated: Here, since both a permanent and an impermanent nature exist, this is a thing that is both permanent and impermanent and different.

original: 'di ltar rang gi gnas pa'i chos can gzhan las dngos po 'pho ba'i ngo bo 'jig pa yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi gnas pa'i chos can gzhan las dngos po 'pho ba'i ngo bo 'jig pa yin par 'dod la /
translated: Thus, since the disintegration of a thing that is characterized by its own enduring is asserted to be a different entity from it,

original: de yang de las gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid gnyis su khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de las gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid gnyis su khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and since it is not different from that, at that time you would be accepting two natures.

original: ji ltar rang gi 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa yin zhe na /
translated: How could it both disintegrate and not disintegrate?

original: bshad pa / gal te ngo bo nyid snga ma bdag nyid kyis 'jig pa yin na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te ngo bo nyid snga ma bdag nyid kyis 'jig pa yin na /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: If the former nature itself disintegrates,

original: de'i tshe 'di'i 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nas rang 'jig par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di'i 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nas rang 'jig par smras pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is said that it is destroyed by its own nature of destruction.

original: de lta na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa yin no //
translated: Even so, the cause of destruction is pointless.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid phyi ma gang yin pa de yang 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid phyi ma gang yin pa de yang 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is the nature generated by the cause of destruction is also the nature of destruction,

original: bdag nyid 'jig pas 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jig pas 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa yin no //
translated: it is pointless for the cause of destruction, since it is destroyed by itself.

original: 'on te ngo bo nyid snga ma 'jig pa'i dang can ma yin na de'i tshe yang bdag nyid kyis mi 'jig par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ngo bo nyid snga ma 'jig pa'i dang can ma yin na de'i tshe yang bdag nyid kyis mi 'jig par smras pa yin no //
translated: But if the former nature is not subject to destruction, then at that time it is said that it is not destroyed by itself.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude, he says,

original: de ltar na snga ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na snga ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, in the former case,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas na rtag par 'dod pa snga ma la gnyi ga ltar yang 'jig pa'i rgyu nus pa med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas na rtag par 'dod pa snga ma la gnyi ga ltar yang 'jig pa'i rgyu nus pa med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, in the manner explained, it is established that in the former case, which is asserted to be permanent, the cause of destruction is not capable in either way.

original: pha rol pos gcig la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis kyis nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol pos gcig la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis kyis nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: The opponent says that the error of being both permanent and impermanent is completely avoided in regard to the one.

original: sngar rtag par 'gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po sngar rtag par 'gyur nas /
analyzed: sngar rtag par 'gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po sngar rtag par 'gyur nas /
translated: To respond, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not that a thing that was previously permanent later becomes impermanent,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyis mi rtag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyis mi rtag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that a thing that was previously permanent later becomes impermanent.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni phyis kyang rtag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni phyis kyang rtag pa kho na'o //
translated: However, it is permanent later as well.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir 'di'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin pa de'i phyir 'di phyis mi @145a * //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi phyir 'di'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin pa de'i phyir 'di phyis mi @145a * //
translated: Here the reason is stated: ‚ÄúBecause it has a single nature.‚ÄùüîΩBecause it has a single nature, how could it later become impermanent?

original: rtag pa nyid ga la yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ga la yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the tenets says,

original: 'o na dngos po de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWell, that thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te dngos po 'di rang gi ngo bo 'jig pa dang ma 'brel mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'di rang gi ngo bo 'jig pa dang ma 'brel mi 'gyur na /
translated: If that thing were not devoid of the disintegration of its own entity,

original: 'o na 'jig pa zhes ji skad du bya /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig pa zhes ji skad du bya /
translated: then how could it be called ‚Äúdisintegrated‚Äù?

original: mi 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni thams cad du zhig pa nyid du rtag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni thams cad du zhig pa nyid du rtag par rig pa yin no //
translated: The intrinsic reality of the impermanent is always known to be destroyed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir / de'i ngo bo nyid dang 'jig pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i ngo bo nyid dang 'jig pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says: ‚ÄúIts intrinsic reality and destruction,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang 'jig pa 'di gnyis ni phan tshun gyi ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang 'jig pa 'di gnyis ni phan tshun gyi ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: These two, the intrinsic reality of the permanent and destruction, are mutually exclusive, because their characteristics are incompatible.

original: 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that the intrinsic reality of destruction and nondestruction are characteristics that are mutually exclusive and incompatible.

original: 'di gnyis la phan tshun gyi ngo bo yod pas 'di dag ni phan tshun gyi ngo bo can no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la phan tshun gyi ngo bo yod pas 'di dag ni phan tshun gyi ngo bo can no //
translated: Since these two have each other‚Äôs intrinsic reality, they have each other‚Äôs intrinsic reality.

original: phan tshun gyi ngo bo can ma yin pa ni phan tshun gyi ngo bo can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi ngo bo can ma yin pa ni phan tshun gyi ngo bo can ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which does not have each other‚Äôs intrinsic reality does not have each other‚Äôs intrinsic reality.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de'i phyir ro //
translated: Its intrinsic reality is just that. Therefore,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to conclude, it says:

original: de lta bas na 'di la 'jig pa yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la 'jig pa yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIf you assert that it is destroyed, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since that is the case,

original: nam yang rung ste rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa 'di 'jig par 'dod na /
analyzed: nam yang rung ste rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa 'di 'jig par 'dod na /
translated: if you assert that this permanent thing is destroyed at some point,

original: de'i tshe 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar 'gyur dgos so //
translated: then at that time it would have to be the very nature of this thing to be destroyed.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jig par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jig par mi rung ste /
translated: If it were not like that, it would not be suitable to be destroyed.

original: de lta na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa kho na'o zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa kho na'o zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: In that case, as was explained earlier, the cause of destruction would be pointless.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: To summarize,

original: des na dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa yin yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa yin yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúTherefore, even if things are destroyed by their very nature, etc.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /üîΩspyos pa'i tshul des na /
analyzed: ji skad du / spyos pa'i tshul des na /
translated: As it is said,üîΩ‚ÄúBy this method,

original: gal te dngos po 'jig pa'i ngang can yin yang rung /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'jig pa'i ngang can yin yang rung /
translated: whether things are by nature subject to destruction

original: 'on te 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin yang rung ste /
translated: or not subject to destruction,

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig pa'i rgyu dgos pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig pa'i rgyu dgos pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: in no case is there any need for a cause of destruction.‚Äù

original: dkyus ma'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyus ma'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: To summarize the main point,

original: de lta bas na dngos po 'jig pa la ltos pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po 'jig pa la ltos pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúSince things do not depend on cessation,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas 'jig pa'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas 'jig pa'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since, in the manner explained above, the cause of cessation is not tenable in any way,

original: dngos po ni 'jig par bya ba la cung zad kyang ltos pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'jig par bya ba la cung zad kyang ltos pa med do //
translated: things do not depend in the slightest on cessation.

original: de'i phyir 'jig par nges par grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig par nges par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, cessation is definitely established.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dag gang zhig @145b yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dag gang zhig @145b yod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Here the syllogism is: Whatever exists does not depend on another for its existence.

original: ltos pa med pa de dag ni de yod par nges pa dag yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa de dag ni de yod par nges pa dag yin te /
translated: Those that do not depend on another for their existence are ascertained to exist.

original: dper na 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rgyu'i tshogs tha ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rgyu'i tshogs tha ma lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the final collection of causes does not depend on another for the production of the effect.

original: dngos po yang 'jig par bya ba la ltos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po yang 'jig par bya ba la ltos pa med pa yin te /
translated: Things do not depend on cessation.

original: de lta bas na de yod par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yod par nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are ascertained to exist.

original: des ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is established by this?

original: gang yod pa de ni 'jig pa yang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni 'jig pa yang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhatever exists is also ceasing,‚Äù and so on.

original: de yod par grub na dngos po gang la la yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'jig pa yin la 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid log na thams cad du yod pa nyid ldog pas de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dag grub pa yin no //üîΩ'dir pha rol pos rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub par klan ka btsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod par grub na dngos po gang la la yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'jig pa yin la 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid log na thams cad du yod pa nyid ldog pas de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dag grub pa yin no // 'dir pha rol pos rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub par klan ka btsal ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is established that it exists, then it is certain that whatever exists is perishable. If the nature of destruction is refuted, then existence is refuted in all cases. Thus, the pervasion and the counter pervasion are established.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, in order to refute the opponent‚Äôs claim that the pervasion and the counter pervasion are not established, he says, ‚ÄúEven if it is intrinsically perishable,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yod pa kha cig 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin du chug na yang yod pa thams cad 'jig pa'i ngang can du 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di go ga las /
analyzed: gal te yod pa kha cig 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin du chug na yang yod pa thams cad 'jig pa'i ngang can du 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di go ga las /
translated: Even if it is the case that some things are intrinsically perishable because it is not tenable that they have a cause of destruction, it follows that all things that exist would be perishable.üîΩWhy is this?

original: de'i phyir la lar yod kyang 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir la lar yod kyang 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, some things that exist would not be perishable by nature.

original: yang dogs pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam na /
analyzed: yang dogs pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin snyam na /
translated: What is the cause of this doubt?

original: thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid thams cad yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid thams cad yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of all is all‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad rang gi ngo bo gcig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rang gi ngo bo gcig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of all things is not the same.

original: dper na yod pa nyid du 'dra yang /
analyzed: dper na yod pa nyid du 'dra yang /
translated: For example, although they are similar in existing,

original: kha cig ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: some are obstructive,

original: kha cig ni thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: and some are not obstructive.

original: bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: The same should be seen with respect to the visible and invisible, and so on.

original: de dang 'dra bar yod pa nyid du mtshungs kyang /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar yod pa nyid du mtshungs kyang /
translated: Although they are similar in existing in that way,

original: kha cig ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: some are perishable,

original: kha cig ni mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and some are imperishable.

original: de'i phyir ma khyab pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub bo zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma khyab pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub bo zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is not universal, the pervasion is not established,‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩgnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The proponent of the thesis says:

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not so, because we have presented a valid refutation.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúAre not momentary?‚Äù

original: gang zhig 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma 'dod pa de ni yod pa nyid du mi rung ngo //üîΩde'i phyir yod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma 'dod pa de ni yod pa nyid du mi rung ngo // de'i phyir yod pa yang yin la /
translated: If something is not accepted as having the nature of destruction, then it is not suitable to be existent.

original: rtag par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'khrul par ga @146a * //
analyzed: rtag par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'khrul par ga @146a * //
translated: Therefore, how could there be the error that something is both existent and permanent?

original: la 'gyur / ci'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: la 'gyur / ci'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does it follow that it is nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir / dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe definition of an entity,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar gang don byed nus pa de ni dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang don byed nus pa de ni dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which is able to perform a function is called an ‚Äúentity.‚Äù

original: 'o na dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well, then, what is the definition of a nonentity?

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúThat which is devoid of all ability,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig gang du yang nus pa med pa de ni dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang du yang nus pa med pa de ni dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is not able to do anything is called a ‚Äúnonentity.‚Äù

original: de la 'di snyam du skad cig ma ma yin pa yang don byed par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du skad cig ma ma yin pa yang don byed par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that even that which is not momentary performs a function,

original: de'i phyir / skad cig ma ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skad cig ma ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Nothing that is not momentaryüîΩperforms a function.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni gang du yang nus pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni gang du yang nus pa med do //
translated: That which is not momentary has no capacity for anything.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rim dang cig car dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of gradualness and simultaneity,‚Äù

original: rim dang cig car ma gtogs pa dus gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim dang cig car ma gtogs pa dus gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because apart from gradualness and simultaneity, there is no other time.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni /
translated: That which is not momentary

original: rim gyis don byed par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rim gyis don byed par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: is not tenable as gradual.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas rim gyis don byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas rim gyis don byed pa yin na /
translated: In that case, if it performs a function in dependence on its cooperating conditions,

original: rtag pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: it is gradual. But it has already been explained that a permanent thing does not depend on cooperating conditions.

original: de'i phyir 'dis cung zad bya ba gang yin pa de thams cad cig car byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis cung zad bya ba gang yin pa de thams cad cig car byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, whatever function it performs, it would perform all of that at once,

original: rim gyis ni ma yin no /
analyzed: rim gyis ni ma yin no /
translated: but not gradually.

original: cig car yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: cig car yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also not tenable that it is simultaneous.

original: 'di ltar bya ba thams cad cig car byas nas kyang skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba thams cad cig car byas nas kyang skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, having performed all actions simultaneously, it would also perform them in the second moment and so on.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par 'di'i bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa ni med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par 'di'i bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa ni med do //
translated: The cessation of the entity that performs its function in the second moment and so on does not exist.

original: lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not rely on coemergent conditions,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la bya ba bya dgos pa de thams cad kyang sngon kho na byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la bya ba bya dgos pa de thams cad kyang sngon kho na byed par 'gyur te /
translated: all that it must perform in the second moment and so on would be performed earlier.

original: de ltar na thug pa med pa'i 'khor lo la zhon pa'i rtag pa nyon mongs bdag nyid kyang khyab par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na thug pa med pa'i 'khor lo la zhon pa'i rtag pa nyon mongs bdag nyid kyang khyab par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the self would be permanent, riding the chariot of the wheel of endless activity, and it would also be pervasive.

original: 'bras bu lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'bras bu lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention the result?

original: de ltar 'khrul pa yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pa yongs su spangs nas /
translated: Having thus completely abandoned error,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to summarize,

original: de lta bas na gang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin pas khyab pa grub bo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin pas khyab pa grub bo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, because that which exists is momentary, it is established that it is pervaded by that.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas ji ltar yang 'khrul pa med pa de'i phyir gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas ji ltar yang 'khrul pa med pa de'i phyir gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad ni /
translated: Because, in the manner explained, there is no error whatsoever, therefore whatever exists, all of that is either a thing or a non-thing.

original: skad cig ma kho na yin pas khyab ba grub bo //
analyzed: skad cig ma kho na yin pas khyab ba grub bo //
translated: Because of the way that has been explained, there is no error whatsoever. Therefore, whatever exists is all pervaded by being momentary.

original: @146b rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: @146b rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the reason of nature is finished.

original: // /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: // /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the reason of effect,

original: don gzhan shes par bya ba la 'bras bu gtan tshigs yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan shes par bya ba la 'bras bu gtan tshigs yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIn order to understand a different object, the effect is the reason.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe don gzhan rtogs par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu kho na gtan tshigs su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe don gzhan rtogs par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu kho na gtan tshigs su brjod par bya'o //
translated: When one wishes to understand a different object, at that time the effect alone should be stated as the reason.

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan la ste /
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúA different object‚Äù means a different thing that is not included in the probandum.

original: dngos po gzhan tha dad pa gzhan kho na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan tha dad pa gzhan kho na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúA different thing‚Äù means a different thing that is separate.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni phan tshun zlog pa'i bye brag pas brtags pa'i chos gzhan shes pas byed pa yin par 'dod la ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni phan tshun zlog pa'i bye brag pas brtags pa'i chos gzhan shes pas byed pa yin par 'dod la ;
translated: The reason of essence is asserted to be the cause of understanding another phenomenon that is mutually exclusive.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni dngos po gzhan shes par byed pa yin pas khyab par yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni dngos po gzhan shes par byed pa yin pas khyab par yod do //
translated: The reason of effect is the cause of understanding another thing.

original: yang ci'i phyir don gzhan rtogs par bya ba la 'bras bu kho na gtan tshigs yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir don gzhan rtogs par bya ba la 'bras bu kho na gtan tshigs yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: Moreover, why is it that only the effect is asserted to be a reason for understanding another object?

original: gzhan yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not another?

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause there is no error.‚Äù

original: rgyu zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba don gzhan gang yin pa de dang 'bras bu kho nar lhan cig 'khrul pa med kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba don gzhan gang yin pa de dang 'bras bu kho nar lhan cig 'khrul pa med kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: The cause is the object to be established that is another object. Only the effect is not in error with it, but another is not.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pas 'bras bu kho na dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pas 'bras bu kho na dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related by the characteristic of arising from it, only the effect is related.

original: 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa la /
translated: Thus, the relation of the nature of that and arising from thatüîΩis the relation of the effect.

original: de la de'i bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: de la de'i bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin la /
translated: The relation of identity is the relation of natural evidence.

original: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The relation of origination is the relation of evidence by effect.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dang ma 'brel pa nyid kyi mi 'khrul ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dang ma 'brel pa nyid kyi mi 'khrul ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no nonerroneous evidence that is unrelated to something else.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /üîΩgal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar / gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Anticipating the opponent‚Äôs objection,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúIf the object of knowledge and the means of knowledge are the cause and effect, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas brtags shes par byed pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas brtags shes par byed pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the means of knowledge is that which causes the object of knowledge,

original: de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that the object of knowledge and the means of knowledge are in every case the same thing,

original: me'i spyi'i chos bzhin du khyad par gyi chos rnams kyang shes par bya ba yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: me'i spyi'i chos bzhin du khyad par gyi chos rnams kyang shes par bya ba yin par 'gyur la /
translated: because, like the general property of fire, the particular properties of fire are also objects of knowledge.

original: du ba'i yang khyad par gyi chos bzhin du spyi'i chos rnams kyang shes par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩme'i spyi'i chos me nyid dang rdzas nyid dang yod pa nyid dang shes @147a * //
analyzed: du ba'i yang khyad par gyi chos bzhin du spyi'i chos rnams kyang shes par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro // me'i spyi'i chos me nyid dang rdzas nyid dang yod pa nyid dang shes @147a * //
translated: And just as the particular qualities of smoke are known, so too would the general qualities be known.

original: bya nyid la sogs pa ni shes par bya ba yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: bya nyid la sogs pa ni shes par bya ba yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: The general qualities of fire‚Äîbeing fire, being a substance, being existent, being an object of knowledge, and so on‚Äîare asserted to be objects of knowledge.

original: khyad par gyi chos rtsva'i dang lo ma'i la sogs ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi chos rtsva'i dang lo ma'i la sogs ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But the particular qualities of fire‚Äîbeing grass, being leaves, and so on‚Äîare not.

original: du ba'i yang khyad par gyi chos du ba nyid dang sngo ba nyid dang / 'khyil ba nyid la sogs pa shes par byed pa yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: du ba'i yang khyad par gyi chos du ba nyid dang sngo ba nyid dang / 'khyil ba nyid la sogs pa shes par byed pa yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: And just as the particular qualities of smoke‚Äîbeing smoke, being blue, being coiled, and so on‚Äîare asserted to be objects of knowledge,

original: spyi'i chos rdzas nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang shes bya nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i chos rdzas nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang shes bya nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the general qualities of smoke‚Äîbeing a substance, being existent, being an object of knowledge, and so on‚Äîare not.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would they not be objects of knowledge and objects of knowledge in every way?

original: de'i phyir / rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIn every way, the object to be produced and the producer, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir du ba dang mes rnam pa thams cad du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ba dang mes rnam pa thams cad du /
translated: Because smoke is produced by fire in every way

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi chos dag gis bskyed par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi chos dag gis bskyed par bya ba yin la /
translated: through general and specific properties,

original: me yang du ba rnam pa thams cad du spyi dang khyad par gyi chos dag gis skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: me yang du ba rnam pa thams cad du spyi dang khyad par gyi chos dag gis skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and fire is the producer of smoke in every way through general and specific properties, therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe object to be known and the knower would be established in every way.‚Äù

original: phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo, because it occurs even when that does not exist.‚Äù

original: de med par yang 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩme med kyang rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de med par yang 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / me med kyang rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung la /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúBecause it occurs even when that does not exist,‚Äù and so on.üîΩEven when fire does not exist, substance and so on occur.

original: me'i khyad par med kyang du ba tsam 'byung ngo //
analyzed: me'i khyad par med kyang du ba tsam 'byung ngo //
translated: Even when the particularities of fire do not exist, mere smoke occurs.

original: de'i phyir / me kho na las rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / me kho na las rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung la /
translated: Therefore,üîΩsubstance and so on arise from fire alone,üîΩand smoke arises from the specific features of fire alone.

original: me'i khyad par kho na las du ba tsam du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me'i khyad par kho na las du ba tsam du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no such certainty,

original: de skad smras pa'i nyes par thal ba med de /
analyzed: de skad smras pa'i nyes par thal ba med de /
translated: the consequence of the fault of the statement is not entailed.

original: 'di ltar me las du ba zhes bya ba'i rdzas 'byung gi / chu zhes bya ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar me las du ba zhes bya ba'i rdzas 'byung gi / chu zhes bya ba ni ma yin la /
translated: In this way, the substance called ‚Äúsmoke‚Äù arises from fire, but not from that called ‚Äúwater.‚Äù

original: rtsva'i me las du ba 'ga' kho na zhig 'byung gi / thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsva'i me las du ba 'ga' kho na zhig 'byung gi / thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: And from the fire of grass, only some smoke arises, but not all.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas /
translated: The summary

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gis shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gis shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to analyze the object of knowledge and the means of knowledge through the probandum and the proof,

original: de lta bas na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, the nature of the cause . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa ni med pa de'i phyir rgyu las rnam par gnas pa'i chos ji snyed cig med par 'bras bu mi 'byung ba de snyed cig na rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa ni med pa de'i phyir rgyu las rnam par gnas pa'i chos ji snyed cig med par 'bras bu mi 'byung ba de snyed cig na rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the entity that is the effect and the entity that is the cause do not exist in any way, therefore, to the extent that effects do not arise without as many entities as there are that are established from causes, to that extent, those are causes, but not others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @147b smos te /
