analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @147b smos te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause they are ascertained as its effects.

original: de dag kho na'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dag kho na'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because there is a determination such as, ‚ÄúThis is the effect of just those.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar spyi'i chos rnams kho na'i 'bras bu du ba yin no zhes nges par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi'i chos rnams kho na'i 'bras bu du ba yin no zhes nges par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that smoke is the effect of just those general properties.

original: de ltar re zhig bsgrub par bya bar gtogs pa'i cha dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bsgrub par bya bar gtogs pa'i cha dpyad pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the portion that is the object to be established has been analyzed.

original: bsgrub par gtogs pa'i cha dpyad par bya ba'i phyir gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsgrub par gtogs pa'i cha dpyad par bya ba'i phyir gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to analyze the part that is to be accomplished, he says, ‚ÄúThose that are phenomena that do not occur when those do not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu yang de'i chos /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de'i chos /
translated: The effect is also a phenomenon of that.

original: gang dag rgyur gtogs pa'i chos dag med na mi 'byung ba'i chos de dag nyid kyis shes par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag rgyur gtogs pa'i chos dag med na mi 'byung ba'i chos de dag nyid kyis shes par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those phenomena that are effects should be understood as being phenomena that do not occur when those phenomena that are causes do not exist.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par gyi chos rnams rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos rnams med na mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par gyi chos rnams rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos rnams med na mi 'byung ste /
translated: The particular phenomena that are effects do not occur when the general phenomena that are causes do not exist.

original: de lta bas na de dag nyid shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag nyid shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, those are the things that are to be known and the things that cause knowledge.

original: yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Again, anticipating an opportunity for others to object, he says,

original: gal te cha shas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te cha shas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that it is by part,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te rgyur gtogs ba'i spyi'i chos kho na dag med par 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par gyi chos rnams mi 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyur gtogs ba'i spyi'i chos kho na dag med par 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par gyi chos rnams mi 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If the particular qualities that are included among the effects do not occur without the general qualities that are included among the causes,

original: de lta na ni 'o na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid du gyur to //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid du gyur to //
translated: then in that case, the particular qualities would be produced by the general qualities.

original: 'di ltar me'i khyad par gyi chos rnams kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i khyad par gyi chos rnams kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: In that case, the particular qualities of fire would not produce smoke,

original: du ba'i yang spyi'i chos rnams bskyed par bya ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: du ba'i yang spyi'i chos rnams bskyed par bya ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: and the general qualities of smoke would not be produced.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por ni 'dod do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por ni 'dod do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is that the particular qualities of fire produce smoke, and the general qualities of fire produce the general qualities of smoke.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / ma yin te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo, because the particular qualities that are produced by that . . .‚Äù

original: 'dir bdag nyid thams cad kho nas bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir bdag nyid thams cad kho nas bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
translated: Here, the object to be produced and the producer are the whole of the self,

original: chas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chas ni ma yin no //
translated: not a part.

original: shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos po ni /
translated: The object to be known and the knower are

original: shes pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: dependent on consciousness,

original: dngos po 'jug pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'jug pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not dependent on the engagement of the object.

original: 'di ltar gal te me'i khyad par gyi du ba'i khyad par bskyed pa gang yin pa de bzung bar nus na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te me'i khyad par gyi du ba'i khyad par bskyed pa gang yin pa de bzung bar nus na /
translated: Thus, if one can apprehend the production of a particular smoke by a particular fire,

original: de'i tshe me'i khyad par shes par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa nyid de /üîΩ'di ltar yang aa ka ru'i du ba mthong ba las aa @148a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe me'i khyad par shes par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa nyid de / 'di ltar yang aa ka ru'i du ba mthong ba las aa @148a * //
translated: then at that time, it is just the particular fire that is asserted to be the object to be known.

original: ka ru'i me rjes su dpag pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: ka ru'i me rjes su dpag pa mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, having seen the smoke of agaru, one sees the inference of the fire of agaru.

original: gal te spyi'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa /üîΩrtags kyi khyad par du bas khyad par du byas pa de lta bu de dag kyang bzung nus na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa / rtags kyi khyad par du bas khyad par du byas pa de lta bu de dag kyang bzung nus na /
translated: If the particular reason, the substance of generality, etc.,üîΩqualified by smoke, is apprehended,

original: de'i tshe de dag las kyang me rtogs par 'gyur bas 'dod ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag las kyang me rtogs par 'gyur bas 'dod ba kho na ste /
translated: then at that time, fire would be understood from that, so it is just what is desired.

original: gang zhig du ba la yod pa'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig du ba la yod pa'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a substance that exists in smoke.üîΩ

original: 'di na me yod do zhes smra na de'i rjes su dpag pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na me yod do zhes smra na de'i rjes su dpag pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúHere there is fire because there is smoke which is a substance,‚Äù then that is inference.

original: me'i khyad par des bskyed par bya ba ni /
analyzed: me'i khyad par des bskyed par bya ba ni /
translated: The particular of fire is that which is produced by that.

original: des bskyed par bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ni des bskyed par bya ba yang yin la /
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba'o // 'di ni des bskyed par bya ba yang yin la /
translated: That which is produced by that is produced by that.

original: khyad par yang yin pas des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: khyad par yang yin pas des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par te /
translated: Since it is that which is produced by that and it is a particular, it is the particular of that which is produced by that.

original: du ba la yod pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du ba la yod pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the particular of smoke.

original: de 'dzin pa ni des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ni des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of that is the apprehension of the particular of that which is produced by that.

original: rtags kyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: rtags kyi khyad par ni /
translated: The particular of the reason is

original: rtags khyad par can te /üîΩspyi gang dag la de'i khyad par bye brag yod pa de dag ni rtags kyi khyad par gyi bye brag can no //
analyzed: rtags khyad par can te / spyi gang dag la de'i khyad par bye brag yod pa de dag ni rtags kyi khyad par gyi bye brag can no //
translated: the particular of the reason.üîΩThose universals which have that particular as a specific instance are the particular of the reason.

original: gal te des bskyed pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa dang rtags kyi khyad par gyi bye brag can gyi spyi 'dzin na rjes su dpag par 'dod do//
analyzed: gal te des bskyed pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa dang rtags kyi khyad par gyi bye brag can gyi spyi 'dzin na rjes su dpag par 'dod do//
translated: If one apprehends the particular of that which is produced by that and the universal which is the particular of the reason, then it is inference.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Well then, when is it that one does not accept it?

original: khyad par can ma yin pa'i spyi brjod par 'dod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa'i spyi brjod par 'dod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhen one wishes to express a universal that is not a qualifier,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe khyad par can ma yin pa'i du ba brjod par 'dod pa dang / khyad par can ma yin pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa spyi dag brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyad par can ma yin pa'i du ba brjod par 'dod pa dang / khyad par can ma yin pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa spyi dag brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one wishes to express a universal that is not a qualifier, such as smoke, and one wishes to express universals that are not qualifiers, such as substance,

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par mi 'dod do //
translated: then one does not accept that it is inferred because it is mistaken.

original: 'di ltar me'i khyad par med par yang khyad par can ma yin pa'i du ba 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i khyad par med par yang khyad par can ma yin pa'i du ba 'byung la /
translated: Thus, even without a particular fire, a universal that is not a qualifier, smoke, arises.

original: me med par yang khyad par can ma yin pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: me med par yang khyad par can ma yin pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And even without fire, a universal that is not a qualifier, such as substance, arises.

original: de lta bas na gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúWhere there is smoke, there is fire‚Äù

original: 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag par rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag par rnam par gnas so //
translated: is a case of inferring a cause from an effect.

original: 'dir pha rol pos 'khrul ba gleng ba'i go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol pos 'khrul ba gleng ba'i go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Here, anticipating that the opponent will raise an objection about the mistake,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúIf one says that the universal is not different from the particular,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig res 'ga' 'ga' zhig las byung yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig res 'ga' 'ga' zhig las byung yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that some arise from some, etc.

original: gal te du ba 'ga' zhig dus res 'ga' me 'ga' zhig las byung du chug na yang /
analyzed: gal te du ba 'ga' zhig dus res 'ga' me 'ga' zhig las byung du chug na yang /
translated: If you say that some smoke arises from some fire,

original: du ba thams cad me la rag las te skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di go ga las /
analyzed: du ba thams cad me la rag las te skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di go ga las /
translated: how could you ascertain that all smoke arises in dependence on fire?

original: nges pa ma grub na /
analyzed: nges pa ma grub na /
translated: If you do not establish the pervasion,üîΩthen you do not establish the forward and reverse inclusions.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kho na mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kho na mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / ma yin te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: de las 'byung ba ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: No, because that which does not arise from it, etc.

original: gal te du ba mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid @148b ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te du ba mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid @148b ma yin par gyur na /
translated: If smoke did not have the nature of being generated by fire,

original: de'i tshe lan 'ga' yang me de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe lan 'ga' yang me de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would never arise from that fire.

original: brjod kyang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod kyang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Even if you say it does, it would not arise from it.

original: 'di la me de las 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pas 'di ni de las 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: 'di la me de las 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pas 'di ni de las 'byung ba can no //
translated: Since it has an essence that arises from fire, it is called ‚Äúarisen from that.‚Äù

original: de las 'byung ba can ma yin pas de las 'byung ba can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba can ma yin pas de las 'byung ba can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since it is not arisen from that, it is not arisen from that.

original: des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it does not have an essence that is generated by that.

original: ci du ba mes bskyed par bya ba yin pas me las 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci du ba mes bskyed par bya ba yin pas me las 'byung ste /
translated: Is smoke generated by fire and therefore arisen from fire

original: des na de skad du brjod dam zhe na /
analyzed: des na de skad du brjod dam zhe na /
translated: because it is said in that way?

original: de'i phyir / phan tshun ltos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / phan tshun ltos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain this, he says, ‚ÄúMutual dependence‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni phan tshun ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni phan tshun ltos pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the essence of the generator and the generated in cause and effect is mutual dependence.

original: 'di ltar du ba yang mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba yang mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Thus smoke is an effect that has the essence of being generated by fire.

original: me yang du bskyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: me yang du bskyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyur 'dod do //
translated: Fire is asserted to be the cause that has the essence of generating smoke.

original: phan tshun la ltos pa ni phan tshun ltos pa'o //üîΩbskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ni /
analyzed: phan tshun la ltos pa ni phan tshun ltos pa'o // bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMutual dependence‚Äù is dependence on each other.üîΩ‚ÄúThat which is to be produced and that which produces‚Äù areüîΩthe object to be produced and the producer.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag go / de dag ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag kyang yin la /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag go / de dag ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa dag kyang yin la /
translated: Since they are both that which is to be produced and that which produces,

original: ngo bo nyid dag kyang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dag kyang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: and they are also entities, the sentence is to be construed in this way.

original: gang dag la de dag gi mtshan nyid yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag la de dag gi mtshan nyid yod pa de dag ni /
translated: Those that have the characteristics of those are

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag go //
translated: the cause and effect that have the characteristics of that which is to be produced and that which produces.

original: gal te 'di gnyis kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid phan tshun ltos pa yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: gal te 'di gnyis kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid phan tshun ltos pa yin du chug na yang /
translated: Even if these two, that which is to be produced and that which produces,

original: des na ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: are mutually dependent, what is established by that?

original: 'de la gal te du ba me la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'de la gal te du ba me la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, he says, ‚ÄúIf smoke and fire, etc.,üîΩare mutually dependent, then what is established?‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de ltar gnas pa de la gal te du ba me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa spangs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de ltar gnas pa de la gal te du ba me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa spangs te /
translated: In this way, the entities of cause and effect remain.üîΩ

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs ba gzhan las kyang 'byung na ni /üîΩde'i tshe du ba me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs ba gzhan las kyang 'byung na ni / de'i tshe du ba me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas /
translated: If smoke were to arise from other things, such as the crown of Indra,üîΩwithout the assemblage of fire and so on, then smoke would not be produced

original: lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: by the assemblage of fire and so on, and therefore it would never arise from

original: dper na padma bzhin no //üîΩ'di ltar mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid me las 'byung ba bshad kyi /
analyzed: dper na padma bzhin no // 'di ltar mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid me las 'byung ba bshad kyi /
translated: that assemblage. It would be like a lotus growing in the sky.üîΩIn this way, it is said that that which is to be produced by fire arises from

original: des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: fire, but not that that which is not to be produced by fire arises from fire,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would be absurd.

original: gang zhig gang gis bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ni lan 'ga' yang de las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ni lan 'ga' yang de las mi 'byung ste /
translated: That which is not to be produced by something never arises from it, just

original: dper na me las padma @149a * //
analyzed: dper na me las padma @149a * //
translated: as a lotus does not arise from fire.

original: lta bu'o // khyod kyi lugs kyis kyang /
analyzed: lta bu'o // khyod kyi lugs kyis kyang /
translated: According to your system,

original: du ba ni me ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: du ba ni me ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Smoke is not the nature of what is produced by fire, because it is smoke. This is a nonobservation of a pervader.

original: de la 'di snyam du des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin ba 'di yang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo snyam du sems na /üîΩtshogs bas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin ba 'di yang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo snyam du sems na / tshogs bas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that even though it is not the nature of what is produced by that, it arises due to the power of the assembly,

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa des kyang du ba de lta bu de bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa des kyang du ba de lta bu de bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Even the assembly of that would not produce that smoke.

original: ci'i phyir / de bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / de bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why? Because it is not the nature of what is produced by that.

original: du ba bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the nature of what produces smoke.

original: gang gi tshe du ba gzhan las kyang 'byung ba de'i tshe me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa du bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe du ba gzhan las kyang 'byung ba de'i tshe me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa du bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: When smoke arises from something else, the assembly of fire and so on is not the nature of what produces smoke.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar du bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar du bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it produce smoke?

original: 'dir dper na /
analyzed: 'dir dper na /
translated: Here is an example.

original: tshogs pa gzhan bzhin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan bzhin te /
translated: Like other collections.

original: ji ltar chu la sogs pas du bskyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du 'dis kyang skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar chu la sogs pas du bskyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du 'dis kyang skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Just as fire and so on do not produce smoke, so this also does not produce.

original: de la 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du /
translated: If you think thus:

original: du ba ni mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: du ba ni mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin la /
translated: Smoke is the intrinsic reality of what is to be produced by fire,

original: gzhan gyis bskyed bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyed bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: and it is also the intrinsic reality of what is to be produced by other things.

original: de'i phyir / du ba ni de dang de ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / du ba ni de dang de ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Smoke is not the intrinsic reality of what is to be produced by that and what is not that.

original: du ba ni mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin la /üîΩbrgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: du ba ni mes bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin la / brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: Smoke is not suitable to be the intrinsic reality of what is to be produced by fire,

original: bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin par 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin par 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: and also the intrinsic reality of what is to be produced by Indra‚Äôs crown protrusion, and so on.

original: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de ma yin pa dag go //üîΩde dang de ma yin pa dag gis bskyed par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de ma yin pa dag go // de dang de ma yin pa dag gis bskyed par bya ba ni /
translated: That and not that are that and not that.

original: de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba ste /
translated: What is to be produced by that and not that is what is to be produced by that and not that.

original: de zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa rgyu'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa rgyu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cause, such as fire.

original: de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot that‚Äù refers to the head of Indra, etc.

original: ci'i phyir / rig pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / rig pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not known?

original: ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the identity of nature.‚Äù

original: du ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: du ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na /
translated: If smoke has an identical nature,üîΩhow could it be produced from that and not that?

original: de ji ltar de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur gal te de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin par gyur na nyes ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur gal te de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin par gyur na nyes ba ci yod ce na /
translated: If it were produced from that and not that because of having an identical nature, what would be wrong with that?

original: du ba dang du ba ma yin par bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ba dang du ba ma yin par bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the arising from the nature of smoke and non-smoke, etc.‚Äù

original: du bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'byung na ni /
analyzed: du bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'byung na ni /
translated: If it arises from the nature of smoke,

original: du ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: du ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: it would have the nature of smoke.

original: du ba ma yin par bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las byung na ni /
analyzed: du ba ma yin par bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las byung na ni /
translated: If it arises from the nature of non-smoke,

original: du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du @149b 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du @149b 'gyur ro ;
translated: it would have the nature of non-smoke.

original: / de'i phyir du ba dang du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bos du ba 'gal ba'i ngo bo nyid can du gyur to //
analyzed: / de'i phyir du ba dang du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bos du ba 'gal ba'i ngo bo nyid can du gyur to //
translated: Therefore, smoke and non-smoke have the nature of being mutually exclusive.

original: gal te du ba dang du ba ma yin par bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las skyes pa yin du chug kyang /
analyzed: gal te du ba dang du ba ma yin par bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las skyes pa yin du chug kyang /
translated: Even if it is the case that smoke arises from the nature of generating smoke and non-smoke,

original: 'on kyang du ba dang du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du go ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang du ba dang du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du go ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why then does it become the nature of smoke and non-smoke?

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'bras bu rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'bras bu rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe nature of effects is not made by the nature of causes.‚Äù

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis byas pa yin no //
translated: The nature of effects is not made by the nature of causes.

original: de'i phyir du ba dang du ba ma yin ba bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'byung na /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba dang du ba ma yin ba bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'byung na /
translated: Therefore, if smoke arises from the nature of generating smoke and non-smoke,

original: ji ltar du ba dang du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar du ba dang du ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: how could it not become the nature of smoke and non-smoke?

original: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis byas ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis byas ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the nature of effects is not made by the nature of causes,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir / rgyu la mi ltos na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu la mi ltos na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúEven if it does not depend on a cause, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rgyu'i ngo bo nyid la mi ltos na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rgyu'i ngo bo nyid la mi ltos na /
translated: If the nature of the effect does not depend on the nature of the cause,

original: de'i tshe rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that it would be causeless.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it were causeless,

original: yul dang dus dang rnam pa so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam pa so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be restricted to particular places, times, and types.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize,

original: de ltar na du ba skyed bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni me la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na du ba skyed bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni me la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThus, that which produces smoke is the particular collection of fire, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩgang zhig du bskyed par byed pa de ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i khyad par yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir / gang zhig du bskyed par byed pa de ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i khyad par yin la /
translated: Since that is the case,üîΩthat which produces smoke is the particular collection of fire, etc.

original: du ba yang me la sogs pa'i khyad par las byung ba gang yin ba de kho na yin par blta'o //
analyzed: du ba yang me la sogs pa'i khyad par las byung ba gang yin ba de kho na yin par blta'o //
translated: And smoke is just that which arises from the particularities of fire, etc.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na gang zhig tsha bar byed pa dang 'tshed par byed pa dang / du ba skyed par byed pa de ni me yin par grags la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na gang zhig tsha bar byed pa dang 'tshed par byed pa dang / du ba skyed par byed pa de ni me yin par grags la /
translated: Thus, in the world, that which burns, that which cooks, and that which produces smoke is known as fire.

original: gang zhig mes bskyed cing mig dag nas mchi ma 'dzag par byed pa dang / nag por byed pa dang / gre ba la gnod par byed pa ni du ba yin par grags so //
analyzed: gang zhig mes bskyed cing mig dag nas mchi ma 'dzag par byed pa dang / nag por byed pa dang / gre ba la gnod par byed pa ni du ba yin par grags so //
translated: That which is produced by fire, which causes tears to flow from the eyes, which makes things dark, and which harms the throat is known as smoke.

original: de ltar me dang du ba dag phan tshun ltos ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar me dang du ba dag phan tshun ltos ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, it has been shown that fire and smoke have an essence that is mutually dependent.

original: klan ka snga ma yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: klan ka snga ma yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to completely abandon the former objection,

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, cause and effect . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi ngo bo nyid nges pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi ngo bo nyid nges pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the nature of cause and effect is ascertained in the manner that has been explained,

original: rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: it is established that they do not arise from a dissimilar type.

original: gal te rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung bar ma gyur du chug na yang /
analyzed: gal te rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung bar ma gyur du chug na yang /
translated: Even if it were the case that they do not arise from a dissimilar type,

original: des na dngos su @150a * //
analyzed: des na dngos su @150a * //
translated: Therefore, the actualüîΩmeaning of the text is as follows.

original: ci zhig grub ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig grub ce na /
translated: Therefore, what is actually established?

original: de'i phyir / de lta bas na 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de lta bas na 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Hence, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, that which is called the effect . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba bkag pa de'i phyir 'bras bus rgyu 'khrul pa med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba bkag pa de'i phyir 'bras bus rgyu 'khrul pa med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Since it is thus that the arising from a heterogeneous cause is refuted, therefore it is established that the cause is not mistaken with regard to the effect.

original: de lta yin na yon tan ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na yon tan ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the benefit?

original: des rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩji skad du spros te bshad pa des rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'khrul pa med par grub na /
analyzed: des rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ji skad du spros te bshad pa des rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'khrul pa med par grub na /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf the nature of cause and effect is established . . .‚ÄùüîΩIf, by the extensive explanation, the nature of cause and effect is established without error, then the pervasion of the object to be known by the object that produces knowledge is established.

original: shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa bsam pa la du ba la sogs pa 'bras bu la me la sogs pa rgyus khyab pa grub pa yin no //üîΩ'dir gzhan gyi 'khrul pa kun du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa bsam pa la du ba la sogs pa 'bras bu la me la sogs pa rgyus khyab pa grub pa yin no // 'dir gzhan gyi 'khrul pa kun du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, smoke is pervaded by fire.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error of others here, he says, ‚ÄúEven if it is not heterogeneous . . .‚Äù

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong pa la ma gtogs pa rgyu rigs mi mthun pa las kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong pa la ma gtogs pa rgyu rigs mi mthun pa las kyang /
translated: But we see that some effects arise from causes that are not of a similar type.

original: 'bras bu cung zad 'byung ba mthong ste /üîΩde'i phyir 'khrul pa srid na /
analyzed: 'bras bu cung zad 'byung ba mthong ste / de'i phyir 'khrul pa srid na /
translated: For example, we see that a rice sprout arises from a rice seed, but we also see that a rice seedling arises from rice chaff, ashes, and so on.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu la rgyus khyab pa grub par 'gyur /üîΩ'khrul pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu la rgyus khyab pa grub par 'gyur / 'khrul pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, if error is possible, how could you establish that an effect is pervaded by a cause?

original: dper na ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that error is possible, he says, ‚ÄúFor example, we see that a rice seedling arises from rice chaff, ashes, and so on.‚Äù

original: sha lu ka rung gi sa bon las rab tu skye ba yang ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las skye ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: sha lu ka rung gi sa bon las rab tu skye ba yang ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las skye ba mthong ngo //
translated: We see that a rice seedling arises from a ≈õƒÅli rice seed, but we also see that a rice seedling arises from rice chaff, ashes, and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes

original: rva las 'dam bu dang ba lang gi spu dang / lug gi bal dag las rtsva d'ur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: rva las 'dam bu dang ba lang gi spu dang / lug gi bal dag las rtsva d'ur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o // grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: sugar cane from bamboo seeds, reeds from cow‚Äôs hair, and duk≈´la cloth from sheep‚Äôs wool.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that an effect arises from a cause that is not of a similar type.‚Äù

original: ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las sha lu ka la sogs ba 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa las sha lu ka la sogs ba 'byung ba ni /
translated: Because the seed, etc. is the cause of the sprout, etc.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.üîΩBut a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.üîΩTherefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.üîΩBut a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.üîΩTherefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.

original: gang gi phyir ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu kho na sha lu ka la sogs pa dang por 'byung ba de 'dra ba rnams kyi dang po'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa de'i phyir ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa rgyu
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu kho na sha lu ka la sogs pa dang por 'byung ba de 'dra ba rnams kyi dang po'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa de'i phyir ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa rgyu
translated: If it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.üîΩBut a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.

original: rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.

original: ci ste thams cad du rva las 'dam bu mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste thams cad du rva las 'dam bu mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: But a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.üîΩTherefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.

original: de'i phyir rgyun gyis 'byung na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'dam bu dang po nyid du 'byung ba'i rgyu ni rva kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun gyis 'byung na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dam bu dang po nyid du 'byung ba'i rgyu ni rva kho na yin no //
translated: But a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.üîΩTherefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.üîΩBut a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.üîΩTherefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.üîΩBut a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.üîΩTherefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.üîΩBut a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clod, etc.üîΩTherefore, the seed, etc. is not a cause of something dissimilar.üîΩIf it were, then a sprout, etc. would arise from a clod, etc.

original: de ltar byung ba phyis rgyun chags par 'byung ba ni rva las byung ba ma yin no //üîΩ'di skad du /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba phyis rgyun chags par 'byung ba ni rva las byung ba ma yin no //üîΩ'di skad du /
translated: But a sprout, etc. does not arise from a clo

original: 'dam bu rnams kyi dang po'i rgyu mtshan @150b ni rnam pa thams cad du rva kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'dam bu rnams kyi dang po'i rgyu mtshan @150b ni rnam pa thams cad du rva kho na yin la /
translated: The reason for the first of the reeds is exclusively the sprout.

original: phyis na de dag rigs mthun pa snga ma snga ma dag las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyis na de dag rigs mthun pa snga ma snga ma dag las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ste /
translated: Later, the subsequent ones arise from the former ones of the same type.

original: dper na du ba dang po ni me las nye bar 'byung la /üîΩde'i 'og rol gyi dus su 'byung ba skad cig ma rnams ni /
analyzed: dper na du ba dang po ni me las nye bar 'byung la / de'i 'og rol gyi dus su 'byung ba skad cig ma rnams ni /
translated: For example, the first smoke arises in dependence on fire.üîΩThe moments that occur later are not due to a reason of a homogeneous moment.

original: rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de ltar re zhig rgyu rigs mi mthun pa nyid bkag ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rgyu rigs mi mthun pa nyid bkag ba yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the cause is not of a different type.

original: da ni rigs mi mthun pa nyid khas blangs nas 'khrul pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rigs mi mthun pa nyid khas blangs nas 'khrul pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to completely eliminate error by accepting that it is of a different type,

original: yang na ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skyes pa can dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skyes pa can dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOr, the sprouts that arise from cow dung and something else,‚Äù and so on.

original: ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skyes pa'i sha lu ka dag rnam pa 'dra mod kyi /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skyes pa'i sha lu ka dag rnam pa 'dra mod kyi /
translated: The sprouts that arise from cow dung and something else are similar in appearance.

original: 'on kyang de gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid ro dang / nus pa dag rnam par smin pa tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid ro dang / nus pa dag rnam par smin pa tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: But the nature of these two, the taste and the potency, is certainly different.

original: gang dag ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skye ba yod pa de dag ni ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skye ba can dag go //
analyzed: gang dag ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skye ba yod pa de dag ni ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skye ba can dag go //
translated: Those that arise from cow dung and something else are those that arise from cow dung and something else.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúsomething else‚Äù

original: rang gi sa bon yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: refers to its own seed.

original: rnam pa 'dra ba rnams ngo bo nyid kyang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dra ba rnams ngo bo nyid kyang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Don‚Äôt the things that are similar in appearance also have a similar nature?

original: dngos po rnams kyi rnam par mtshungs pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rnam par mtshungs pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe similarity of things, etc.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa dag gis thams cad ngo bo nyid mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa 'di ni med do //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa dag gis thams cad ngo bo nyid mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa 'di ni med do //
translated: There is no certainty that everything that is similar in appearance also has a similar nature.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of that is the cause of a single nature.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a cause?

original: rnam pa tha dad pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven those that are not different in aspect‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar dngos po kha cig rnam pa mtshungs kyang khyad par 'ga' zhig gis rigs tha dad pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po kha cig rnam pa mtshungs kyang khyad par 'ga' zhig gis rigs tha dad pa mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, some things are seen to be different in type due to some difference in their aspects, even though they are similar in other respects.

original: 'di ltar la la la mi me tog las tha dad par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar la la la mi me tog las tha dad par mthong ste /
translated: For example, some see a man as different from a flower.

original: shur pa ka me tog sngon po dang / cig shos can dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: shur pa ka me tog sngon po dang / cig shos can dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sh≈´rpƒÅraka is a blue flower, and the other is not.

original: la la la ni 'bras bu las te kar ko ta 'bras bu med pa dang cig shos lta bu'o //üîΩla la la ni ro las te nags kyi dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: la la la ni 'bras bu las te kar ko ta 'bras bu med pa dang cig shos lta bu'o // la la la ni ro las te nags kyi dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon dag lta bu'o //
translated: Some see him as different from the fruit, like a karaka tree without fruit and the other.üîΩSome see him as different from the taste, like a forest and the other, the royal emblic myrobalan.

original: la la la ni dri las te shing ljon pa dang cig shos las skye ba'i tsam pa ka dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: la la la ni dri las te shing ljon pa dang cig shos las skye ba'i tsam pa ka dag lta bu'o //
translated: Some see him as different from the smell, like a tree and the other, the campaka that grows from the hair.

original: la la la ni mthu las te reg pa dang spyad pas 'khru ba'i aa ru ra dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: la la la ni mthu las te reg pa dang spyad pas 'khru ba'i aa ru ra dag lta bu'o //
translated: Some see him as different from the power, like the myrobalan that is rubbed with oil and the other that is not.

original: yang ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skye ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skye ba dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with saying that the two, the product of cow dung and the product of clay, are of the same nature?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: tshogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las @151a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshogs pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las @151a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: From a collection of causes of different characteristics

original: gal te rgyu'i tshogs mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las kyang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa khas len na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i tshogs mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las kyang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa khas len na /
translated: If you accept that from a collection of causes of different characteristics there arises an effect of the same nature, then

original: de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa dag las 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag mi 'grub bo //
translated: at that time, from causes that are not different, an effect that is different and not different is not established.

original: de'i phyir khams gsum gyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khams gsum gyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the difference and non-difference of the three realms would be without a basis.

original: gal te rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las 'bras bu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa 'byung na rgyu'i tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i tha dad par mi 'gyur du chug na yang /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las 'bras bu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa 'byung na rgyu'i tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i tha dad par mi 'gyur du chug na yang /
translated: If from a cause of different characteristics an effect of the same nature arises, then although the difference of the effect from the difference of the cause is not established,

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa las 'byung ba go ci'i phyir tha dad par ma yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin pa las 'byung ba go ci'i phyir tha dad par ma yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt it arise from that which is not different?

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar tha dad pa las tha dad pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi tshe rgyu tha dad ba las 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'grub pa de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar tha dad pa las tha dad pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi tshe rgyu tha dad ba las 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'grub pa de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa las kyang /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúBecause that which is different does not arise from that which is different,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ma yin pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ma yin pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: When a different effect is not established from a different cause, then an effect that is not different is not established from a cause that is not different.

original: yang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa de dag rgyu med pa can yin na yang nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa de dag rgyu med pa can yin na yang nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: Again, if those that are different and not different are causeless, what is wrong with that?

original: de'i phyir / de la ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúApart from those two,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa kho nar zad kyi /
analyzed: dngos po ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa kho nar zad kyi /
translated: Things are just different and not different.

original: de la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other thing apart from those two.

original: gal te de gnyis rgyu med pa can yin na ;
analyzed: gal te de gnyis rgyu med pa can yin na ;
translated: If those two are causeless,

original: de'i tshe dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, all things would be causeless.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid gcig yin na ni dngos po rtag tu yod pa'am med pa zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid gcig yin na ni dngos po rtag tu yod pa'am med pa zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were causeless, they would either be eternally existent or eternally nonexistent.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su /
translated: Here, he states the reason:

original: ltos par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ltos par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because there is no dependence.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: dngos po rnams ni ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: because things are dependent.

original: dngos po rnams kyi res 'ga' ba gang yin pa 'di ni ltos par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi res 'ga' ba gang yin pa 'di ni ltos par byas pa yin te /
translated: That which is occasional for things is dependent.

original: 'di ltar de dag cung zad cig la ltos na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag cung zad cig la ltos na /
translated: Thus, if they depend on something,

original: dus gzhan du shol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan du shol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they are postponed to another time.

original: res 'ga' yod pa ni res 'ga' ba dag ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' yod pa ni res 'ga' ba dag ste /
translated: That which exists occasionally is occasional.

original: res 'ga' ba smos ba ni nye bar mtshon par zad pas yul dang ngo bo nyid so sor nges pa yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba smos ba ni nye bar mtshon par zad pas yul dang ngo bo nyid so sor nges pa yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Since the mention of the occasional is merely an illustration, the restriction of the object and the nature should also be understood.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod la /
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod la /
translated: This is what he means: If the cause exists, the effect exists.

original: rgyu med na med pa de bzhin du rgyu tha dad bas /
analyzed: rgyu med na med pa de bzhin du rgyu tha dad bas /
translated: If there is no cause, there is no effect.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu tha dad la tha dad pa ma yin na tha dad pa ma yin par gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad la tha dad pa ma yin na tha dad pa ma yin par gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so //
translated: Just as there is no effect if there is no cause, in the same way, if there is no difference in the effect, there must be no difference in the cause.üîΩTo prove another reason, he says, ‚ÄúThe application of proofs to the probandum, etc.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gzhan bsgrub par bya ba dag la sgrub ba te bar sbyor @151b ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan bsgrub par bya ba dag la sgrub ba te bar sbyor @151b ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The application of proofs to the probandum, etc.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid yin no //
translated: would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dag la sgrub pa rnams kyi sbyor ba so sor nges pa /üîΩnas kyi myu gu la nas kho na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dag la sgrub pa rnams kyi sbyor ba so sor nges pa / nas kyi myu gu la nas kho na /
translated: The application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.

original: s'a lu'i myu gu rnams kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur //üîΩci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩrgyu'i nus pa so sor nges na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te rgyu rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa dag yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu rnams kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur // ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na / rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te rgyu rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa dag yin na de'i tshe /
translated: The application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.

original: 'ga' zhig 'ga' sgrub par byed pa gzung bar rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'ga' sgrub par byed pa gzung bar rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific power in the cause.üîΩThe application of proofs to the probandum would not be possible if there were no specific

original: ci'i phyir gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not different?

original: de kho na de la nus pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de kho na de la nus pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it has the power over that reality,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar nas kyi sa bon kho na nas kyi myu gu la nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar nas kyi sa bon kho na nas kyi myu gu la nus kyi /
translated: Thus, only a barley seed has the power over a barley sprout,

original: s'a lu'i sa bon ni ma yin no //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon ni ma yin no //
translated: but not a rice seed.

original: yang ci'i phyir de'i tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu kho na de la nus kyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de'i tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu kho na de la nus kyi /
translated: Again, why is it that only the cause called ‚Äúits collection‚Äù has the power over it,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not another?

original: de'i phyir / de gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause those two,‚Äù etc.

original: s'a lu dang nas kyi sa bon de dag ni s'a lu dang nas kyi myu gu skyed par byed pa nyid kyis tha dad par rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: s'a lu dang nas kyi sa bon de dag ni s'a lu dang nas kyi myu gu skyed par byed pa nyid kyis tha dad par rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rice and barley seeds are distinct, because they exist as different in the production of the rice and barley sprouts.

original: de la 'di snyam du gal te mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las kyang skye bar 'gyur na 'gyur du zad mod /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gal te mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las kyang skye bar 'gyur na 'gyur du zad mod /
translated: If you think that even though they are different in characteristics, they are still produced,

original: nyes ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: nyes ba ci yod ce na /
translated: what is the problem?

original: de bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is produced from a nature and characteristics that are different,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te du ba skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa /
analyzed: gal te du ba skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa /
translated: If you accept that smoke arises from the essence or nature of something that is not fire,

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo las kyang du ba 'byung ba khas len na /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo las kyang du ba 'byung ba khas len na /
translated: then smoke would arise even from the head of Indra.

original: de'i tshe me kho na du ba skyed par nus so zhes bya ba'i nus pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe me kho na du ba skyed par nus so zhes bya ba'i nus pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, this capacity, ‚Äúonly fire has the ability to produce smoke,‚Äù would not exist.

original: nges pa med na ni /
analyzed: nges pa med na ni /
translated: If there is no certainty,

original: du ba gang yang rung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba gang yang rung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: smoke would arise from anything at all.

original: de lta yin na ni dngos po thams cad gang yang rung ba las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni dngos po thams cad gang yang rung ba las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, anything at all would arise from anything at all.

original: de la 'di snyam du gzhan yang de skyed par nus su zad mod /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gzhan yang de skyed par nus su zad mod /
translated: If you think that although something else is able to produce it,

original: kho bo la gnod pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: kho bo la gnod pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: what harm is done to me?

original: de'i phyir / de skyed par nus par mtshungs na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de skyed par nus par mtshungs na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: If it is the same in being able to produce it,

original: gal te brgya byin gyi spyi bo la yang du ba skyed par nus pa yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te brgya byin gyi spyi bo la yang du ba skyed par nus pa yod na ni //
translated: then if the head of Indra also has the ability to produce smoke,

original: de'i tshe de yang mi kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de yang mi kho na yin no //
translated: then at that time it would be fire.

original: de'i phyir legs par rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bus ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bus ni /
translated: Therefore, the result of a proper analysis

original: rgyu 'khrul pa med pas khyab pa grub bo //
analyzed: rgyu 'khrul pa med pas khyab pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the cause is necessarily nonerroneous.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: du ba las kyang du ba 'byung ba las 'khrul pa'i nyes pa de'i so na 'dug go zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar 'jig rten ni du ba 'di'i skad cig ma dang po ni 'di'o phyi ma ni 'di'o @152a * //
analyzed: du ba las kyang du ba 'byung ba las 'khrul pa'i nyes pa de'i so na 'dug go zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te / 'di ltar 'jig rten ni du ba 'di'i skad cig ma dang po ni 'di'o phyi ma ni 'di'o @152a * //
translated: The error of the arising of smoke from smoke still remains.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma rnam par dbye ba ni mi shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma rnam par dbye ba ni mi shes so //
translated: That is not logical, because the world does not know the differentiation of the moments of things such as this is the first moment of this smoke and this is the second moment.

original: mi shes pas skad cig ma thams cad gcig pa nyid du 'dzin la /
analyzed: mi shes pas skad cig ma thams cad gcig pa nyid du 'dzin la /
translated: Since it does not know that, it apprehends all moments as one.

original: gcig pa nyid du bzung nas du ba thams cad med las rab tu 'byung bar shes te /üîΩrjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad kyang ji ltar grags pa yin par zad mod kyi /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du bzung nas du ba thams cad med las rab tu 'byung bar shes te / rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad kyang ji ltar grags pa yin par zad mod kyi /
translated: Having apprehended them as one, it knows that all smoke arises from nonexistence.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Inference and the object inferred are merely what is renowned in the world, but they are not as they are in reality.

original: 'on te mkhas pa blo gros can 'ga' zhig gis skad cig ma'i rnam par dbye ba shes par gyur na /üîΩdes kyang yongs su snang ba'i du ba'i rgyun dang po me las rab tu 'byung ba kho na'o shes pas /
analyzed: 'on te mkhas pa blo gros can 'ga' zhig gis skad cig ma'i rnam par dbye ba shes par gyur na / des kyang yongs su snang ba'i du ba'i rgyun dang po me las rab tu 'byung ba kho na'o shes pas /
translated: But if some wise person who knows the analysis of momentsüîΩknows that the first moment of the continuum of smoke arises from fire,

original: 'di ltar 'di na du ba'i skad cig ma snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni me las brgyud de byung ba yin no snyam du rjes su dpog par byed pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na du ba'i skad cig ma snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni me las brgyud de byung ba yin no snyam du rjes su dpog par byed pa la /
translated: then he infers that the appearance of the moment of smoke is a subsequent effect that arises from fire.

original: me yang mngon sum dang brgyud pas du ba thams cad kyi rgyur 'dod de /
analyzed: me yang mngon sum dang brgyud pas du ba thams cad kyi rgyur 'dod de /
translated: Fire is asserted to be the cause of all smoke, directly and indirectly.

original: gal te me de med par gyur na du ba'i skad cig ma'i rgyun 'jug pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te me de med par gyur na du ba'i skad cig ma'i rgyun 'jug pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that fire were not to exist, the continuum of the moments of smoke would not occur.

original: de ltar re zhig rjes su dpag pa rnams par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rjes su dpag pa rnams par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: In this way, inference is established.

original: dngos po'i sgo nas kyang 'khrul pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i sgo nas kyang 'khrul pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: It is also nonerroneous in terms of the object.

original: ji ltar me'i rgyu mtshan can gyi skad cig ma dang po gang yin pa de ni gzhan las mi 'byung la dus phyis 'byung ba can gang dag yin pa de dag kyang nam yang me las mngon sum du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar me'i rgyu mtshan can gyi skad cig ma dang po gang yin pa de ni gzhan las mi 'byung la dus phyis 'byung ba can gang dag yin pa de dag kyang nam yang me las mngon sum du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the first moment that has the reason of fire does not arise from another, and those that arise later on are never directly perceived from fire.

original: de ltar na re zhig ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the reason of effect is taught to be non-erroneous.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs rdzogs so /üîΩ// / mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs rdzogs so / // / mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas //
translated: The chapter on the reason of effect is finished.üîΩWith regard to non-apprehension, he says:

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is an object of apprehension, etc.

original: don gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin na ;üîΩde mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: don gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin na ; de mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'am /
translated: If an object is an object of apprehension,

original: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs te /
translated: its non-apprehension is a reason proving the non-existence of the thing or the designation of the non-existence of the thing.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang du bsgrub shar bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tha dad pa der ni dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang du bsgrub shar bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tha dad pa der ni dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates that where there is a difference between the object of proof and the proof, the reason is non-existence.

original: gang du tha dad pa ma yin pa der ni med par tha snyad gdags pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du tha dad pa ma yin pa der ni med par tha snyad gdags pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And where there is no difference, the reason is the designation of non-existence.

original: dmigs pa ni dmigs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dmigs par byed pa ste /
translated: The object of observation is that which is observed.

original: yongs su gcod pa dang / shes par byed pa'i mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa dang / shes par byed pa'i mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for direct perception that is a determiner and a knower.

original: dmigs pa'i rig bya ni dmigs pa'i rig bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig bya ni dmigs pa'i rig bya'o //
translated: The object of observation is that which is observed.

original: shes par bya @152b ba yin pas /
analyzed: shes par bya @152b ba yin pas /
translated: It is that which is to be known.

original: rig bya ste dmigs pa'i rig bya nyid du gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rig bya ste dmigs pa'i rig bya nyid du gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar 'gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is an object of observation, that is, that which is an object of observation in the sense of being an observed object, is an object of observation.

original: dmigs pa'i rig bya nyid yul nyid du gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig bya nyid yul nyid du gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for an object in the sense of being an object of observation.

original: ngo bo'i rkyen med kyang ngo bo gtso cher bstan par rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: ngo bo'i rkyen med kyang ngo bo gtso cher bstan par rung ba nyid de /
translated: Even though it is not a condition of the nature, it is suitable to teach the nature as the chief.

original: dper na gnyis dang gcig dag la gnyis su smos pa dang ; gcig tu smos par bya ba zhes bya ba 'dir mdo'i don gnyis nyid dang gcig nyid dag ces bya bar bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gnyis dang gcig dag la gnyis su smos pa dang ; gcig tu smos par bya ba zhes bya ba 'dir mdo'i don gnyis nyid dang gcig nyid dag ces bya bar bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the statement, ‚Äútwo and one are to be spoken of as two and one,‚Äù the meaning of the sutra is explained as ‚Äútwo and one.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The condition of being an objective support is

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i rkyen gzhan mtha' dad dang dngos ltar rung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / yul dang / dus dang / ngo bo nyid kyi skal pa dag gis ma bskal ba nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i rkyen gzhan mtha' dad dang dngos ltar rung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / yul dang / dus dang / ngo bo nyid kyi skal pa dag gis ma bskal ba nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the condition of being an objective support that is not excluded from the other conditions, except for the condition of being an object.

original: dmigs ba de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dmigs ba de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That objective support is of two kinds:

original: shes par byed pa'i chos dang shes par bya ba'i don gyi chos so //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i chos dang shes par bya ba'i don gyi chos so //
translated: the phenomenon that is the object of knowledge and the phenomenon that is the object of understanding.

original: re zhig shes par byed pa'i chos nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig shes par byed pa'i chos nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the phenomenon that is the object of knowledge,

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that regard, the objective support is the object of knowledge.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa dang dmigs par byed pa'i chos yin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe dmigs par byed pa de'i shes pa mngon sum zhes bya ba gang yin pa de 'dir dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa dang dmigs par byed pa'i chos yin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe dmigs par byed pa de'i shes pa mngon sum zhes bya ba gang yin pa de 'dir dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do /
translated: When one wishes to express the object of observation and the observing subject, at that time, the consciousness of that observing subject is called ‚Äúdirect perception,‚Äù and that is expressed here with the term ‚Äúobject of observation.‚Äù

original: 'di'i dag pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i dag pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that, he says:

original: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The other object of observation is called ‚Äúnon-observation.‚Äù

original: dmigs par byed pa'i chos nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de las gzhan pa bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mi dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa'i chos nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de las gzhan pa bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mi dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The object of observation of the consciousness apprehending a vase, etc., which is expressed as the observing subject, is called ‚Äúobservation.‚Äù The other object of observation, which is the apprehension of the ground devoid of a vase, is expressed here with the term ‚Äúnon-observation.‚Äù

original: yang dmigs pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: yang dmigs pa kho na yin na /
translated: If it is only an object of observation,

original: ji ltar mi dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod ce na /
translated: how is it expressed with the term ‚Äúnon-observation‚Äù?

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is other than the object of observation that is wished to be expressed.‚Äù

original: brjod par 'dod pa bum pa 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de las bum pas de dben pa'i sa gzhi 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa 'di gzhan yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa bum pa 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de las bum pas de dben pa'i sa gzhi 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa 'di gzhan yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The object of apprehension of the apprehension of a vase, which is the object of desire, is different from the object of apprehension of the apprehension of the ground that is devoid of a vase.

original: ma yin par 'jug pas /üîΩdper na bzar rung ba las gzhan bzar mi rung ba mi gtsang ba las sogs pa lta bu dang / reg tu rung ba las gzhan pa reg tu mi rung ba gdol ba dang rol myags la sogs pa lta bu'o //
