analyzed: ma yin par 'jug pas / dper na bzar rung ba las gzhan bzar mi rung ba mi gtsang ba las sogs pa lta bu dang / reg tu rung ba las gzhan pa reg tu mi rung ba gdol ba dang rol myags la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called non-observation.

original: ma yin par @153a * //
analyzed: ma yin par @153a * //
translated: For example, it is like what is not suitable to eat, such as feces, being different from what is suitable to eat, and like what is not suitable to touch, such as a ca·πá·∏çƒÅla or a corpse, being different from what is suitable to touch.

original: 'jug pa ni ma yin par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni ma yin par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Non-engagement is non-engagement.

original: dgag par bya ba'i don ma yin pa bor nas don khyad par can la 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba'i don ma yin pa bor nas don khyad par can la 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is the engagement in a specific object after abandoning the object that is to be negated.

original: ma yin par 'jug pa de lta bu de 'dir dag pa rab tu sbyar pa yin no /üîΩma yin pa ni gang du bsgrub ba ni gtso che la /
analyzed: ma yin par 'jug pa de lta bu de 'dir dag pa rab tu sbyar pa yin no /üîΩma yin pa ni gang du bsgrub ba ni gtso che la /
translated: That kind of non-engagement is applied here as purity.üîΩNon-engagement is the non-engagement of the mind.

original: dgag pa ni don gyis go ba de lta bu yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgag pa ni don gyis go ba de lta bu yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The negation should be seen as understood by implication in that way.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa yin pas bsgrub pa ni gtso bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa yin pas bsgrub pa ni gtso bo nyid yin te /
translated: The affirmation is the principal one, because it is the object that is different from the object that is intended to be expressed.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa gzhan yod par bsgrub pa'i shugs kho nas brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa dgag pa'i shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa gzhan yod par bsgrub pa'i shugs kho nas brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa dgag pa'i shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the cognition of the negation of the object that is intended to be expressed is only by the implication of the affirmation of the existence of another object.

original: de las bzlog pa ni med par dgag pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni med par dgag pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that should be seen as an absolute negation.

original: der ni dgag pa gtso bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: der ni dgag pa gtso bo nyid yin no //
translated: In that case, the negation is the principal one.

original: de ltar mi dmigs par shes par byed pa'i chos nyid yin pa bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs par shes par byed pa'i chos nyid yin pa bstan nas //
translated: Having thus taught the nature of the cognition of non-apprehension,

original: dmigs pa shes par bya ba'i don gyi chos nyid yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa shes par bya ba'i don gyi chos nyid yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the nature of the cognition of the object that is apprehended,

original: dmigs par bya ba'i chos nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i chos nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf it were the nature of the object that is apprehended,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po'i chos yin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po'i chos yin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya ba'o //
translated: When you want to say that the object is the thing that is perceived, then the object is to be regarded as the nature of the object.

original: yul gyi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhig la dmigs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhig la dmigs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the object that is called the object?

original: rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe consciousness that has that as its object, etc.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de bskyed par rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de bskyed par rung ba nyid de /
translated: The consciousness that has as its object the nature of the object to be refuted, such as a pot, is capable of being produced.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The nature of the object that has that as its characteristic is called the object.

original: shes pa 'di la bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi yul yod pas na 'di ni rang gi yul can no //üîΩde ni rang gi yul can yang yin la /
analyzed: shes pa 'di la bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi yul yod pas na 'di ni rang gi yul can no // de ni rang gi yul can yang yin la /
translated: Since this consciousness has as its object the nature of a pot, etc., it is said to have its own object.üîΩIt is a consciousness that has its own object,

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pas rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pas rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: and it is a consciousness that has as its object the nature of the object.

original: de skye ba la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de skye ba la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called ‚Äúthe capacity to generate consciousness.‚Äù

original: rang gi yul can rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te //üîΩyul gyi ngo bo nyid 'di la rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pas //
analyzed: rang gi yul can rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te // yul gyi ngo bo nyid 'di la rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pas //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe capacity to generate consciousness that has it as its object‚Äù should be supplied.üîΩThe object has the characteristic of the capacity to generate consciousness that has it as its object.

original: 'di ni rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Therefore, the object has the characteristic of the capacity to generate consciousness that has it as its object.

original: gal te 'dir dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar @153b rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te 'dir dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar @153b rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin /
translated: If the object is the nature of the object of perception, how can it be the characteristic of the capacity?

original: 'di ltar rung ba nyid kyi chos nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rung ba nyid kyi chos nyid yin la /
translated: The capacity is the nature of a thing.

original: chos dang chos can dag ni tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag ni tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: The property and the possessor of the property are certainly different.

original: de'i phyir / rung ba nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rung ba nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause the capacity is the nature of a thing.‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid ni dngos su na /
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni dngos su na /
translated: The capacity is actually

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin gyi /
translated: the nature of a thing.

original: don dam par dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is not different from the nature of the entity itself.

original: de ltar dmigs pa yul gyi chos nyid yin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa yul gyi chos nyid yin pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown that the object of perception is the reality of the object,

original: dgag pa 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgag pa 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show the application of the negation,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe perception of something else,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par rung ba /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par rung ba /
translated: The object of negation, such as a pot, is suitable to produce a consciousness that has it as its object.

original: de las gzhan pa bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa bskyed par rung ba gang yin pa de nyid //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa bskyed par rung ba gang yin pa de nyid //
translated: That which is different from it, the perception of a place devoid of a pot, is suitable to produce a perception.

original: 'dir mi dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir mi dmigs pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: That very [perception] is expressed here by the word ‚Äúnon-perception.‚Äù

original: tshul gong ma dang mthun par bsgre ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tshul gong ma dang mthun par bsgre ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to extend the method in the same way as before,

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAs before.‚Äù

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa la gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa la gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is different from the desired object of perception,

original: ma yin par 'jig pas bzar mi rung ba dang / reg tu mi rung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba don thams cad thal zin no //
analyzed: ma yin par 'jig pas bzar mi rung ba dang / reg tu mi rung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba don thams cad thal zin no //
translated: it is like something inedible or untouchable that is destroyed. The meaning of all this has already been concluded.

original: yang gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spyi'i sgra yin na /
analyzed: yang gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spyi'i sgra yin na /
translated: Moreover, the term ‚Äúother‚Äù is a general term.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin par 'jug pas /üîΩbum pas dben pa'i phyogs shes pa kho na'am /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin par 'jug pas / bum pas dben pa'i phyogs shes pa kho na'am /
translated: How is it that non-apprehension is not engaged?üîΩIt is only the cognition of a place devoid of a pot,

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kho na yin par rab tu brtags la /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kho na yin par rab tu brtags la /
translated: or it is only a place devoid of a pot that is thoroughly investigated.

original: khyad par med par gzhan gyi sgrar brjod par bya ba thams cad kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med par gzhan gyi sgrar brjod par bya ba thams cad kho na ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not all that is expressed by the term ‚Äúother‚Äù without distinction.

original: de'i phyir / de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rung ba nyid du khyad par med ba'i phyir gang du gang zhig dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rung ba nyid du khyad par med ba'i phyir gang du gang zhig dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to show that there is no distinction in terms of suitability, he says, ‚Äúwherever one is apprehended,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyogs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gang du gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig dmigs na /
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gang du gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig dmigs na /
translated: In whatever situation, such as a place, and so on, wherever one, such as form, is apprehended,

original: dngos po gzhan gang zhig nges par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po de ni gzugs la sogs pa de dang 'brel pa brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gang zhig nges par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po de ni gzugs la sogs pa de dang 'brel pa brjod do //
translated: that other thing which is definitely apprehended is said to be related to that form, and so on.

original: rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa ni nges par dmigs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa ni nges par dmigs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The absence of distinction in terms of suitability is the cause of definite apprehension.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dmigs na drung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dmigs na drung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, if form and so on are observed, they are equivalent in being the essence of the appropriated aggregates.

original: gnyis pa yang gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if form and so on are observed, then the two are necessarily observed, because they are similar in being the nature of the object.

original: de nyid ji ltar 'brel ce na /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar 'brel ce na /
translated: How are they related?

original: shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgnyi @154a * //
analyzed: shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / gnyi @154a * //
translated: The response is: because they are related to a single consciousness.

original: ga yang shes pa gcig dang 'brel te /
analyzed: ga yang shes pa gcig dang 'brel te /
translated: Both are related to a single consciousness.

original: 'di ltar shes pa de dngos po gnyis kyi rnam par bskyed pa na de gnyis bdag nyid dang 'brel par ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa de dngos po gnyis kyi rnam par bskyed pa na de gnyis bdag nyid dang 'brel par ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, when that consciousness generates the aspect of two things, it demonstrates that those two are related to itself.

original: ci'i phyir shes pa de gdon mi za bar dngos po gnyis kyi rnam par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes pa de gdon mi za bar dngos po gnyis kyi rnam par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is that consciousness necessarily transformed into the aspect of two things?

original: de'i phyir / de gnyis yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de gnyis yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond, he says, ‚ÄúIf those two exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te rung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag yod pa yin no //
translated: If those two are similar in being the nature of the object, then they exist.

original: de'i tshe gcig nges bar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig nges bar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one is not ascertained.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Here, the reason is stated: because it is impossible.

original: gang gis na de gnyis la gcig kho na snang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gis na de gnyis la gcig kho na snang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: How could it be impossible that only one of those two appears,

original: cig shos ni ma yin pa 'di ni mi srid do //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin pa 'di ni mi srid do //
translated: and the other does not?

original: klan ka gnyug ma yongs su spang bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: klan ka gnyug ma yongs su spang bar bzhed nas /
translated: In order to completely eliminate the objection,

original: mjug bsdu bar /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bar /
translated: he concludes:

original: de ltar bas na 'dir rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar bas na 'dir rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, here, the two are similar in being the nature of the possible.

original: gang gi phyir de gnyis rung ba nyid kyi phyir ngo bor mtshungs pas shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i skabs 'dir de gnyis nye ba'i phyir rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa can dag phan tshun ltos pa kho nas gzhan
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gnyis rung ba nyid kyi phyir ngo bor mtshungs pas shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i skabs 'dir de gnyis nye ba'i phyir rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa can dag phan tshun ltos pa kho nas gzhan
translated: Because those two are similar in being the nature of the possible, they are related to a single cognition. Therefore, in this context of non-apprehension, because those two are similar in being the nature of the possible, they are mutually dependent, and should be seen as different.

original: nyid yin par blta bar bya'i khyad par med par gzhan gyi sgrar brjod par bya ba'i dngos po la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid yin par blta bar bya'i khyad par med par gzhan gyi sgrar brjod par bya ba'i dngos po la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: However, they are not different in the absence of a specific difference, in dependence on the entity that is the referent of the term other.

original: gang dag la rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa yod pa de dag ni rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo khyod par med pa can dag go //üîΩga dgag la shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag la rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa yod pa de dag ni rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo khyod par med pa can dag go // ga dgag la shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag ni /
translated: Those that have the nature of being suitable, without distinction, are those that have the nature of being suitable.

original: shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa can dag go //
analyzed: shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa can dag go //
translated: Those that have the nature of being related to a single cognition are those that are related to a single cognition.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi dmigs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi dmigs pa ston par byed do //
translated: Here, this shows non-apprehension.

original: de ltar 'dir shes pa gcig pa dang 'brel pa can dag phan tshun ltos pa kho nas gzhan nyid du tha snyad gdags so zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir shes pa gcig pa dang 'brel pa can dag phan tshun ltos pa kho nas gzhan nyid du tha snyad gdags so zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, here it is shown that those that are related to a single cognition are mutually dependent, and are conventionally designated as different.

original: mi dmigs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach non-apprehension,

original: de 'ba' zhig de la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig de la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said: Only that, in dependence on that... and so forth.

original: gang gi tshe phyogs de 'ba' zhig kho na ji skad bshad pa'i bu ma la ltos nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyogs de 'ba' zhig kho na ji skad bshad pa'i bu ma la ltos nas /
translated: When only that direction, in dependence on the son as previously explained, is apprehended,

original: bum pa de las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba de'i tshe mi dmigs pa ni bum pas dben pa'i phyogs shes pa'am bum pas @154b dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: bum pa de las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba de'i tshe mi dmigs pa ni bum pas dben pa'i phyogs shes pa'am bum pas @154b dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: If it is said that the vase is different from that, then non-apprehension is the cognition of a place devoid of a vase, or the intrinsic reality of a place devoid of a vase.

original: gang gi tshe de shes pa yin pa de'i tshe ni mi dmigs pa shes par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de shes pa yin pa de'i tshe ni mi dmigs pa shes par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: When it is cognition, then it is the characteristic of a phenomenon that causes the cognition of non-apprehension.

original: gang gi tshe de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni shes bya'i chos kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni shes bya'i chos kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: When it is intrinsic reality, then it is the characteristic of a phenomenon that is cognized.

original: 'di skad du mi dmigs pa ni /üîΩbyed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'di skad du mi dmigs pa ni / byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba 'am /
translated: In this way, non-apprehensionüîΩis either the action that resides in the agent,

original: las la gnas pa'i bya ba yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las la gnas pa'i bya ba yin par 'gyur te /
translated: or the action that resides in the object.

original: byed pa po gnas pa yin ni mi dmigs pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po gnas pa yin ni mi dmigs pa shes pa yin no //
translated: If it resides in the agent, then non-apprehension is the cognition.

original: las la gnas pa yin na ni mi dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: las la gnas pa yin na ni mi dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: If it resides in the object, then non-apprehension is the intrinsic reality of the object.

original: de ltar ma yin par 'jug pas mi dmigs pa rnams par bzhag nas /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin par 'jug pas mi dmigs pa rnams par bzhag nas /
translated: If it is not like that, then non-apprehension is posited as engagement.

original: 'di'i bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the proof of that, he says:

original: de'i zla bo dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: de'i zla bo dngos po med pa'am /
translated: The opposite of that is the non-existence of a thing,

original: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: or the designation of the non-existence of a thing, and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo bshad pa gang yin pa de ni zla bo bum pa la sogs pa dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo bshad pa gang yin pa de ni zla bo bum pa la sogs pa dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The non-existence of a thing, such as a pot, which is the opposite of the non-observation of a thing, is the proof of the designation of the non-existence of a thing.

original: rgyu dang / khyab par byed pa me dmigs pas ni dngos po med pa dang dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: rgyu dang / khyab par byed pa me dmigs pas ni dngos po med pa dang dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed la /
translated: The non-observation of a cause or a pervader proves the non-existence of a thing and the designation of the non-existence of a thing.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The non-observation of a nature proves only the designation of the non-existence of a thing.

original: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa ni /
translated: The designation of the non-existence of a thing

original: shes pa dang mngon par brjod pa dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: shes pa dang mngon par brjod pa dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: is characterized by consciousness, verbalization, and engagement.

original: de la 'di na bum pa med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang / de lta bu dngos po mngon par rjod par byed pa'i mngon par brjod pa dang / phyogs der dogs pa med par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di na bum pa med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang / de lta bu dngos po mngon par rjod par byed pa'i mngon par brjod pa dang / phyogs der dogs pa med par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the consciousness that has the aspect of thinking ‚ÄúThe pot does not exist here,‚Äù the verbal expression that expresses such an entity, and the activity that has the characteristic of going and coming without hesitation in that place.

original: pha rol pos gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: pha rol pos gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the opponent says that non-apprehension is not the nature of the object,

original: mi dmigs par mi rung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs par mi rung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that non-apprehension is not tenable,

original: ji ltar na gzhan yod pa de med pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan yod pa de med pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHow can the existence of one thing be the nonexistence of another?‚Äù

original: phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ji ltar bum ba med pa yin /
analyzed: phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ji ltar bum ba med pa yin /
translated: How can the nature of the place be the nonexistence of the pot?

original: rgyu gang gis na dngos bo med pa'i ngo bo'i mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad gdags par gyur par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na dngos bo med pa'i ngo bo'i mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad gdags par gyur par 'gyur /
translated: By what means does the nonapprehension of the nature of nonentity become the designation of nonentity?

original: 'dir pha rol po'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po'i bsam pa ni /
translated: Here the opponent thinks as follows:

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dngos po yod pa'i ngo bo dag las mi dmigs pa logs shig tu byed na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dngos po yod pa'i ngo bo dag las mi dmigs pa logs shig tu byed na /
translated: When nonobservation is made into a separate type of effect and nature reasonings, then it is not tenable that there are only three types of reasons.

original: de'i tshe de gdon mi za bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /üîΩde lta ma yin na logs shig @155a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe de gdon mi za bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te / de lta ma yin na logs shig @155a * //
translated: If non-apprehension is made separate from the effect and nature reasons, then it would definitely have the nature of a non-thing.

original: shig tu byed pa don med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: shig tu byed pa don med pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then making it separate would be pointless.

original: khyad kyis ni gzhan yod pa'i ngo bo med dmigs par bshad na /
analyzed: khyad kyis ni gzhan yod pa'i ngo bo med dmigs par bshad na /
translated: If you explain that the apprehension of the nature of the existence of another is non-apprehension,

original: de ci gzhan don yod pa de med pa yin par nges te /
analyzed: de ci gzhan don yod pa de med pa yin par nges te /
translated: then how could the existence of another be ascertained as non-existence?

original: des na khyod de skad du 'chad snyam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na khyod de skad du 'chad snyam pa 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, you think that it is explained in that way.

original: de'i phyir / ji ltar na gzhan yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i glan ka 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji ltar na gzhan yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i glan ka 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, how could this objection arise, ‚ÄúHow is it that the existence of another is called non-apprehension?‚Äù This is the doubt of the opponent.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas //
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remind you of what was previously explained,

original: 'dir ji ltar ma yin par 'jug pas ltos pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar ma yin par 'jug pas ltos pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, since it is not like that, it is said, ‚ÄúIn terms of dependence, etc.‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa dag ma yin par 'jug pas ltos pa'i sgo nas dngos po med pa dang / ltos pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa dag ma yin par 'jug pas ltos pa'i sgo nas dngos po med pa dang / ltos pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is not the case that they are similar in the nature of being suitable, non-existence is in terms of dependence, and non-apprehension is in terms of dependence.

original: dgag pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar bshad zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgag pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar bshad zin pa nyid do //
translated: This is not a mere negation. This has already been explained.

original: 'di skad du //
analyzed: 'di skad du //
translated: It is like this:

original: gang gi tshe ma yin pa'i ngo bor dngos po med pa dang / mi dmigs pa dag rnam par 'jog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma yin pa'i ngo bor dngos po med pa dang / mi dmigs pa dag rnam par 'jog pa'i tshe /
translated: When non-existence and non-apprehension are posited in the nature of not being,

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi sgo ngo bo nyid kho na bum pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi sgo ngo bo nyid kho na bum pa med pa yin no //
translated: the nature of a place devoid of a pot is itself the non-existence of a pot.

original: de'i phyir bum pa med pa'i ngo bo'i mi dmigs pa de lta bus dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa la nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa med pa'i ngo bo'i mi dmigs pa de lta bus dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa la nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, in that way, the non-apprehension of the nature of the non-existence of a pot is non-existence. In terms of that, there is no fault at all in positing the designation of non-existence.

original: logs shig tu smos pa ni chung zad tsam zhig khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: logs shig tu smos pa ni chung zad tsam zhig khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is mentioned separately because there is a slight difference.

original: don dam par ni mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho na yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, non-observation is only a natural argument.

original: 'di ltar dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyis ba dngos po med par tha snyad gdags su rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid grub par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyis ba dngos po med par tha snyad gdags su rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid grub par byed do //
translated: Thus, the nature of the absence of the object of negation is established as having the characteristic of the mere possibility of the designation of non-existence.

original: yang ci'i phyir dngos po med pa dang mi dmigs pa dgag pa tsam ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dngos po med pa dang mi dmigs pa dgag pa tsam ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is non-existence and non-observation not mere negation?

original: de'i phyir / de grub par ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de grub par ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause the non-establishment of that is not established.‚Äù

original: dgag pa tsam de'i tshad ma nyid chung zad kyang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dgag pa tsam de'i tshad ma nyid chung zad kyang mi 'grub bo //
translated: The valid knowledge of mere negation is not established in the least.

original: 'di ltar khyod kyi phyogs ltar dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyi phyogs ltar dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, according to your position, non-observation is non-observation.

original: des dngos po med pa'am der tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed na /üîΩde la re zhig mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar 'grub /
analyzed: des dngos po med pa'am der tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed na / de la re zhig mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar 'grub /
translated: If that establishes non-existence or the designation of that,üîΩthen first, how is that non-observation established?

original: gal te mi dmigs pa gzhan zhig gis na ni de'i tshe de yang ji ltar grub /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa gzhan zhig gis na ni de'i tshe de yang ji ltar grub /
translated: If it is by another non-observation, then how is that established?

original: de las gzhan pa yang ji ltar grub ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang ji ltar grub ste /
translated: How could anything else be established?

original: de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med par tha snyad dgag pa nyid gang du yang grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med par tha snyad dgag pa nyid gang du yang grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of things is not established in any way through the negation of conventions.

original: yang de na sgrub pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang de na sgrub pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di don gzhan yin te /
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúbecause the proof is not established‚Äù has a different meaning.

original: @155b dgag pa tsam de grub pa nyid yin pa kho nar mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: @155b dgag pa tsam de grub pa nyid yin pa kho nar mi 'grub bo //
translated: It is not established that the mere negation is established.

original: 'di ltar grub par byed pa sgrub pa zhes bya na dgag pa tsam ni dngos po med pa'i phyir sgrub bar byed pa mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar grub par byed pa sgrub pa zhes bya na dgag pa tsam ni dngos po med pa'i phyir sgrub bar byed pa mi nus te /
translated: In this way, if one says that the proof is that which establishes, then the mere negation is not able to establish because it is a non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yin no //
translated: A non-thing is devoid of all ability.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa yang grub pa bskyed par 'dod na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa yang grub pa bskyed par 'dod na ni de'i tshe /
translated: But if you assert that a non-thing generates an existent,

original: lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir rtag tu bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir rtag tu bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would always generate it because it would not rely on cooperating conditions.

original: shes pa gzhan gyi go skabs kho na yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyi go skabs kho na yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, there would be no opportunity for any other cognition.

original: de lta na dgag pa tsam gyis grub pa skyed par mi nus na /
analyzed: de lta na dgag pa tsam gyis grub pa skyed par mi nus na /
translated: If that were so, then since a mere negation cannot generate an existent,

original: de'i tshe med par tha snyad gdags pa yang mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe med par tha snyad gdags pa yang mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time, the designation of nonexistence would not be established at all.

original: de ltar 'dir dngos po med par dgag pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir dngos po med par dgag pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa bsal nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the nature of mere negation of non-thing here,

original: rgyu gang gis na gzhan yod pa na de med pa yin no zhes tha snyad gdags pa de bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo de //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na gzhan yod pa na de med pa yin no zhes tha snyad gdags pa de bstan pa'i phyir / 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo de //
translated: in order to demonstrate the cause by which, when the other exists, it is designated as ‚Äúnonexistent,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat nature which is unrelated,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: bum pa dang 'brel pa med pa de'i ngo bo'i phyogs de'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa de nyid gzhan bum pa med par grub pa yin pa de'i phyir //
analyzed: bum pa dang 'brel pa med pa de'i ngo bo'i phyogs de'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa de nyid gzhan bum pa med par grub pa yin pa de'i phyir //
translated: the nature of that which is unrelated to the pot, the nature of that part, is established as its own nature, that itself is established as the nonexistence of the other, the pot.

original: gzhan yod pa yang mi dmigs pa bzhin du //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa yang mi dmigs pa bzhin du //
translated: Therefore, just like the non-observation of the existence of the other,

original: me yin pa'i ngo bos de med pa yin no zhes tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: me yin pa'i ngo bos de med pa yin no zhes tha snyad gdags so //
translated: by the nature of being fire, it is designated as ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: 'dir pha rol pos bum pa la sogs pa med pa yang dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid du nyes pa med par mthong nas gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩbum pas dben pa'i phyogs ni mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa de rang gi ngo bor mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tshad mas 'grub par 'gyur bas bum pa med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol pos bum pa la sogs pa med pa yang dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid du nyes pa med par mthong nas gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bum pas dben pa'i phyogs ni mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa de rang gi ngo bor mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tshad mas 'grub par 'gyur bas bum pa med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: Here, the opponent sees no fault in the cause of the designation of non-thing in the nonexistence of a pot and so on.

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs de grub pas rjes su dpag pa'i bum pa med pa bum pa med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed kyang rung ba'i 'dir dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa la khyad par 'ga' yang med na /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs de grub pas rjes su dpag pa'i bum pa med pa bum pa med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed kyang rung ba'i 'dir dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa la khyad par 'ga' yang med na /
translated: Since the absence of a pot in a place devoid of a pot is established by the valid knowledge called ‚Äúperception‚Äù as the nature of the absence of a phenomenon, it is either established by the means of designation of the nonexistence of a pot or it is established by the inference of the nonexistence of a pot in that place devoid of a pot, and the means of designation of the nonexistence of a pot is established.

original: khyad par gang gis ni mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa 'grub pa 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par gang gis ni mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa 'grub pa 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: What is the difference between these two? It would be contradictory to establish the expression ‚Äúnonexistent thing‚Äù by non-apprehension.

original: 'dir gcig gi ltar na ni bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa mngon sum du rtags yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gcig gi ltar na ni bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa mngon sum du rtags yin la /
translated: In this regard, according to one opinion, the non-apprehension of the apprehension of the place devoid of pot is the direct evidence.

original: cig shos kyi ltar na ni /
analyzed: cig shos kyi ltar na ni /
translated: According to the other opinion,

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pas rjes su dpag pa'i bum pa med pa dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa'i rtags yin pas khyad par yod pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pas rjes su dpag pa'i bum pa med pa dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa'i rtags yin pas khyad par yod pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: the non-apprehension of the pot that is inferred from the apprehension of the place devoid of pot is the evidence for the expression ‚Äúnonexistent thing.‚Äù So there is a difference.

original: khyad par 'di ni yong ba bden @156a * //üîΩna gang gis na dgag par brtags pa bzhin du mi dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: khyad par 'di ni yong ba bden @156a * // na gang gis na dgag par brtags pa bzhin du mi dmigs pa las so //
translated: This difference is indeed true,üîΩbut it is not the case that the expression ‚Äúnonexistent thing‚Äù is established from non-apprehension as imagined in the negation.

original: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa 'grub pa 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de ni med de brgyud de mi dmigs pas rjes su dpag pa'i tshul gyis grub pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na las grub par zad do //
analyzed: dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa 'grub pa 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de ni med de brgyud de mi dmigs pas rjes su dpag pa'i tshul gyis grub pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na las grub par zad do //
translated: There is no difference in the establishment of the expression ‚Äúnonexistent thing‚Äù by the inference of non-apprehension. That which is established by the mode of inference of indirect non-apprehension is established only from that.

original: gal te khyad par med du chug na yang des na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par med du chug na yang des na ci zhe na /
translated: But even if it is not distinct, what is the point of that?

original: de'i phyir / gzhan yod pa de nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzhan yod pa de nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe existence of the other is itself‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub pa la khyad par med pa de'i tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs de nyid dang / de'i yul can gyi dmigs pa bum pa dngos po med pa'i rtags nyid du sgrub pa ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub pa la khyad par med pa de'i tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs de nyid dang / de'i yul can gyi dmigs pa bum pa dngos po med pa'i rtags nyid du sgrub pa ci ste ma yin /
translated: When, by the method explained above, there is no difference in the establishment of the designation of a non-thing, then why is the very place devoid of pot and the object of the awareness of that place, the pot, not established as the reason of the non-thing?

original: de de ltar grub pa ni bum pa med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: de de ltar grub pa ni bum pa med par tha snyad gdags pa sgrub par byed pa kho na yin na /
translated: When that is established in that way, it is the establishment of the designation of the nonexistence of the pot.

original: gzhan yod par grub pa nyid de de med par grub pa yin no zhes 'jig rten dang 'gal bar brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan yod par grub pa nyid de de med par grub pa yin no zhes 'jig rten dang 'gal bar brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of imagining that the establishment of the existence of the other is the establishment of its nonexistence, since that contradicts the world?

original: 'dir pha rol gyi bsam pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol gyi bsam pa ni /
translated: Here the thought of the opponent is this:

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa la ni rigs na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa la ni rigs na /
translated: If it is reasonable to understand that non-apprehension is not a non-entity due to the faults explained above,

original: dngos po med par dgag pa'i ngo bor yongs su bzung na dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: dngos po med par dgag pa'i ngo bor yongs su bzung na dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa grub pa la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: If you hold that the nature of a non-thing is an internal negation, what contradiction is there in establishing the designation of a non-thing?

original: gang gis gzhan yod pa nyid de med pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan yod pa nyid de med pa yin /
translated: How could the existence of another be a non-thing?

original: gzhan yod pa grub pa nyid de med par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu 'jig rten dang 'gal ba rnam par 'joms par byed /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa grub pa nyid de med par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu 'jig rten dang 'gal ba rnam par 'joms par byed /
translated: The establishment of the existence of another is the establishment of a non-thing.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: re zhig gzhan yod pa de med pa'i sgrub ba nyid yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig gzhan yod pa de med pa'i sgrub ba nyid yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the claim that the existence of another is the proof of nonexistence,

original: so so ma grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: so so ma grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause they are not established separately.‚Äù

original: bum pa med pa dang phyogs so sor grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: bum pa med pa dang phyogs so sor grub pa ni med do //
translated: A non-pot and a place are not established separately.

original: 'on kyang bum pas dben pa'i ngo bos phyogs 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa kho nas bum pa med pa shes te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pas dben pa'i ngo bos phyogs 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa kho nas bum pa med pa shes te /
translated: However, the cognition that apprehends a place as having the nature of being empty of a pot knows that there is no pot.

original: de'i phyir shes pa gcig gis gzung bar bya ba phyogs dang bum pa dag ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa gcig gis gzung bar bya ba phyogs dang bum pa dag ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the object held by a single cognition, such as a place and a pot, be the relationship of signifier and signified?

original: gtan tshigs gzhan 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the reason is unrelated to the other.‚Äù

original: phyogs dang bum pa med pa 'di gnyis ni phan tshun 'brel pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: phyogs dang bum pa med pa 'di gnyis ni phan tshun 'brel pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: These two, a place and a pot, are not related to each other in any way.

original: 'brel pa med na ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: 'brel pa med na ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur /
translated: If they are not related, how could they be the relationship of signifier and signified?

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩre zhig gzhan yod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / re zhig gzhan yod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: re zhig gzhan yod pa ni zla bo bum pa la sogs pa med pa'i sgrub pa ma yin @156b no ;
analyzed: re zhig gzhan yod pa ni zla bo bum pa la sogs pa med pa'i sgrub pa ma yin @156b no ;
translated: ‚ÄúFirst, the existence of the other is not the proof of the absence of the opposite, such as a pot.‚Äù

original: / re zhig ces bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: / re zhig ces bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù

original: go rims yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: go rims yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: is used to indicate the order.

original: gzhan yod ba'i yul can gyi dmigs pa dngos po med pa bsgrub pa yin pa dgag pa ni phyis bshad par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yod ba'i yul can gyi dmigs pa dngos po med pa bsgrub pa yin pa dgag pa ni phyis bshad par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The refutation of the fact that the object of the subject, which is other-existence, is established as a non-thing will be explained later.

original: ji ltar gzhan yod pa dngos po med pa'i bsgrub pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan yod pa dngos po med pa'i bsgrub pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the existence of another is not the establishment of a non-thing?

original: de'i phyir / gang zhig grub pa na gang mi 'grub pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zhig grub pa na gang mi 'grub pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThat which is not established when this is established . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: don gang zhig grub pa'i tshe don gzhan gang zhig mi 'grub pa de gnyis ni rtags dang rtags can yin no /
analyzed: don gang zhig grub pa'i tshe don gzhan gang zhig mi 'grub pa de gnyis ni rtags dang rtags can yin no /
translated: When one object is established, the other object is not established. These two are the reason and the property to be established.

original: 'dir dpe me dang du ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir dpe me dang du ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, he says, ‚ÄúThe example is fire and smoke.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe la lar du ba grub pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe la lar du ba grub pa'i tshe /
translated: When smoke is established in some place,

original: me ma grub pa yin pa de'i tshe me grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: me ma grub pa yin pa de'i tshe me grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: fire is not established. At that time, in order to establish fire,üîΩsmoke is taken as the reason.

original: du brtags nyid du gzung gi / gang gi tshe du ba grub pa'i tshe kho na na me 'grub pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: du brtags nyid du gzung gi / gang gi tshe du ba grub pa'i tshe kho na na me 'grub pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: But when smoke is established, fire is established. At that time,

original: de gnyis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po ma yin na /
analyzed: de gnyis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po ma yin na /
translated: those two are not the reason and the property to be established.

original: 'dir ni bum pas dben pa'i phyogs rtog pa'i tshe nyid na bum pa med pa shes na /
analyzed: 'dir ni bum pas dben pa'i phyogs rtog pa'i tshe nyid na bum pa med pa shes na /
translated: Here, when one conceives of a place devoid of a pot, one knows that there is no pot.

original: de ji ltar 'di gnyis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'di gnyis rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur /
translated: How could these two be the property of the reason and the property to be proven?

original: 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo can te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo can te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt has an essence that is not related to anything else, etc.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba la ni phyogs zhes bya ba gzhan yod pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la ni phyogs zhes bya ba gzhan yod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the place.

original: de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyogs de las gzhan pa rung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyogs de las gzhan pa rung ba nyid kyi ngo bor mtshungs pa bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: ‚Äú It has an essence that is not related to anything else, etc.‚Äù That which is similar to a pot, etc., which is suitable as something other than that place, is

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: referred to by the term ‚Äúthat which is other than that.‚Äù

original: 'di la de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo yod pas 'di ni de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo can te /
analyzed: 'di la de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo yod pas 'di ni de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo can te /
translated: It has an essence that is not related to anything else, because it has an essence that is not related to anything else.

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúA place devoid of a pot‚Äù means a place that is not related to a pot.üîΩBecause a place that is not related to a pot is a place that is devoid of a pot, the valid cognition that posits the reality of a place that is not related to a pot is

original: gang gi phyir bum pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs de'i de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa gang gis na bum pas dben pa nyid kyi phyogs shes bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs de'i de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa gang gis na bum pas dben pa nyid kyi phyogs shes bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma
translated: the valid cognition that posits a place that is devoid of a pot.

original: de kho nas phyogs kyi gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: de kho nas phyogs kyi gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub ste /
translated: By that very [valid cognition], the exclusion of other places is established.

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúA place that is devoid of a pot‚Äù means a place that is known to be devoid of a pot.

original: de'i phyir so sor ma grub pas gzhan yod pa de ni dngos po med pa'i sgrub pa ma yin no //üîΩgtan tshigs gzhan bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor ma grub pas gzhan yod pa de ni dngos po med pa'i sgrub pa ma yin no // gtan tshigs gzhan bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Therefore, since [the two] are not established separately, the existence of one thing is not a proof of the nonexistence of another.

original: de de'i rtags yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de de'i rtags yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain another reason, [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] states, ‚ÄúThat is its reason,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtags de dang rtags can dang ldan na /üîΩrtags de rtags can der lhan @157a * //
analyzed: rtags de dang rtags can dang ldan na / rtags de rtags can der lhan @157a * //
translated: If the reason and the one who possesses the reasonüîΩare related in some way,

original: cig 'brel pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: cig 'brel pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: then the reason and the one who possesses the reason would be mutually dependent.

original: dper na byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i rtag dang mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i rtags can du lhan cig don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa lta bu zhig yin grang ste /
analyzed: dper na byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i rtag dang mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i rtags can du lhan cig don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa lta bu zhig yin grang ste /
translated: For example, it is like the relation of the reason ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù to the property to be established ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid gnyis ni don gcig la bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid gnyis ni don gcig la bsdu ba yin no //
translated: In this case, ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù and ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù are related by the definition of being included in the same object.

original: 'di gnyis don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The relation of these two by the definition of being included in the same object is explained in terms of the opponent‚Äôs system.

original: rang gi lugs ltar na ni /
analyzed: rang gi lugs ltar na ni /
translated: In our own system,

original: 'di gnyis de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel ba yin no //
translated: these two are related by the identity relation.

original: 'brel pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another relation,

original: du ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúsmoke‚Äù and so on.

original: du ba dang rtags can med par lhan cig don gcig la 'du ba lta bu zhig yin grang ste /
analyzed: du ba dang rtags can med par lhan cig don gcig la 'du ba lta bu zhig yin grang ste /
translated: For example, it is like the relation of the reason ‚Äúsmoke‚Äù to the property to be established ‚Äúfire.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar du ba dang me gnyi ga yang phyogs gcig na 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba dang me gnyi ga yang phyogs gcig na 'du ba yin no //
translated: In this case, both smoke and fire are included in the same place.

original: ldan pa ni 'dir 'du ba'i sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: ldan pa ni 'dir 'du ba'i sgrar bshad de /
translated: Possession is explained here as the term ‚Äúincluded.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni phyogs na de gnyis 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par khas mi len te /
analyzed: gzhan ni phyogs na de gnyis 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par khas mi len te /
translated: Others do not accept that these two are related by the characteristic of inherence.üîΩOr else, since smoke is seen in fire, these two are related by the characteristic of support and supported.

original: yang na me la du ba mthong ba'i phyir de gnyis rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa zhig yin grang 'brel pa 'di gnyi ga yang gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na me la du ba mthong ba'i phyir de gnyis rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa zhig yin grang 'brel pa 'di gnyi ga yang gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: But both of these relations are posited in dependence on the system of others.

original: rang gi lugs ltar 'di gnyis kyi 'brel ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi lugs ltar 'di gnyis kyi 'brel ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the relation between these two in our system, he says,

original: bskyed par bya ba dang bskyed pa'i dngos po lta bu zhig yin grang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang bskyed pa'i dngos po lta bu zhig yin grang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is like the relation of the produced and the producer.‚Äù

original: mes ni du ba bskyed do //
analyzed: mes ni du ba bskyed do //
translated: Fire produces smoke.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are related by the characteristic of cause and effect.

original: de ltar 'brel pa rnam pa gsum brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa rnam pa gsum brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the three types of relations,

original: dkyus ma dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyus ma dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to apply this to the present case,

original: dngos po yod pa dang med pa dag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dang med pa dag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWith regard to existent and nonexistent things,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa dang / ji ltar du ba dang me dag 'brel pa ji skad bshad pa rnams ltar phyogs dang bum pa med pa dag la ni phan tshun rgyu gang gis na gzhan yod pa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bum pa med pa dgag pa'i mtshan nyid 'di sgrub par 'gyur ba'i 'brelüîΩpa de lta bu 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa dang / ji ltar du ba dang me dag 'brel pa ji skad bshad pa rnams ltar phyogs dang bum pa med pa dag la ni phan tshun rgyu gang gis na gzhan yod pa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bum pa med pa dgag pa'i mtshan nyid 'di sgrub par 'gyur ba'i 'brel pa de lta bu 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Just as smoke and fire are related, as explained above, in the case of the nonexistence of a pot and the nonexistence of a place, there is no relation whatsoever by which the existence of one is established by the definition of the other, the definition of the nonexistence of a pot being the characteristic of a place.

original: ji ltar bum pa med pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir gang du yang 'du ba med la /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa med pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir gang du yang 'du ba med la /
translated: Because the nonexistence of a pot is a nonthing, it does not inhere in anything.

original: dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is a nonthing,

original: 'di rten 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rten 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: it does not rely on anything.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: In response to the qualms of others,

original: gal te yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it might be said that the state of being object and object possessor exists and so on.

original: de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po'i 'brel pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po'i 'brel pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: And the nonexistence of one and the existence of another are related as object and subject.

original: @157b 'di ltar phyogs na bum pa med par shes so //
analyzed: @157b 'di ltar phyogs na bum pa med par shes so //
translated: Thus, one knows that a pot does not exist in a certain place.

original: de lta bas na gzhan yod pa ni yul yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan yod pa ni yul yin la /
translated: Therefore, the existence of another is the object,

original: bum pa med pa ni yul can yin pa la /
analyzed: bum pa med pa ni yul can yin pa la /
translated: and the nonexistence of a pot is the subject.

original: 'di gnyis yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
translated: These two are related as object and subject.

original: dper na sgra dang don dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra dang don dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the relation of sound and meaning.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yul la shing ljon pa'i sgra sbyor la /
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yul la shing ljon pa'i sgra sbyor la /
translated: The word ‚Äútree‚Äù is applied to an object that possesses branches, etc.üîΩAnd those two are related as object and subject.üîΩThe same is true here.

original: de gnyis kyang yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'gre'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'gre'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The Proponents of the Doctrines of theüîΩNon-Buddhist schools say:üîΩSound and meaning are related as

original: sgra dang don dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: designator and designated.

original: sgra dang don dag ni yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don ston par sems na shing ljon pa'i sgra sbyor bas 'brel par rigs te /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag ni yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don ston par sems na shing ljon pa'i sgra sbyor bas 'brel par rigs te /
translated: If you think that the word and meaning are related in that the word expresses the meaning that possesses branches, etc., then it is logical to apply the word tree,

original: 'di ltar sgra de dang yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don der lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra de dang yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don der lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod do //
translated: because the word and the meaning that possesses branches, etc. are related in that they have the nature of cause and effect.

original: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pa yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don ston par sems na /üîΩshing ljon pa'i sgra sbyor ba de'i phyir don de lta bu brjod par 'dod na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pa yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don ston par sems na / shing ljon pa'i sgra sbyor ba de'i phyir don de lta bu brjod par 'dod na /
translated: If you think that the word expresses the meaning that possesses branches, etc., which is the object of desire,

original: sgra sbyor bas sgra ni 'bras bu yin la rgyu ni brjod par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba grub la /
analyzed: sgra sbyor bas sgra ni 'bras bu yin la rgyu ni brjod par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba grub la /
translated: then because you apply the word tree, it is established that the word is the effect and the object of desire is the cause.

original: don de lta bur brjod par 'dod pa med na /
analyzed: don de lta bur brjod par 'dod pa med na /
translated: If you do not desire to express that meaning,

original: shing ljon pa'i sgra mi sbyor bas 'di gnyis la med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang srid do //
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i sgra mi sbyor bas 'di gnyis la med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang srid do //
translated: you would not apply the word tree, and it is possible that the two are related in that they have the nature of not occurring if the other is absent.

original: sgra dang don dag gi rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid mod kyi /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid mod kyi /
translated: If the thing that is the cause and effect of the word and the referent does not exist, it does not arise.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dor byas nas med na mi 'byung ba logs shig tu nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dor byas nas med na mi 'byung ba logs shig tu nye bar bkod de /
translated: However, having discarded the thought of others, nonarising is posited separately.

original: gzhan dag ni med na mi 'byung ba /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni med na mi 'byung ba /
translated: Others assert that nonarising

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa las logs shig tu 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa las logs shig tu 'dod do //
translated: is separate from the connection of cause and effect.

original: de lta bas na 'di bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩgang gi tshe brjod par 'dod pa la gsal bar snang ba'i don de na yod pa nyid du sgro btags pa phyi rol gyi don dang tha mi dad par byas nas brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni sgra dang don dag dngos su rgyu dang
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te / gang gi tshe brjod par 'dod pa la gsal bar snang ba'i don de na yod pa nyid du sgro btags pa phyi rol gyi don dang tha mi dad par byas nas brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni sgra dang don dag dngos su rgyu dang
translated: Thus this is the meaning of the summary:üîΩWhen the referent that appears clearly to one who wishes to speak is imputed to exist there, having made it undifferentiated from an external object, it is the referent.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
translated: At that time, the word and the referent are the actual cause and effect.

original: 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa la gsal bar snang ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir sgra sbyor bar 'dod do zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa la gsal bar snang ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir sgra sbyor bar 'dod do zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung yin no //
translated: This is our own position: ‚ÄúWhen one wishes to express something, one wishes to employ a sound in order to indicate the object that appears clearly.

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gyi gzhung la ltos nas phyi'i don brjod par bya ba yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe yang brgyud pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan gyi gzhung la ltos nas phyi'i don brjod par bya ba yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe yang brgyud pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äù Even when one wishes to express an external object in dependence on another‚Äôs treatise, there is still a causal relation between them.

original: 'di ltar don las ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don las ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the object is seen.

original: mthong ba las ni brjod par 'dod pa yin no //üîΩbrjod par 'dod pa @158a * //
analyzed: mthong ba las ni brjod par 'dod pa yin no // brjod par 'dod pa @158a * //
translated: From seeing, there is a wish to express.

original: las ni rtsol ba yin no //
analyzed: las ni rtsol ba yin no //
translated: From the wish to express, there is effort.

original: rtsol ba las ni rlung yin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba las ni rlung yin no //
translated: From effort, there is wind.

original: rlung las ni gnas gzhan du thug pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung las ni gnas gzhan du thug pa yin no //
translated: From wind, there is contact with another place.

original: de las ni sgra 'grub par brgyud pa yin no //
analyzed: de las ni sgra 'grub par brgyud pa yin no //
translated: From that, sound is produced.

original: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention of the author of the treatise.

original: 'di la dngos su rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di la dngos su rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Here, there is a direct causal relation between them.

original: de yod na gzhan dag gis gzhan yongs su btags pa gang yin pa de yang yin te /
analyzed: de yod na gzhan dag gis gzhan yongs su btags pa gang yin pa de yang yin te /
translated: If it exists, then whatever is imagined by others as something else is also that.

original: ming la log par rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: ming la log par rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do snyam pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he thinks that it is only a mistaken conception in regard to the name.

original: de la 'di snyam du de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag kyang de lta bu yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag kyang de lta bu yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that nonexistence and existence are also like that,

original: de'i phyir rnam pa 'di yang 'di la med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa 'di yang 'di la med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then in order to demonstrate that this aspect is not present in this case, he says, this is not possible, etc.

original: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa'i rnam pa nye bar bstan pa gang yin pa 'di ni de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la mi srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa'i rnam pa nye bar bstan pa gang yin pa 'di ni de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la mi srid pa kho na'o //
translated: This aspect of the relation between the word and the object that is taught is not possible in regard to nonexistence and existence.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar de gnyis yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar de gnyis yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could these two be related by the character of object and subject?

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: de'i phyir de gnyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos por grub na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos por grub na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, if they were established as the entities of the object to be established and the means of establishment, etc.

original: gang gi tshe de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dngos por grub pa yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dngos po'i sgo nas yul dang yul can gyi dngos por 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dngos por grub pa yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dngos po'i sgo nas yul dang yul can gyi dngos por 'gyur na /
translated: When the nonexistence of that and the existence of another are established as the object to be established and the means of establishing, then, in terms of the object to be established and the means of establishing, there would be the relation of object and subject.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos po de nyid ni 'brel pa med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos po de nyid ni 'brel pa med par mi 'grub po //
translated: But that object to be established and means of establishing are not established without a relation.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos po de ma grub na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos po de ma grub na /
translated: If that object to be established and means of establishing are not established,

original: de'i rgyu can yul dang yul can gyi dngos po lta rgyangs bcad de por ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can yul dang yul can gyi dngos po lta rgyangs bcad de por ba yin no //
translated: then the relation of object and subject, which is based on them, is also cut off.

original: gal te yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos pos byas pa nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos por gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos pos byas pa nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i dngos por gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: But if the object to be established and the means of establishing are made by the relation of object and subject, what is the fault?

original: de'i phyir de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it were not so,

original: 'di gcig la gcig brten pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di gcig la gcig brten pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then this would be a case of mutual dependence.‚Äù

original: de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po ma gtogs pa 'brel pa gzhan mi 'dod na /
analyzed: de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po ma gtogs pa 'brel pa gzhan mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept any other relation between the existent object and the existent consciousness, apart from the fact that one exists and the other does not,üîΩ

original: de'i tshe gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept any other relation between the two than that of object and subject, and if one does not exist and the other does exist, then the error of mutual dependence would ensue.

original: 'di ltar yul dang yul can yod par bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang yul can yod par bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa yod la /
translated: Thus, the existence of object and subject would be established, and the existence of the object to be established and the means of establishment would be established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa yod pas kyang yul dang yul can yod pas gcig la gcig brten pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa yod pas kyang yul dang yul can yod pas gcig la gcig brten pa nyid yin no //
translated: And, since the object to be established and the means of establishment exist, the existence of object and subject would be established. Thus, there would be mutual dependence.

original: gcig la gcig brten pa dag ni nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten pa dag ni nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But mutual dependence is not tenable.

original: dper na gru la grub bcings pa gcig la gcig skyob par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gru la grub bcings pa gcig la gcig skyob par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like two boats in a river, each tied to the other: neither can reach the near shore, nor can they go to the far shore.

original: 'thad pa gzhan @158b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'thad pa gzhan @158b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another absurdity, he says:

original: gzhan yod pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of one thing is established in dependence upon the nonexistence of another,‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhan yod pas bum pa med par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe chos 'ba' zhig bsgrub pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhan yod pas bum pa med par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe chos 'ba' zhig bsgrub pa yin pas /
translated: because the existence of one thing is established in dependence upon the nonexistence of another, for example, the existence of the absence of a pot is established in dependence upon the existence of a place that is devoid of a pot.

original: spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
