translated: There would be the fault that the general is not established.

original: 'di ltar yon tan dang gtso bos dngos por rnam par gnas pa chos dang chos can spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan dang gtso bos dngos por rnam par gnas pa chos dang chos can spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid 'dod kyi /
translated: Thus, it is maintained that the general is established, the property and the subject that are the entities that are the bases of qualities and the chief.

original: chos sam chos can 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos sam chos can 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not maintained that the property or the subject alone is established.

original: gal te bum pa med pa 'ba' zhig bsgrub par 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa med pa 'ba' zhig bsgrub par 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If it were established that the vase alone does not exist, what would be wrong with that?

original: de'i phyir / de lta yin na ni de las gzhan pa yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de lta yin na ni de las gzhan pa yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúIn that case, because it exists, it is not tenable to say that the vase does not exist in that place.‚Äù

original: gal te 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur na de'i tshe tshig gi don 'di rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur na de'i tshe tshig gi don 'di rnam par gnas te /
translated: If it were established that the vase alone does not exist, then the meaning of the words would be as follows.

original: sa phyogs dben pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa phyogs dben pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the place is empty of the nature of the vase,

original: khams gsum na bum pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: khams gsum na bum pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: there is no vase whatsoever in the three realms.

original: de lta na bum pa yul thams cad na dus thams cad du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bum pa yul thams cad na dus thams cad du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the vase would not exist in all places and at all times.

original: bum pa'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The object, the pot, would not exist.

original: 'dir pha rol gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Here, anticipating the opponent‚Äôs words, he says,

original: gal te ma yin te phyogs la sogs pa chos can gyi khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te ma yin te phyogs la sogs pa chos can gyi khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say that it is not so, that the subject is qualified by the property to be established, such as ‚Äòdirection,‚Äô etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the liberation from that,

original: 'di snyam du phyogs la sogs pa chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du phyogs la sogs pa chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe subject, ‚Äòdirection,‚Äô etc.‚Äù

original: phyogs zhes bya ba'i chos can gang yin pa de nyid khyad par du 'gyur ba'i bum pa med pa sgrub par byed kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba'i chos can gang yin pa de nyid khyad par du 'gyur ba'i bum pa med pa sgrub par byed kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: The subject called ‚Äúdirection‚Äù is qualified by the property to be established, ‚Äúthe nonexistence of the pot,‚Äù and not by itself alone.

original: de'i phyir spyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, the error of not establishing the universal does not occur.

original: phyogs 'di la ni rtags dang rtags can dag 'brel ba med pa'i nyes pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni rtags dang rtags can dag 'brel ba med pa'i nyes pa yang mi srid de /
translated: And in this case, the error of the reason and the property to be proven being unrelated is also not possible.

original: 'di ltar rtags nyid khas blangs pa gzhan yod pa dang phyogs la sogs pa chos can du 'brel par yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtags nyid khas blangs pa gzhan yod pa dang phyogs la sogs pa chos can du 'brel par yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Thus, the reason itself is only related to the subject, such as the other, the locus, etc.,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because it is the nature of an entity.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bsam yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bsam yin te /
translated: The proponent of tenets thinks this.

original: phyogs la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe locus, etc., itself‚Äù and so on is made.

original: 'dir chos can gzhan la rtags nyid du 'dod pa gzhan yod pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir chos can gzhan la rtags nyid du 'dod pa gzhan yod pa yang gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here the other that is asserted as the reason in relation to another subject is not different.

original: gzhan ma yin par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known that it is not different?

original: de'i phyir phyogs gang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩphyogs gang kho na na bum pa med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs de nyid bum pa dang 'dres pa med pa'i gzhan yod @159a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / phyogs gang kho na na bum pa med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs de nyid bum pa dang 'dres pa med pa'i gzhan yod @159a * //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe locus itself‚Äù and so on.

original: pa nyid du 'dod cing rtags nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: pa nyid du 'dod cing rtags nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The locus itself, where it is said, ‚ÄúA pot does not exist,‚Äù is asserted as the other that is the absence of mixing with a pot and is asserted as the reason itself.

original: 'di ltar bum pas dben pa'i phyogs mthong ba kho nas rtogs par byed pa 'di phyogs na bum pa med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pas dben pa'i phyogs mthong ba kho nas rtogs par byed pa 'di phyogs na bum pa med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung ngo //
translated: In this way, the mere seeing of the place devoid of pot causes the thought ‚ÄúThere is no pot in this place‚Äù to arise.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar khyad par med pa than ldog pa'i bye brag gis kyang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyogs de kho na rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por rung /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar khyad par med pa than ldog pa'i bye brag gis kyang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyogs de kho na rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por rung /
translated: Therefore, just as a place that is not different from a place that is not devoid of pot is suitable as the basis of the property of the reason and the property to be proven,üîΩin the same way, a place that is not different from a place that is not devoid of pot is suitable as the basis of the property of the reason and the property to be proven.

original: de la 'di snyam du dngos su tha dad pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du dngos su tha dad pa med mod kyi /
translated: If you think that although they are not actually different,

original: 'on kyang spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos por brtag pas rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos por brtag pas rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: nevertheless, because they are conceived as the entities of universals and instances, they become the entities of the reason and the property to be proven,

original: de'i phyir 'dir gang gis na spyi ni gtan tshigs su 'gyur la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gang gis na spyi ni gtan tshigs su 'gyur la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, by what means would a universal be a reason?‚Äù and so on.

original: phyogs de lta bu la ni rgyu gang gis na /
analyzed: phyogs de lta bu la ni rgyu gang gis na /
translated: In such a place, by what means

original: spyi ni gtan tshigs nyid du khas len pa /
analyzed: spyi ni gtan tshigs nyid du khas len pa /
translated: would a universal be accepted as a reason?

original: khyad par ni chos can nyid du khas len par 'gyur ba'i spyi dang khyad par du brtag pa ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: khyad par ni chos can nyid du khas len par 'gyur ba'i spyi dang khyad par du brtag pa ni mi 'thad do //
translated: In particular, it is not tenable to impute a universal and a particular as the very subject.

original: ci'i phyir phyi dang khyad par du yongs su brtag pa mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyi dang khyad par du yongs su brtag pa mi srid ce na /
translated: Why is it impossible to impute a universal and a particular as the subject?

original: de'i phyir / de'i khyad par rtogs pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i khyad par rtogs pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúIt is only the apprehension of its particular,‚Äù and so on.

original: bum pa dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par chos can nyid du yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de lta bu rtogs pa kho nas bum pa med pa'i rtogs pa'i phyir rgyus phyogs kyi spyi gtan tshigs kyi dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par chos can nyid du yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de lta bu rtogs pa kho nas bum pa med pa'i rtogs pa'i phyir rgyus phyogs kyi spyi gtan tshigs kyi dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Since the apprehension of the particular of a place that is empty of a pot is only the apprehension of the absence of a pot, the universal of a place is not the property of the reason.

original: de la 'di snyam du phyogs kyi khyad par de nyid gzhan du yang 'jug pa'i phyir spyi yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du phyogs kyi khyad par de nyid gzhan du yang 'jug pa'i phyir spyi yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that since that particular of a place also occurs elsewhere, it is a universal,

original: de'i phyir / de la rjes su 'gro ba yang med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de la rjes su 'gro ba yang med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúBecause it does not pervade that.‚Äù

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yongs su snang ba de lta bu la ni gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yongs su snang ba de lta bu la ni gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: In that way, the appearance of a place devoid of a pot does not pervade other places.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po yin /
translated: Therefore, how could it be the universal and particular of a pot?

original: gtan tshigs gzhan dam bcas pa'i phyir phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan dam bcas pa'i phyir phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, Dharmottara says, ‚ÄúBecause it is a part of the thesis,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kho na chos can ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kho na chos can ma yin la /
translated: At the time when only a place devoid of a pot is not the subject,

original: de nyid rtags nyid du yang brjod pa de'i tshe /üîΩdam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rtags nyid du yang brjod pa de'i tshe / dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and that very [place] is stated as the reason,

original: 'di rtags nyid ga la yin /
analyzed: 'di rtags nyid ga la yin /
translated: then how could it be the reason, because it is a part of the thesis?

original: gal te phyogs kyi khyad par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /üîΩrtags yin par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs kyi khyad par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir / rtags yin par mi 'dod na /
translated: If it is not accepted as the reason because it does not pervade the subject and because it is a part of the thesis,

original: 'on te phyogs kyi spyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs kyi spyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: then if one thinks that the universal of the subject becomes the reason,üîΩ[Dharmakƒ´rti] says, ‚ÄúIf the universal of the subject is the reason,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir / gang na phyogs tsam yod pa de na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang na phyogs tsam yod pa de na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúWhere there is a part of that, there is that.‚Äù

original: gang dag gang na phyogs tsam yod pa de dang de na bum pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gang na phyogs tsam yod pa de dang de na bum pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Where there is a part of that, there is not an absence of that.

original: de lta bas na 'khrul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khrul pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of error,

original: @159b phyogs kyi spyi yang gtan tshigs ma yin no //üîΩpha rol gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: @159b phyogs kyi spyi yang gtan tshigs ma yin no // pha rol gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: a universal of a part is not a logical reason.

original: gal te phyogs 'ba' zhig yin pa de lta bu na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te phyogs 'ba' zhig yin pa de lta bu na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to anticipate the opponent‚Äôs assertion, it is said: ‚ÄúIf it were just a part of that . . .‚Äù

original: phyogs tsam ni ha cang spyi yid ches pas 'khrul pa yang bden na /
analyzed: phyogs tsam ni ha cang spyi yid ches pas 'khrul pa yang bden na /
translated: If a mere part were a universal, then because of the error of overextension,

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig yin pa de lta bu gzhan yang yod pa gang yin pa de na bum pa med pa nyid du 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig yin pa de lta bu gzhan yang yod pa gang yin pa de na bum pa med pa nyid du 'khrul pa med do //
translated: where there is an absence of a pot, there would be no error in saying that a pot does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi spyi de lta bu ni gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi spyi de lta bu ni gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: Therefore, a universal of a part that is devoid of a pot is a logical reason,

original: de la ni 'khrul pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni 'khrul pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: because there is no error in that.‚Äù This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThat alone, etc.‚Äù

original: phyogs 'ba' zhig ces bya ba gang yin pa de nyid bum pa dang bral ba zhes mi bya'am /
analyzed: phyogs 'ba' zhig ces bya ba gang yin pa de nyid bum pa dang bral ba zhes mi bya'am /
translated: Is it not the case that what is called ‚Äúthat alone‚Äù is also free from the pot?

original: byar zad mod /
analyzed: byar zad mod /
translated: It is indeed so.

original: nyes ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: nyes ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault?

original: 'dir rtags su gyur pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir rtags su gyur pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here he says, ‚ÄúThat evidence, etc.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba 'dir rtags nyid du 'dod pa bum pa dang 'bral ba'i phyogs de yang phyogs rtogs pa'i dus de kho na na grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba 'dir rtags nyid du 'dod pa bum pa dang 'bral ba'i phyogs de yang phyogs rtogs pa'i dus de kho na na grub pa yin no //
translated: In this proof by non-observation, the position that is free from the pot, which is asserted to be the evidence, is established at just the time that the position is realized.

original: de'i phyir phyogs 'ba' zhig po de dag gi rtags su 'dod par bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs 'ba' zhig po de dag gi rtags su 'dod par bya /
translated: Therefore, that alone is asserted to be the evidence.

original: 'di nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan rjes su 'gro ba smos pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan rjes su 'gro ba smos pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, the reason for the other entailment is stated. He says, ‚ÄúAlso, etc.‚Äù

original: gang dag gang na phyogs 'ba' zhig yod pa de dang de na bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu rjes su 'gro ba smos pa gang yin pa de yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag gang na phyogs 'ba' zhig yod pa de dang de na bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu rjes su 'gro ba smos pa gang yin pa de yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the statement of the pervasion, ‚ÄúWhatever is found only in a certain place, there the pot does not exist,‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: 'di ltar rtags su gyur pa'i phyogs rtogs pa kho na bum pa dang bral ba grub na rjes su 'gro bas lhag par ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtags su gyur pa'i phyogs rtogs pa kho na bum pa dang bral ba grub na rjes su 'gro bas lhag par ci zhig bya /
translated: Thus, if the mere realization of the place that is the evidence establishes the absence of the pot, what is the point of the pervasion?

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: To conclude,

original: de lta bas na gzhan yod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan yod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, when the other exists, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas 'brel pa med pa de'i phyir dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan yod pa ni bum pa med pa'i sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas 'brel pa med pa de'i phyir dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan yod pa ni bum pa med pa'i sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Since there is no relation in the way that has been explained, it is established that the existence of the other, which is the definition of absence, is not the proof of the absence of the pot.

original: yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Again, anticipating an opportunity for an objection by the opponent,

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'brel pa yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'brel pa yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf there is a relation of contradiction, etc.‚Äù

original: de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag la 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: and the absence of that and the existence of another are related by the nature of contradiction.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan yod pa las dngos po med pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan yod pa las dngos po med pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of being related by the nature of contradiction, non-existence is established from the existence of another. This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says, ‚ÄúBecause contradiction is impossible,

original: dri bar / gang zhig gang dang 'gal zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dri bar / gang zhig gang dang 'gal zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: what contradicts what?‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba bum pa med pa @160a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bum pa med pa @160a * //
translated: The probandum is the non-existence of a pot.üîΩThe reason is the place where it is to be established.

original: dang gtan tshigs phyogs dag / gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'gal ba brjod dgos so //üîΩpha rol pos 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang gtan tshigs phyogs dag / gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'gal ba brjod dgos so // pha rol pos 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: What contradicts what?üîΩThe opponent says,

original: gzhan yod pa dang zla bor ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa dang zla bor ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of another and its opposite.‚Äù

original: bum pas dben pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs dang zla bo bum pa dang lhan cig 'gal lo //
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs dang zla bo bum pa dang lhan cig 'gal lo //
translated: The place that is the nature of being devoid of a pot and its opposite, the pot, are mutually exclusive.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says,üîΩ‚ÄúIf that is so, then tell me what is the opposite of the non-existence of a pot?‚Äù

original: ci gang gis na rtags dang rtags can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci gang gis na rtags dang rtags can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is the reason that the sign and the property-possessor are called contradictory?

original: kye ci 'dir gang gis na rtags dang rtags can dag 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin par brjod pa /
analyzed: kye ci 'dir gang gis na rtags dang rtags can dag 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin par brjod pa /
translated: Oh, here, what is the reason that the sign and the property-possessor are said to be related by the characteristic of contradiction?

original: dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa la bum pa yod par gzhal bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: dben pa'i phyogs dmigs pa la bum pa yod par gzhal bar 'dod dam /
translated: Do you assert that the existence of a pot is cognized in a place devoid of pot?

original: 'dir zla bo bum pa med par sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dir zla bo bum pa med par sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Here, is not the absence of pot, the counter-correlate, established?

original: de ni dben pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhan yod pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ni dben pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhan yod pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba med do //
translated: That is not contradictory with the other-existence characterized by a place devoid of pot.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: Why is it not contradictory?

original: lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they coexist, it is said.

original: 'di ltar bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dang bum pa med pa dang lhan cig gnas pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pas dben pa'i phyogs dang bum pa med pa dang lhan cig gnas pa mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, a place devoid of pot and the absence of pot are seen to coexist.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to conclude,

original: gzhal bya de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhal bya de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, In that object of cognition, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe 'dir bum pa med pa kho na dben pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs dmigs pas 'jal bar byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dir bum pa med pa kho na dben pa'i ngo bo'i phyogs dmigs pas 'jal bar byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one observes the mere absence of a pot here, the nature of emptiness, at that time,

original: gzhal bya de la rtags dang rtags can dag ji ltar 'gal /
analyzed: gzhal bya de la rtags dang rtags can dag ji ltar 'gal /
translated: how could the evidence and the evidential sign be contradictory with respect to that object of apprehension?

original: de'i phyir 'dir de gnyis 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir de gnyis 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in this case, there is no relationship between the two.

original: de ltar 'brel pa med par bstan nas ;
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa med par bstan nas ;
translated: Having thus demonstrated the absence of a relationship,

original: nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate another fault,

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, in this case,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'i phyogs 'di la yang spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i nyes pa ni de'i so na 'dug pa nyid do //üîΩyang pha rol pos mi 'dod pa brjod pas brgal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'i phyogs 'di la yang spyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i nyes pa ni de'i so na 'dug pa nyid do // yang pha rol pos mi 'dod pa brjod pas brgal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In this case, where the relationship is characterized by contradiction, the fault that the general property is not established remains.

original: de med par dang gzhan yod pa dag 'brel pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de med par dang gzhan yod pa dag 'brel pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to refute the opponent‚Äôs assertion, he says, ‚ÄúIf the absence of that and the existence of something else are not related,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag phan tshun cung zad kyang 'brel par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag phan tshun cung zad kyang 'brel par mi 'dod na /
translated: If the absence of that and the existence of something else are not related in the slightest,üîΩthen how could the absence of that be the existence of something else?

original: de'i tshe gzhan yod pa rtogs kyang de med pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan yod pa rtogs kyang de med pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: At that time, even though the existence of the other is realized, the nonexistence of that is not realized.

original: gzhan yod pa ni de med pa'i shes par byed pa yin par ni 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa ni de med pa'i shes par byed pa yin par ni 'dod do //
translated: But it is accepted that the existence of the other makes one understand the nonexistence of that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The Proponents of the Tenets of the Middle Way say:

original: 'brel ba gang las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gis na nyes pa mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba med na mi 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'brel ba gang las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gis na nyes pa mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba med na mi 'byung ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom no connection whatsoever.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba'am / gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'am / gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: If there were a connection, such as that of being inseparable or being contradictory or being different,üîΩthen the existence of the other would make one understand the nonexistence of that.

original: 'brel pa gang las kyang gzhan yod pa de de med pa'i shes par byed pa yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'brel pa gang las kyang gzhan yod pa de de med pa'i shes par byed pa yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: But we do not accept that the existence of the other makes one understand the nonexistence of that from any connection whatsoever.

original: gal te 'brel pa'i @160b sgo nas shes par byed pa yin par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa'i @160b sgo nas shes par byed pa yin par mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that the existence of the other makes one understand the nonexistence of that from the point of view of a connection,

original: 'o na ji ltar shes par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar shes par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: then how do you understand the existence of the other to make one understand the nonexistence of that?üîΩThe Proponents of the Tenets of the Middle Way say:

original: 'on kyang gzhan yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan yod pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of the other is the nonexistence of that.‚Äù

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yod pa nyid du bum pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yod pa nyid du bum pa med pa yin te /
translated: The existence of a place that is empty of a pot is the nonexistence of a pot.

original: 'di ni de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo can de'i de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma kho nas gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar skabs 'dir bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni de las gzhan pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo can de'i de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma kho nas gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar skabs 'dir bshad zin to //
translated: This is because the exclusion of other is established by the valid cognition that posits the suchness of that entity which is unrelated to anything else.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this very point, he says:

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe entity that is unrelated to other . . .‚Äù

original: phyogs la sogs pa gzhan yod pa bum pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo de'o //
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa gzhan yod pa bum pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo de'o //
translated: The entity that is unrelated to the existence of other, such as the directions, is that of the pot.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni dben pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni dben pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlone‚Äù means the entity that is isolated.

original: bdag nyid gcig tu rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid so sor nges pa la rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig tu rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid so sor nges pa la rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in a single nature‚Äù means abiding in a nature that is individually determined.

original: tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par bshad do //
translated: These two phrases explain the entity that is unrelated.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de ji skad bshad pa de'i bdag nyid du yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de nyid bum pa la sogs pa gzhan rnam par gcod pa dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de ji skad bshad pa de'i bdag nyid du yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de nyid bum pa la sogs pa gzhan rnam par gcod pa dgag pa yin no //
translated: That which is such, and which is the determination of the nature of what has been explained, is itself the exclusion of the negation of other things such as the pot.

original: de ltar byas na phyogs de 'ba' zhig pa de nyid gzhan bum pa dang bral ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na phyogs de 'ba' zhig pa de nyid gzhan bum pa dang bral ba med pa yin no //
translated: When it is done in this way, that very place itself is the absence of other, the absence of the pot.

original: de lta bas na gzhan pa yod pa nyid du phyogs yod pa nyid de med pa bum pa med pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan pa yod pa nyid du phyogs yod pa nyid de med pa bum pa med pa zhes bya la /
translated: Thus, the existence of the other is the existence of the place, and the absence of the pot is called the absence of the pot.

original: de las gzhan pa rtogs pa nyid phyogs rtogs pa nyid de med par rtogs pa bum pa med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rtogs pa nyid phyogs rtogs pa nyid de med par rtogs pa bum pa med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The very understanding of that which is other is the understanding of the place, and the understanding of the absence of the pot is the understanding of the absence of the pot.

original: bum pa shes pa med pa tsam gyis bum pa med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa shes pa med pa tsam gyis bum pa med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the mere absence of the understanding of the pot is the understanding of the absence of the pot.

original: gal te yang de ltar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar mi 'dod na /
translated: If one does not accept it in this way,

original: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what is the fault?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: de yongs su bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yongs su bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the determination of that . . .‚Äù

original: gal te bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yongs su bcad pas bum pas rnam par mi gcod mi 'gog na de'i tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yongs su bcad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yongs su bcad pas bum pas rnam par mi gcod mi 'gog na de'i tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs yongs su bcad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the side devoid of pot is not differentiated by the pot, then at that time the side devoid of pot would not be differentiated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir / de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause the nature of that and the nature of that which is not that are not differentiated.‚Äù

original: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de dag go //üîΩde dang de ma yin pa dag gi ngo bo ni /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de dag go // de dang de ma yin pa dag gi ngo bo ni /
translated: That and that which is not that are that and those which are not that.

original: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag ste /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag ste /
translated: The nature of that and that which is not that is the nature of that and the nature of that which is not that.

original: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir logs shig tu ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir logs shig tu ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of that and the nature of that which is not that are not differentiated, they are not made separate.

original: 'di skad du bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi'i ngo bo de dang bum pa'i ngo bo de ma yin pa 'di @161a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi'i ngo bo de dang bum pa'i ngo bo de ma yin pa 'di @161a * //
translated: This is saying that the nature of the ground devoid of pot and the nature of the pot are not differentiated.üîΩBecause they are not differentiated, there is no differentiation.

original: gnyis gang gi phyir rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa yin pa de'i phyir yongs su gcod pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis gang gi phyir rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa yin pa de'i phyir yongs su gcod pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no determination.

original: gal te rnam par phye nas de yongs su gcod pa ma byas par chud na yang /
analyzed: gal te rnam par phye nas de yongs su gcod pa ma byas par chud na yang /
translated: If, having distinguished it, one does not ascertain it, then what is it?

original: de ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: la lar 'ga' zhig mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: la lar 'ga' zhig mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn some cases, having seen something . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: yul lam dus sam gnas skabs kyi bye brag la lar dngos po 'ga' zhig mthong ba'i 'og tu thob par bya ba'i don dam pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i don gyi tha snyad gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul lam dus sam gnas skabs kyi bye brag la lar dngos po 'ga' zhig mthong ba'i 'og tu thob par bya ba'i don dam pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i don gyi tha snyad gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In some cases, in a particular place, time, or situation, having seen something, one does not engage in the conventional activity of obtaining the thing that is to be obtained or avoiding the thing that is to be avoided.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: me mthong yang gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: me mthong yang gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though one sees fire, by what . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rtogs par byed pa 'dis me mthong yang rgyu gang gis na chu don du gnyer ba me la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba me 'ba' zhig mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa 'dis me mthong yang rgyu gang gis na chu don du gnyer ba me la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba me 'ba' zhig mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: By this mode of understanding, even though one sees fire, one does not engage in the activity of seeking water with respect to fire. It is not that one sees only fire.

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par dbye ba mi byed pa de'i tshe mi mthong yang chu'i ngo bo rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par dbye ba mi byed pa de'i tshe mi mthong yang chu'i ngo bo rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, when the nature of that and not that are not distinguished, then although it is not seen, since the nature of water is not eliminated, it is said that water exists.

original: me 'ba' zhig kho na mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me 'ba' zhig kho na mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In other words, when the nature of that [fire] and the nature of that [water] are not distinguished, then although one does not see water, it is not that one sees only fire, because the nature of water is not eliminated.

original: de'i phyir chu don du gnyer ba me de la 'jug bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chu don du gnyer ba me de la 'jug bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one who seeks water will approach that fire.

original: 'dis chu me las rnam par phye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis chu me las rnam par phye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But this does not distinguish water from fire.

original: 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it approach [water].

original: de lta bas na rang gi ngo bo so sor nges pa'i me yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes ba de nyid kyis chu rnam par bcad pa yang byas par khas blangs dgos so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gi ngo bo so sor nges pa'i me yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes ba de nyid kyis chu rnam par bcad pa yang byas par khas blangs dgos so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it must be accepted that the cognition that determines fire, whose nature is individually ascertained, also eliminates water.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating an opportunity for others to object, he says,

original: gal te mi dmigs pas chu med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pas chu med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that water does not exist because it is not observed,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe me mthong na de na chu mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chu mi dmigs bas me la chu med par shes so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe me mthong na de na chu mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chu mi dmigs bas me la chu med par shes so //
translated: When one sees fire, at that time one does not observe water.üîΩAt that time, because one does not observe water, one knows that there is no water in the fire.

original: de'i phyir chu don du gnyer ba de la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu don du gnyer ba de la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who seeks water does not enter there.üîΩThis is the doubt of the opponent.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the thesis says:

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is this called non-observation?

original: mi dmigs pa'i sgras ci zhig yin pa shes par bya /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sgras ci zhig yin pa shes par bya /
translated: By the word non-observation, what is understood?

original: re zhig gal te chu dmigs pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te chu dmigs pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: First, if it is the non-existence of the observation of water,

original: de'i tshe med pa de dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe med pa de dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: then how can that non-existence, which is a non-entity,

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rtogs pa yin te /
translated: be understood by anyone?

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig yongs su gcod par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig yongs su gcod par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the meaning of how can it be ascertained by anyone?

original: de la 'di snyam du 'di ni 'ga' yang yongs su gcod par byed par mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'di ni 'ga' yang yongs su gcod par byed par mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: It is said that in this case, it is not accepted that it is ascertained by anyone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that non-apprehension is the cause of the determination of non-existence,

original: de'i phyir / rtogs pa'i rgyu yin zhes @161b bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtogs pa'i rgyu yin zhes @161b bya ba smos te /
translated: then in response to that, he says, ‚ÄúIt is the cause of the understanding,‚Äù

original: med pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: because that which is non-existent is not suitable as the cause of the understanding, because it is a non-entity.

original: 'di skad du gal te mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor brten na ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor brten na ni /
translated: In this way, if non-apprehension is taken to be the nature of non-existence,

original: de'i tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, our position is accepted.

original: 'on te med par dgag ba'i ngo bo na ni /üîΩde'i tshe dngos po med pa'i phyir 'ga' yongs su gcod ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te med par dgag ba'i ngo bo na ni / de'i tshe dngos po med pa'i phyir 'ga' yongs su gcod ba'am /
translated: But if it is the nature of an external negation,

original: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: then at that time, because it is a non-entity, it is neither the determination of something nor the cause of the determination.

original: mi dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bor yongs su gzung na tshul gyis thug pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bor yongs su gzung na tshul gyis thug pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if non-apprehension is taken to be the nature of non-existence, there is an infinite regress,

original: de yang ji ltar rtogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rtogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHow is that understood?‚Äù

original: chu dmigs pa med pa de yang ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: chu dmigs pa med pa de yang ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How is that non-apprehension of water understood?

original: re zhig ma rtogs pa ni 'ga'i sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig ma rtogs pa ni 'ga'i sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: First, that which is not understood is not the establishment of anything.

original: shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the cognition of that.

original: gal te de yang de las gzhan pa'i mi dmigs pas rtogs so zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te de yang de las gzhan pa'i mi dmigs pas rtogs so zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is understood through the non-apprehension of something other than that,

original: mi dmigs pa gnyis pa de yang ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gnyis pa de yang ji ltar rtogs /
translated: then how is that second non-apprehension understood?

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the same way, it would be infinite regress if you said that it is understood through the non-apprehension of something other than that.

original: de la 'di snyam du mi dmigs pa ni shes pa med pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du mi dmigs pa ni shes pa med pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: But if you think that non-apprehension is the nature of non-cognition,

original: de ni rang gi ngo bo tsam kho nas shes bya med par ston par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bo tsam kho nas shes bya med par ston par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: then it would demonstrate the nonexistence of the object of cognition by its own nature alone.

original: de'i phyir / de'am de las gzhan pa yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par 'dod pa'am de la ma gtogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'am de las gzhan pa yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par 'dod pa'am de la ma gtogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: In response to that, Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúIt is neither that nor something other than that,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIf you assert that the nature of nonexistence is known or that something other than that is known,

original: 'ga' yang ma gtogs par yang dngos po med pa rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma gtogs par yang dngos po med pa rtogs pa yin na /
translated: then even without including anything at all, nonexistence would be known.

original: de'i tshe gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu 'gro ba thams cad kyis ji ste dngos po med pa rtogs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu 'gro ba thams cad kyis ji ste dngos po med pa rtogs par mi 'gyur /
translated: At that time, in the situation of sleeping and so on, how could all beings realize the nonexistence of things?

original: 'di ltar dngos po thams cad ni de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bor phung por gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po thams cad ni de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bor phung por gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa /
translated: Thus all things are posited as a collection of two types: that which is and that which is not.

original: gal te mi dmigs pas kyang de'am de las gzhan pa ma gtogs par yang dngos po med pa rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pas kyang de'am de las gzhan pa ma gtogs par yang dngos po med pa rtogs na /
translated: If one realizes the nonexistence of things by nonapprehending, then apart from that which is and that which is not,

original: de'i tshe thal ba 'dis 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe thal ba 'dis 'gyur te /
translated: at that time this consequence would follow:

original: 'di ni tshad ma rnam par gtan la dbab par dpyad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma rnam par gtan la dbab par dpyad zin to //
translated: This has already been analyzed in the Ascertainment of Valid Knowledge.

original: gnyid log pa dang myos pa dang brgyal ba dang chod pa dang rgyab kyis phyogs pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te ;
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang myos pa dang brgyal ba dang chod pa dang rgyab kyis phyogs pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsleeping, intoxicated, fainting, obstructed, and turned away‚Äù should be applied.

original: de dag gi gnas skabs la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas skabs la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those situations are called that.

original: de la gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na gnyid mthug pos non pa la yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: de la gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na gnyid mthug pos non pa la yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: In the situation of sleeping, one is overcome by deep sleep and lacks the capacity to apprehend objects.

original: myos pa'i gnas skabs na myos bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas spyad pas de'i stobs kyis sems la yul rtogs pa'i nus pa dang bral lo //üîΩbrgyal @162a * //
analyzed: myos pa'i gnas skabs na myos bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas spyad pas de'i stobs kyis sems la yul rtogs pa'i nus pa dang bral lo // brgyal @162a * //
translated: At the time of intoxication, the substance that causes intoxication is used, and by its power, the mind is devoid of the ability to cognize objects.

original: ba'i gnas skabs na gnad du rgyab pas sam /
analyzed: ba'i gnas skabs na gnad du rgyab pas sam /
translated: At the time of fainting, the vital points are struck,

original: rlung la sogs pa ma mnyam pas yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa ma mnyam pas yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: or due to imbalances of wind and so forth, there is no ability to apprehend objects.

original: chod pa'i gnas skabs na yul gyis bskal bas sam thogs par byed pa'i rdzas kyis bsgribs pas yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang bral lo //
analyzed: chod pa'i gnas skabs na yul gyis bskal bas sam thogs par byed pa'i rdzas kyis bsgribs pas yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang bral lo //
translated: At the time of obstruction, the ability to apprehend objects is lost due to being separated from or obscured by obstructing substances.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i gnas skabs na brjod par 'dod pa'i yul 'dzin par nus pa med do //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i gnas skabs na brjod par 'dod pa'i yul 'dzin par nus pa med do //
translated: At the time of turning away, there is no ability to apprehend the desired object.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: The phrase and so on

original: mun nag la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mun nag la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med par blta bar bya'o //
translated: indicates that in the context of darkness and so forth, there is no ability to apprehend objects.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: To summarize,

original: de lta bas na 'dis me mthong yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis me mthong yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says Therefore, even though one sees fire... and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par dbye ba mi byed pa de'i phyir /üîΩrtogs bar byed pa 'dis me mthong yang 'di ni me kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par dbye ba mi byed pa de'i phyir / rtogs bar byed pa 'dis me mthong yang 'di ni me kho na yin gyi /
translated: Because the nature of that and not that are not distinguished,üîΩalthough one sees fire by means of that cognition, one does not understand it as distinguished in this way: ‚ÄúThis is fire,

original: 'di ni chu ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bur rnam par phye nas ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: 'di ni chu ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bur rnam par phye nas ma rtogs pas /
translated: but it is not water.‚Äù

original: me don du gnyer ba 'dug par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: me don du gnyer ba 'dug par yang mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not remain in that place seeking fire.

original: 'o na ci zhe na chu ba brtsal ba'i phyir yul de la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na chu ba brtsal ba'i phyir yul de la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: But rather, one should enter that place in order to seek water.

original: chur ma nges pa'i phyir 'gro bar yang mi bya 'phags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chur ma nges pa'i phyir 'gro bar yang mi bya 'phags par mi bya'o //
translated: Because of the uncertainty of water, one should not go or stay there.

original: de ltar na 'jal bar byed pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir nyon mongs 'di /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jal bar byed pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir nyon mongs 'di /
translated: Thus, because the cognition is connected with mutually contradictory actions, this person

original: ci 'gro na rung ngam 'on te 'dug na rung gtol med de /
analyzed: ci 'gro na rung ngam 'on te 'dug na rung gtol med de /
translated: is in a state of uncertainty as to whether he should go or stay.

original: rgal dka' pa'i skabs su chud par gyur to //
analyzed: rgal dka' pa'i skabs su chud par gyur to //
translated: He is in a state of confusion, having entered a place difficult to cross.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating another‚Äôs doubt, he says,

original: gal te gcig mthong ba de kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir chus dben pa'i me gcig pu de kho na mthong ba de'i phyir de la chu med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gcig mthong ba de kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir chus dben pa'i me gcig pu de kho na mthong ba de'i phyir de la chu med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúJust by seeing one,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees just that fire alone, which is devoid of water, therefore one understands that water does not exist there, because there is no other aspect.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: rang gi tshig kho nas pha rol bo rang gi phyogs la gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi tshig kho nas pha rol bo rang gi phyogs la gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the opponent‚Äôs position by his own words,

original: ji ltar gcig mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúJust as one sees,‚Äù etc.

original: ji ltar dngos po gcig mthong bas gzhan med par rtogs par nus /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po gcig mthong bas gzhan med par rtogs par nus /
translated: How can one understand that another does not exist just by seeing one thing?

original: yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Again, anticipating an opportunity for the opponent to speak,

original: gal te de 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir chu dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo me 'ba' zhig kho na rtogs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir chu dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo me 'ba' zhig kho na rtogs pa de'i phyir /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you say, ‚ÄòJust that alone,‚Äô etc.

original: chu med par khong du chud do zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: chu med par khong du chud do zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: Because one understands just that fire alone, which is devoid of the connection with water, therefore one understands that water does not exist.‚Äù This is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets

original: co dri bar /üîΩ'di nyid kho bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: co dri bar / 'di nyid kho bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: scoffs,

original: 'di kho bos dang po kho nar bshad zin na /
analyzed: 'di kho bos dang po kho nar bshad zin na /
translated: saying, ‚ÄúI explained this from the very beginning.‚Äù

original: ci ste khyod de la ma rangs pa ltar sto na /
analyzed: ci ste khyod de la ma rangs pa ltar sto na /
translated: If you are not satisfied with that,

original: gdon mi za @162b bar khyod la 'bros khung gzhan med de /
analyzed: gdon mi za @162b bar khyod la 'bros khung gzhan med de /
translated: then there is no doubt that you have no other escape.

original: de na khyed phug rdugs pas 'di khas len par zad kyi /
analyzed: de na khyed phug rdugs pas 'di khas len par zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, you are forced to accept this because you are cornered.

original: gzu bor gyur pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzu bor gyur pas ni ma yin te /
translated: You do not do so because you are being honest.

original: gong du gzhan nyid ni zhes gcig dang 'brel pa dag phan tshun ltos pa yin no //üîΩde'i phyir de las gzhan pa yod pa nyid de med pa yin la /
analyzed: gong du gzhan nyid ni zhes gcig dang 'brel pa dag phan tshun ltos pa yin no // de'i phyir de las gzhan pa yod pa nyid de med pa yin la /
translated: Previously, you said, ‚ÄúDifference is the relation of mutual dependence of two things.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa dmigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dmigs pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the existence of something different from it does not exist; it is nonexistent.

original: mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad na /
translated: The very perception of something different from it does not exist; it is nonperception.

original: der ni khyed kyis rangs par ma byas la /
analyzed: der ni khyed kyis rangs par ma byas la /
translated: In that case, you are not satisfied with that.

original: de ni phug rdugs pa'i phyir khas len pas 'di ni gzu po'i tshul chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phug rdugs pa'i phyir khas len pas 'di ni gzu po'i tshul chags pa ma yin no //
translated: Because you are cornered, you accept it. Therefore this is not the way of the honest.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: To summarize,

original: de lta bas na 'gram ma mthong ba'i bya bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gram ma mthong ba'i bya bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is like a bird that does not see the shore.

original: ji ltar gru bo cher zhugs pa'i tshong pa rnams kyis 'gram mthong yang ci ma rung snyam nas /
analyzed: ji ltar gru bo cher zhugs pa'i tshong pa rnams kyis 'gram mthong yang ci ma rung snyam nas /
translated: Just as it is well known that merchants who have gone out in a large boat think, ‚ÄúOh, if only we could see the shore!‚Äù

original: bya sbur te gtor bar byed pa de gang gi tshe thams cad du byugs te 'gram ma rnyed pa de'i tshe gru kho nar 'dug par bya ba'i phyir 'ong ngo zhes grags pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya sbur te gtor bar byed pa de gang gi tshe thams cad du byugs te 'gram ma rnyed pa de'i tshe gru kho nar 'dug par bya ba'i phyir 'ong ngo zhes grags pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: and scatter the bird-lime that they are wearing, but when they have smeared it all over and still do not see the shore, they return to the boat, so you should view this matter in the same way.

original: gang gi phyir ring du yang song /üîΩpha rol du yang song yang gdon mi za bar kho bo'i phyogs khas blang dgos pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ring du yang song / pha rol du yang song yang gdon mi za bar kho bo'i phyogs khas blang dgos pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because you have gone far and have gone to the other side,üîΩyou must undoubtedly accept my position.

original: gting tshugs pa med pa can gyi phyogs grub pa ni chung zad kyang mi dgos so //
analyzed: gting tshugs pa med pa can gyi phyogs grub pa ni chung zad kyang mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you do not need to establish a position that has no foundation.

original: gang la gting tshugs pa med pa yod pa de ni gting mi tshugs pa can gyi phyogs bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gting tshugs pa med pa yod pa de ni gting mi tshugs pa can gyi phyogs bsgrub pa'o //
translated: That which has no foundation is the establishment of a position that has no foundation.

original: gting mi tshugs pa zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa dang mthar phyin pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩpha rol bos gal te lha cig yongs su bcad pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gting mi tshugs pa zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa dang mthar phyin pa ma yin pa'o // pha rol bos gal te lha cig yongs su bcad pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot penetrating‚Äù means not ascertained and not final.

original: gal te don gzhan dang 'brel pa med pa'i lus can gyi dngos po gcig yongs su bcad pa kho nas /
analyzed: gal te don gzhan dang 'brel pa med pa'i lus can gyi dngos po gcig yongs su bcad pa kho nas /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf, by the mere elimination of the existence of a god, one thing, the body, which is not related to another object, is eliminated,

original: gzhan dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par 'dod pa rnam par bcad pa 'grub /
analyzed: gzhan dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par 'dod pa rnam par bcad pa 'grub /
translated: and if the nonexistence of another object is asserted, the negation is established.

original: dgag pa grub pa yin na /
analyzed: dgag pa grub pa yin na /
translated: If the negation is established,

original: de'i tshes gzhi la sogs pa yongs su snang ba de na khyad par med par dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yang rung /
analyzed: de'i tshes gzhi la sogs pa yongs su snang ba de na khyad par med par dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yang rung /
translated: then at that time, the appearance of the basis and so on would be observed without distinction.

original: dngos po snang ba la ma gtogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po snang ba la ma gtogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is an object of observation or not,

original: thams cad med par 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thams cad med par 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: everything would be established as nonexistent.

original: shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa nyid kyis rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de 'ba' zhig kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig dang 'brel pa nyid kyis rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de 'ba' zhig kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just the single entity that is related to consciousness, which is similar in being a suitable object, such as a pot, that is not observed.

original: de'i phyir dngos po dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na dngos po med pa bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par du byed pa gang yin pa de yang brjod mi dgos te /üîΩgang gi phyir @163a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na dngos po med pa bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par du byed pa gang yin pa de yang brjod mi dgos te / gang gi phyir @163a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to specify that only the nonobservation of an object that is suitable to be observed is the proof of the absence of an object.

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa yongs su snang ba der dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam par cad pa de'i phyir khyad par 'dis ci zhig bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa yongs su snang ba der dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rnam par cad pa de'i phyir khyad par 'dis ci zhig bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: Because the ground and so on are completely visible, whatever is not suitable to be observed there is also completely visible. Therefore, what is the point of this distinction? This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The Proponents of Inherent Existence say,

original: de'i bdag nyid gcig yongs su bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid gcig yongs su bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one part of the nature of a single entity is ascertained, the other parts are also ascertained.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi rang bzhin dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig kho na yongs su bcad pa yin pa de'i phyir phyogs de'i ngo bo nyid gzhan bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi rang bzhin dben pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig kho na yongs su bcad pa yin pa de'i phyir phyogs de'i ngo bo nyid gzhan bkag pa yin no //
translated: Because the nature of one part is ascertained as being devoid of the nature of another part, therefore the nature of another part is excluded.

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs 'di yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs 'di yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
translated: This part that is devoid of pot is not the nature of another entity.

original: phyogs der khyad par med par gzhan thams cad med par sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs der khyad par med par gzhan thams cad med par sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it does not establish the nonexistence of everything else without distinction in that part.

original: ci phyogs kyi de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid rnam par gcod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci phyogs kyi de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid rnam par gcod par byed ce na /
translated: Does it exclude the nature of that part which is other than that?

original: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúbecause the cognition of that nature appears as ascertained.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi rnam pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa so sor nyams su myong ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi rnam pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa so sor nyams su myong ba /
translated: Because the aspect of the part is experienced as individually ascertained,

original: de'i phyir de'i gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par gcod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par gcod par byed do //
translated: therefore it excludes the nature of another.

original: legs te phyogs 'ba' zhig gi rnam par shes pa yin par chug na yang /
analyzed: legs te phyogs 'ba' zhig gi rnam par shes pa yin par chug na yang /
translated: Granted that the cognition is of the part alone,

original: 'on kyang ci'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid rnam par gcod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ci'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid rnam par gcod pa yin zhe na /
translated: But why is the exclusion of another nature?

original: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúThe nature of that is not the nature of something else.‚Äù

original: phyogs de'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs de'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the essence of that part is not the nature of something else.

original: gal te yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bcad par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bcad par ma gyur na /
translated: But if the exclusion of another nature does not occur,

original: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par ma chad na //
analyzed: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir / gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par ma chad na //
translated: what is the fault?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúIf the exclusion of another nature does not occur,üîΩthen the nature of that would be the nature of something else.‚Äù

original: gal te phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid las gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par ma chad na de'i tshe 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid las gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par ma chad na de'i tshe 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the exclusion of another nature does not occur from the nature of the part, then at that time there would be no engagement and disengagement.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe phyogs kyi ngo bo la dngos po gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bo ma bkag pa yin pa de'i tshe dngos po gzhan don du gnyer ba rnams 'dug par yang mi bya la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe phyogs kyi ngo bo la dngos po gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bo ma bkag pa yin pa de'i tshe dngos po gzhan don du gnyer ba rnams 'dug par yang mi bya la /
translated: So, when the entity of the direction is not refuted as the entity of another thing, then those who seek another thing should neither stay nor go.

original: 'gro bar mi bya ba yin bas snga ma thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar mi bya ba yin bas snga ma thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all of the previous arguments should be applied.

original: de ltar dngos su gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos su gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus directly taught the exclusion of another nature,

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bcad par bya ba la blo'i byed pa bstan ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bcad par bya ba la blo'i byed pa bstan ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the activity of the mind in the exclusion of another nature,

original: yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn terms of place, time, nature, and occasion,‚Äù and so on.

original: yul du nges pa @163b dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu nges nges ba'i dngos po sngon po la sogs pa de blos yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid du yongs
analyzed: yul du nges pa @163b dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu nges nges ba'i dngos po sngon po la sogs pa de blos yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid du yongs
translated: The entity of the object, such as blue, which is ascertained in terms of place, time, nature, and the particular occasion, is ascertained by the mind as having the nature of being ascertained individually in terms of the particularities of place, time, nature, and occasion.

original: su gcod na dngos po snang ba las bzlog pa dngos po gzhan 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: su gcod na dngos po snang ba las bzlog pa dngos po gzhan 'gog par byed do //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is eliminated?‚Äù it is the elimination of another entity that is the opposite of the appearance of an entity.

original: yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid gnas skabs zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te de dag tu nges pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid gnas skabs zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te de dag tu nges pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin terms of place, time, and nature‚Äù should be applied to the phrase ‚Äúin terms of state.‚Äù They are ascertained in those terms.

original: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs par nges pa'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs par nges pa'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn terms of its nature‚Äù means in terms of the nature that is ascertained in terms of place and so on.

original: de'i de kho na nyid med pa zhes bya ba la de kho na'i ngo bo ni de kho na nyid de yul la sogs pa'i so sor nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na med pa ni yul gzhan la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid med pa zhes bya ba la de kho na'i ngo bo ni de kho na nyid de yul la sogs pa'i so sor nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na med pa ni yul gzhan la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of its suchness‚Äù means that the nature of suchness is the nature that is ascertained individually in terms of place and so on. The absence of suchness is the nature of another place and so on.

original: 'di skad du yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs nges pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan gang yin pa de rnam par gcod do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs nges pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan gang yin pa de rnam par gcod do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In other words, it is the elimination of the nature of blue and so on that is ascertained in terms of place, time, nature, and state.

original: yang ci'i phyir de kho na nyid med pa rnam par gcod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de kho na nyid med pa rnam par gcod ce na /
translated: Why is the absence of suchness eliminated?

original: de'i phyir / gal te gzhan gyi dngos po rnams par bcad par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te gzhan gyi dngos po rnams par bcad par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúIf the other is eliminated,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs gzhan gang yin pa de bkag pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs gzhan gang yin pa de bkag pa yin na /
translated: If the other‚Äîthe place, time, nature, and situation‚Äîis eliminated,

original: de lta na yul la sogs pa nges pa'i sngon po 'di blo des yongs su bcad pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yul la sogs pa nges pa'i sngon po 'di blo des yongs su bcad pa yang yin la /
translated: then in that case, this blue that is ascertained as the place and so on is also excluded by that awareness.

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyang de kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyang de kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: And the reality that is characterized by the ascertainment of the place and so on is also just that,

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: but it is not the other.

original: 'di ltar dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ji skad bshad pa'i yul la sogs pa dang / bral ba'i ngo bo nyid 'gog ba'i blo nyid yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs nges pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ji skad bshad pa'i yul la sogs pa dang / bral ba'i ngo bo nyid 'gog ba'i blo nyid yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs nges pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus the awareness that excludes the nature of the other thing, which is free from the place and so on as previously explained, is called the exclusion of the thing that is ascertained as the place and so on, such as form.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum zhes bya ba tshad ma gcig 'jug pa'i dngos po thams cad phung po gnyis su rnam par 'jog par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum zhes bya ba tshad ma gcig 'jug pa'i dngos po thams cad phung po gnyis su rnam par 'jog par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the so-called perception is the one valid cognition that posits all things that are the domain of engagement of valid cognition as falling into two classes.

original: de la phung po gnyis ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la phung po gnyis ni 'di yin te /
translated: And the two classes are as follows:

original: gcig yongs su snang ba gang yin pa dang / de la ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad mi snang ba nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig yongs su snang ba gang yin pa dang / de la ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad mi snang ba nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: That which is the appearance of one thing and that which is the non-appearance of everything else that is not included in that.

original: 'di skad du dngos po thams cad snang ba dang mi snang ba nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du dngos po thams cad snang ba dang mi snang ba nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In other words, it is the positing of all things as either appearing or not appearing.

original: 'di na ni snang ba'o //üîΩde la ma gtogs pa 'di ni mi snang ba'o zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa 'di mngon sum rnam @164a * //
analyzed: 'di na ni snang ba'o // de la ma gtogs pa 'di ni mi snang ba'o zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa 'di mngon sum rnam @164a * //
translated: Here, this is the appearance,üîΩand this is the non-appearance of what is not included in that.

original: par rtog pa med pa la med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: par rtog pa med pa la med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this activity of conceptualization not absent in nonconceptual perception?

original: de'i phyir / de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is the ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance, etc.‚Äù

original: mngon sum de ni yod pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa kho nas 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum de ni yod pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa kho nas 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the cause of the concepts of existence and non-existence, perception is said to have an effect.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i blo ni yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i blo ni yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The cognition of concomitance is the concept of existence.

original: ldog pa'i blo ni dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
