analyzed: shes pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness itself‚Äù means

original: 'di shes pas na shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di shes pas na shes pa'o //
translated: that which is conscious is consciousness.

original: de'i ngo bo ni shes pa nyid yul gyi las kyi ngo bo ni shes pa la ltos pa la yin pas mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan yang /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni shes pa nyid yul gyi las kyi ngo bo ni shes pa la ltos pa la yin pas mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan yang /
translated: The nature of that is consciousness itself. The nature of the object is dependent on consciousness. Although it has this characteristic,

original: gal te shes yin na ni de'i tshe shes par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te shes yin na ni de'i tshe shes par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: if it is consciousness, then at that time it is that which makes conscious,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but not otherwise. This is the meaning.

original: mi 'dod pa'i ngo bo bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i ngo bo bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the unacceptable nature,

original: de la re zhig gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFirst of all, the nature of having an object that is not impaired,‚Äù and so on.

original: gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid ces bya ba mtshan nyid gzhan du nye bar bkod pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid ces bya ba mtshan nyid gzhan du nye bar bkod pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of having an object that is not impaired is a characteristic that is not posited as different. That is not a different characteristic.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause impairment and non-arising are not different,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma dag gis kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gnod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma dag gis kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gnod la /
translated: In this way, the valid cognitions also contradict the property to be established.üîΩAnd if the property to be established does not exist, the reason does not occur.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med na yang gtan tshigs mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal lo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med na yang gtan tshigs mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal lo //
translated: This is mutually contradictory.

original: 'gal ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmed na @170a * //
analyzed: 'gal ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / med na @170a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that contradiction, he says,

original: mi 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho na gtan tshigs yod pa gang yin pa de ni med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho na gtan tshigs yod pa gang yin pa de ni med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the property to be established does not exist, the reason does not occur.‚ÄùüîΩThat which is the existence of the reason when the property to be established exists is called ‚Äúinseparable.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that if the property to be established does not exist, the reason does not exist.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid de yang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag brjod pas bstan zin na /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid de yang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag brjod pas bstan zin na /
translated: Inseparability is demonstrated by stating the pervasion and the counter-pervasion.

original: ji ltar chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs de yang yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs de yang yod par 'gyur la /
translated: How could the reason, which has the characteristic of not occurring without the property to be established with regard to the subject, exist?

original: 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang med par 'gyur te /
translated: And the property to be established would not exist.

original: 'di ni rung snyam mi byed do //üîΩrung snyam mi byed pa de nyid co 'dri ba'i thabs kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni rung snyam mi byed do // rung snyam mi byed pa de nyid co 'dri ba'i thabs kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: I do not think that is correct.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩmngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de chos can de las zlog par byed la /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de chos can de las zlog par byed la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very fact that he does not think that is correct by means of a method of ridicule, he says direct perception and inference and so on.üîΩDirect perception and inference reverse the property to be established from the subject,üîΩand a reason that is invariably concomitant with the absence of the property to be established engages the property to be established in the subject.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos de chos can de la 'jug par byed pas pas da ni bsgrub par bya'i chos 'di ci mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i 'jigs pas chos can de la logs
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos de chos can de la 'jug par byed pas pas da ni bsgrub par bya'i chos 'di ci mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i 'jigs pas chos can de la logs
translated: Therefore, now, by the fear of direct perception and inference, is this property to be established reversed from the subject somewhere else?

original: shig tu 'bras sam /
analyzed: shig tu 'bras sam /
translated: Or is it reversed in the subject itself?

original: 'on te gtan tshigs kyi mthus de kho na la gnas par bya ba 'di dpyod pa na dngos po rnams te por skabs chen por chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gtan tshigs kyi mthus de kho na la gnas par bya ba 'di dpyod pa na dngos po rnams te por skabs chen por chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if, by the power of the reason, one is to be made to abide in reality, then when this is analyzed, things will fall into a great abyss.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la dag gis ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la dag gis ni /
translated: In this way, by direct perception and inference,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de lag pas mgul nas bzung nas zlog par byed la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de lag pas mgul nas bzung nas zlog par byed la /
translated: the probandum is seized by the throat with the hands and is refuted.

original: gtan tshigs kyis ni mdun du 'dug nas lag pa gnyis stobs yod med kyis de kho na la 'jug par byed pas de phan tshun du phar drangs pas te por nyam nga bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis ni mdun du 'dug nas lag pa gnyis stobs yod med kyis de kho na la 'jug par byed pas de phan tshun du phar drangs pas te por nyam nga bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the reason, sitting in front, engages in reality with the two hands, strong or weak. Therefore, it is mutually drawn back and forth, and falls into a great abyss.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating the opponent's objection,

original: gal te gzhan la gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, If for the sake of others, the reason and the probandum...

original: skabs su bab pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos can la gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba yin gyi chos can de kho na la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos can la gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung ba yin gyi chos can de kho na la ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason is not necessarily concomitant with the subject, but it is concomitant with the property of the thesis.

original: de'i phyir 'di ci ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ci ste /
translated: Therefore, why is this not a reason?

original: skabs su chud ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs su chud ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin some cases‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: tho 'tsham ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tho 'tsham ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a fault.

original: de ci nyon mongs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ci nyon mongs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhat is this affliction?‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gis ma ning chung mar blangs nas bu tshol bar byed do zhes grags pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gis ma ning chung mar blangs nas bu tshol bar byed do zhes grags pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: For example, it is well known that someone takes a neuter as a wife and seeks a son. This should be viewed as similar to that.

original: gtan tshigs kyi med na mi @170b 'byung ba nyid ni pho nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi med na mi @170b 'byung ba nyid ni pho nyid yin no //
translated: The reason is not necessarily concomitant with the subject, but it is concomitant with the property of the thesis.

original: de dang bral ba ni ma ning yin na /
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni ma ning yin na /
translated: If the reason is male, then the subject is free from that.

original: ji ltar med na mi 'byung ba dang bral ba'i ma ning de dang 'dra ba de nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: ji ltar med na mi 'byung ba dang bral ba'i ma ning de dang 'dra ba de nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Just as a neuter is free from being concomitant with that male, it is taught that the subject is similar to that.

original: chos can la bsgrub par la bya ba'i chos nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thu tshul bar byed /üîΩde nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos can la bsgrub par la bya ba'i chos nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thu tshul bar byed / de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The method of proving the probandum with respect to the subject is the definition of a correct reason.üîΩIn order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?‚ÄùüîΩIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?

original: gang gi ga chos can la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: gang gi ga chos can la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gang zhig skabs su bab pa'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med kyang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang zhig skabs su bab pa'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med kyang /
translated: If the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?üîΩIn order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?‚Äù

original: yod pa de dang 'dra ba'i gtan tshigs de chos can la nye bar bstan nas chos can de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes ji skad du bya /üîΩyang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs par bsu bar /üîΩgal te de nyid kyi phyir ;
analyzed: yod pa de dang 'dra ba'i gtan tshigs de chos can la nye bar bstan nas chos can de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa zhes ji skad du bya / yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs par bsu bar / gal te de nyid kyi phyir ;
translated: If the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?

original: gnod pa med pa smos te zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩde nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa smos te zhes bya ba smos te / de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?‚ÄùüîΩIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?

original: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?‚ÄùüîΩIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?üîΩIn order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how could the subject be said to possess the probandum?‚Äù

original: brgya la pha rol bo na re /
analyzed: brgya la pha rol bo na re /
translated: If the reason is stated with respect to the subject, but the probandum does not exist there, then how

original: gang gi phyir kho nar gtan tshigs mngon par 'dod pa'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par yang yod par 'gyur bar dogs pa de kho na'i phyir kho bos tshad ma dag gis gnod par ma byas pa'i chos can ldan pa'i chos can zhes gsalüîΩbar byed do zhes smras te /üîΩgang la gnod par ma byas pa'i chos can yod pa de ni gnod par ma byas pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho nar gtan tshigs mngon par 'dod pa'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par yang yod par 'gyur bar dogs pa de kho na'i phyir kho bos tshad ma dag gis gnod par ma byas pa'i chos can ldan pa'i chos can zhes gsal bar byed do zhes smras te / gang la gnod par ma byas pa'i chos can yod pa de ni gnod par ma byas pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can no //
translated: Because of the mere possibility that the property of the subject that is the reason may exist even when the property to be proven does not exist, the subject is specified as ‚Äúa subject that is not undermined by valid knowledge.‚ÄùüîΩThe opponent‚Äôs position is as follows: Because of the mere possibility that a subject that is undermined may exist, the mere subject that is not undermined is stated as the definition.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir kho nar gnod par byas pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can yang srid pa de kho na'i phyir gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid mtshan nyid gzhan du brjod do zhes smras pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'iüîΩdogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir kho nar gnod par byas pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can yang srid pa de kho na'i phyir gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid mtshan nyid gzhan du brjod do zhes smras pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: In other words, because of the mere possibility that a subject that is undermined may exist, the mere subject that is not undermined is stated as the definition.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the tenets responds:

original: de dag gnod pa med pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gnod pa med pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOnly when they are not invalidated‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gang na tshad ma dag gis gnod par ma byas pa'i chos dang ldan pa de lta bu'i chos can rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: gal te gang na tshad ma dag gis gnod par ma byas pa'i chos dang ldan pa de lta bu'i chos can rnam par 'jog na /
translated: If one posits a subject that possesses a property that is not invalidated by valid cognitions,

original: 'o na ni 'di ltar gnod pa med pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba grub par 'gyur bas gtan tshigs cung zad mi dgos so //üîΩ'di ltar gnod par byed pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sel bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di ltar gnod pa med pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba grub par 'gyur bas gtan tshigs cung zad mi dgos so // 'di ltar gnod par byed pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sel bar byed pa yin na /
translated: then the probandum would be established by that alone, without any need for a logical reason.üîΩIf the invalidating cognition were to eliminate the property of the probandum,

original: gal te de med na go 'o na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos grub pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: gal te de med na go 'o na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos grub pa'i phyir ;
translated: then since the probandum would be established,

original: gtan tshigs dgos pa dang 'gal ba yang med do //üîΩ'di ltar 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par byed pa'i tshad mas 'jug par nges pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dgos pa dang 'gal ba yang med do // 'di ltar 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par byed pa'i tshad mas 'jug par nges pa zhig gam /
translated: there would be no contradiction in the need for a logical reason.üîΩIn this way, the question is whether the valid cognition that eliminates the property of the probandum is ascertained or not.

original: 'on te ma nges pa zhig yin zhes bya ba rnam par brtag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te ma nges pa zhig yin zhes bya ba rnam par brtag pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two alternatives.

original: rnam par brtag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the first alternative,

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa @171a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa @171a * //
translated: If the object of affirmation does not exist,

original: las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the reason is not established.

original: gal te gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma kho nas thams cad la bsgrub bar bya ba med par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma kho nas thams cad la bsgrub bar bya ba med par byed na ni /
translated: If the object of affirmation does not exist due to the mere presence of a valid cognition that contradicts it,

original: de'i tshe gang na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de na bsgrub par bya ba yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de na bsgrub par bya ba yang /
translated: then in that case, where there is no valid cognition that contradicts it, the object of affirmation

original: de kho na las 'grub pas gtan tshigs don med do //
analyzed: de kho na las 'grub pas gtan tshigs don med do //
translated: would be established by that alone, so the reason is pointless.

original: de la 'di snyam du de nas gnod pa yod pa kho na ste /üîΩdes na gtan tshigs don yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du de nas gnod pa yod pa kho na ste / des na gtan tshigs don yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is only when there is contradiction thatüîΩthe reason is not pointless,

original: de'i phyir gnod pa yod pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa yod pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Even if there is contradiction, the reason is pointless.

original: gal te de la gnod pa yod na de'i tshe sgrub pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de la gnod pa yod na de'i tshe sgrub pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If there is contradiction, then because the proof is powerless,

original: gtan tshigs shin tu yang don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs shin tu yang don med pa nyid do //
translated: the reason is pointless.

original: 'di ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma srid na gtan tshigs kyis rang gi bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma srid na gtan tshigs kyis rang gi bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, if a valid cognition that contradicts it is possible, then the reason is not able to establish its object of affirmation.

original: de'i phyir de cing dgos /
analyzed: de'i phyir de cing dgos /
translated: Therefore, what is the need for that?

original: rnam par brtag pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the second analysis,

original: ma nges ba zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma nges ba zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúIf it is uncertain,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma nges pa'i phyogs la ni tshig gi don gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yang med la /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyogs la ni tshig gi don gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yang med la /
translated: In the case of an uncertain position, there is no valid cognition that contradicts the meaning of the statement.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa yang srid do zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa yang srid do zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it would be possible that the probandum does not exist.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bsgrub par bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bsgrub par bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the absence of a contradicting valid cognition, the probandum does not exist‚Äîthat is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa la nus pa chung zad kyang med pa de gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid chung zad kyang dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa la nus pa chung zad kyang med pa de gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid chung zad kyang dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest need for a noncontradictory [reason] to have a subject that is not contradicted.

original: 'di ltar gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma kho nas byed na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma kho nas byed na /
translated: Thus, if the nonexistence of the probandum is produced only by a contradicting valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe gnod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: then, in order to completely avoid contradiction,

original: gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can smos pa'i don yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can smos pa'i don yod pa yin no //
translated: The point of mentioning ‚Äúthe subject that is not contradicted‚Äù is to indicate that.

original: gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid smos pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid smos pa don med pa yin no //
translated: When there is no proof of the probandum even in the absence of a contradicting valid cognition, then it is pointless to mention ‚Äúthe subject that is not contradicted.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du gal te gang gnod pa med pa de na gnod mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba yod pa de'i tshe gnod pa med pa smos par rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te gang gnod pa med pa de na gnod mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba yod pa de'i tshe gnod pa med pa smos par rigs pa nyid do //
translated: In other words, if the probandum exists when there is no contradiction, then it is reasonable to mention ‚Äúthe absence of contradiction.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe gnod pa med pa bzhin du yang bsgrub bar bya ba med pa de'i tshe gnod pa med pa smras pa des ci zhig bya zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnod pa med pa bzhin du yang bsgrub bar bya ba med pa de'i tshe gnod pa med pa smras pa des ci zhig bya zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: But when the probandum does not exist even in the absence of contradiction, then what is the point of mentioning ‚Äúthe absence of contradiction‚Äù?

original: pha rol bos phyogs gnyis ka la bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol bos phyogs gnyis ka la bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he is afraid of the fault of explaining both sides,

original: lam gzhan la brten par bya bar gnod pa med pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lam gzhan la brten par bya bar gnod pa med pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe absence of contradiction in dependence on another path.‚Äù

original: gang gis na gnod pa med pa kho nas bsgrub @171b par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ba gnod pa med pa'i sgrar mi brjod do //
analyzed: gang gis na gnod pa med pa kho nas bsgrub @171b par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ba gnod pa med pa'i sgrar mi brjod do //
translated: But why not call it a non-deficient means of knowledge, since the object to be established is established by it alone without being deficient?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gnod pa mi dmigs pa ni gnod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs pa ni gnod pa med pa yin no //
translated: Non-deficiency is the non-apprehension of a deficiency.

original: gnod pa mi dmigs pa de yang mthong ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs pa de yang mthong ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But that non-apprehension of a deficiency is sometimes faulty,

original: res 'ga' gnod pa srid kyang skyes bu la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: res 'ga' gnod pa srid kyang skyes bu la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: because even when a deficiency is possible, it may not occur in a person.

original: res 'ga' gnod pa yod kyang mi mthong ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' gnod pa yod kyang mi mthong ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes even when a deficiency exists, it is not seen.

original: de'i phyir de ni gtan tshigs sbyor ba'i yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gtan tshigs sbyor ba'i yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the domain of the application of a reason.

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe gnod pa mi dmigs pa la gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs kyang 'bras bu yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe gnod pa mi dmigs pa la gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs kyang 'bras bu yod pa yin la /
translated: In this way, when the non-apprehension of a deficiency is called non-deficiency, then the reason also exists as an effect.

original: gnod par ma byas pa yang smos pas bya ba yin no zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod par ma byas pa yang smos pas bya ba yin no zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: And since it is mentioned, it is also an action.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says:

original: co 'dri bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: co 'dri bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ridicule,

original: gtan tshigs gnod pa dmigs pa la 'jigs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnod pa dmigs pa la 'jigs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe reason is fear of the observation of damage‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: kye gtan tshigs gnod pa dmigs pa la 'jigs kyi /üîΩgnod pa la ma yin nam cin khyod gnod pa tshad mar bzung nas /
analyzed: kye gtan tshigs gnod pa dmigs pa la 'jigs kyi / gnod pa la ma yin nam cin khyod gnod pa tshad mar bzung nas /
translated: Oh! The reason is fear of the observation of damage,üîΩnot fear of damage itself.üîΩYou accept that the reason is the mere nonobservation of damage,

original: gnod pa mi dmigs pa tsam la gtan tshigs sbyor bar bya bar 'dod /
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs pa tsam la gtan tshigs sbyor bar bya bar 'dod /
translated: having taken damage as valid.

original: re zhig gnod pa la 'jigs par bya ba gang yin pa ni rigs te /
analyzed: re zhig gnod pa la 'jigs par bya ba gang yin pa ni rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that one should fear damage,

original: de ni srin po bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi byis pa thams cad za bar byed kyi /
analyzed: de ni srin po bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi byis pa thams cad za bar byed kyi /
translated: because that, like a demon, devours all the children of reasons.

original: dmigs pa nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni za yang ci zhig za bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni za yang ci zhig za bar 'gyur /
translated: But what is there to devour in the freedom from afflictions that is the observation of the absence of damage?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: pha rol po dam 'cha' ba len du gzhug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po dam 'cha' ba len du gzhug pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to make the opponent accept the thesis,

original: gtan tshigs de don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the reason is ‚Äòultimately‚Äô and so on.‚Äù

original: khyod gtan tshigs sbyor ba gang yin pa de don dam par gnod pa srid kyang rung mi srid kyang rung /
analyzed: khyod gtan tshigs sbyor ba gang yin pa de don dam par gnod pa srid kyang rung mi srid kyang rung /
translated: The reason that you employ is suitable whether or not damage is possible ultimately.

original: mi ltos par gnod pa mi dmigs pa tsam la sbyar bar bya'am ci /
analyzed: mi ltos par gnod pa mi dmigs pa tsam la sbyar bar bya'am ci /
translated: Or should it be applied merely to the non-observation of harm without dependence?

original: pha rol pos smras pa sbyar bar bya /üîΩlegs par sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa sbyar bar bya / legs par sbyar bar bya /
translated: The opponent says: It should be applied.üîΩIt should be well applied.

original: rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be thoroughly applied.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says:

original: ci'i phyir sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why should it be applied?

original: don gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir pha rol pos bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir pha rol pos bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to establish a meaning that is to be proven, in order to establish what the opponent is to prove.

original: bsgrub par bya ba grub kyang ci ma rung snyam nas /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba grub kyang ci ma rung snyam nas /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt it be good if the probandum were established,‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs sbyor ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs sbyor ro //
translated: one applies a reason.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says:

original: des la lar gnod pa yod bzhin du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des la lar gnod pa yod bzhin du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In some cases, even though there is harm,

original: gtan tshigs sbyor na des la lar gnod pa yod bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba grub bar nus sam zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sbyor na des la lar gnod pa yod bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba grub bar nus sam zhe na /
translated: if one applies a reason in order to establish a probandum, is it possible that the probandum will be established even though there is harm?

original: gang gi na khyod gnod pa med par bya ba @172a * //
analyzed: gang gi na khyod gnod pa med par bya ba @172a * //
translated: What is that? It is the absence of harm to you.üîΩ

original: la 'bad par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: la 'bad par yang mi byed la /
translated: Why is it that you do not strive to eliminate the damage,

original: bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang sbyor /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang sbyor /
translated: but you do apply the reason in order to establish the probandum?

original: brgya la pha rol po na re /
analyzed: brgya la pha rol po na re /
translated: If the opponent says,

original: nus pa kho na'o zhes zer na de'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa kho na'o zhes zer na de'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is only able to do that,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then in response to that, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúEven if that were so,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gnod pa yod bzhin du gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par nus na de lta na yang gnod pa ma byas pa'i yul can nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa yod bzhin du gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par nus na de lta na yang gnod pa ma byas pa'i yul can nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If the reason is able to establish the probandum even though there is damage, then even if that were so, what would be the point of a reason that has the characteristic of not being damaged?

original: 'dir khyed gnod pa yod bzhin du yang gtan tshigs 'dis nus par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir khyed gnod pa yod bzhin du yang gtan tshigs 'dis nus par 'dod do //
translated: Here you assert that this reason is able to do that even though there is damage.

original: gang gi tshe gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par mi nus pa'i de'i tshe gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid kyi mtshan nyid bya bar rigs kyi gang gi tshe yod bzhin du yang sgrub par byed pa de'i de ci dgos
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par mi nus pa'i de'i tshe gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid kyi mtshan nyid bya bar rigs kyi gang gi tshe yod bzhin du yang sgrub par byed pa de'i de ci dgos
translated: When there is an objection, a reason cannot prove the probandum, and so it is not tenable that it has an object that is not refuted. But when it is existent, what is the point of proving it?

original: / de ltar na pha rol po gnod pa yod bzhin du yang gnod pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs sbyor bar khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar na pha rol po gnod pa yod bzhin du yang gnod pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs sbyor bar khas len pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even though the opponent has an objection, he accepts that the reason is applied due to the mere nonobservation of the objection.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says:

original: pha rol po gnod pa dmigs pa la yang gtan tshigs sbyor ba byed du gzhug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po gnod pa dmigs pa la yang gtan tshigs sbyor ba byed du gzhug pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to make the opponent apply the reason even though he observes the objection,

original: de lta na yang the tshom can la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang the tshom can la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven though that is so, one who is doubtful,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te khyod gnod pa yong bzhin du mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod na de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyod gnod pa yong bzhin du mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod na de lta yin na /
translated: If you assert that the reason is applied due to the mere nonobservation of the objection even though the objection exists,üîΩthen, in that case,

original: ji ltar khyod gnod pa yod bzhin du yang gnod pa khas blangs nas mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs sbyor ba khas len pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod gnod pa yod bzhin du yang gnod pa khas blangs nas mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs sbyor ba khas len pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as you accept the refutation, even though it exists, and apply the reason of non-observation,

original: gnod pa dmigs pa la yang gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa dmigs pa la yang gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, you should accept that the reason is applied when the refutation is observed.

original: 'di ltar gal te mi dmigs pa la yang gnod pa khas blangs nas sbyor bar byed na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te mi dmigs pa la yang gnod pa khas blangs nas sbyor bar byed na /
translated: If you apply the reason, accepting the refutation, even though it is not observed,üîΩthen at that time, since there is an acceptance of the position of observation, you should accept that the reason is applied when the refutation is observed.

original: de'i tshe dmigs pa'i phyogs la yang khas len pa yod pas gnod pa dmigs pa la yang sbyor bar 'dod par gyis shig / the tshom can la ni gal te gnod pa khas blangs nas gtan tshigs mi sbyor na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dmigs pa'i phyogs la yang khas len pa yod pas gnod pa dmigs pa la yang sbyor bar 'dod par gyis shig / the tshom can la ni gal te gnod pa khas blangs nas gtan tshigs mi sbyor na /
translated: If you do not apply the reason, accepting the refutation, even though it is observed,

original: de'i tshe de gnod pa yod pa bzhin du yang gtan tshigs kho na stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes gtan tshigs sbyar ba la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de gnod pa yod pa bzhin du yang gtan tshigs kho na stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes gtan tshigs sbyar ba la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: then at that time, even though the refutation exists, you would not apply the reason, thinking that the reason alone is powerful.

original: khas len na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khas len na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: If you accept, then there is no difference.

original: gdon mi za bar dmigs pa'i phyogs la yang gnod pa yod pa khas blangs nas sbyor bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dmigs pa'i phyogs la yang gnod pa yod pa khas blangs nas sbyor bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must accept that there is a fault in the position of the object, and then one must apply the reason.

original: de ltar ma yin te khas mi len na ci gnod pa yod dam /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te khas mi len na ci gnod pa yod dam /
translated: If it is not like that, and one does not accept it, then what is the fault?

original: 'on te med ces the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te med ces the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or is there not? One would be in doubt.

original: de'i phyir the tshom can la khas blangs nas gtan tshigs sbyor ba la 'jug par byed par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom can la khas blangs nas gtan tshigs sbyor ba la 'jug par byed par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: Therefore, one who is in doubt would not engage in applying the reason after accepting it.

original: rtogs pa @172b sngon du gtong ba rnams ni the tshom gyi 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa @172b sngon du gtong ba rnams ni the tshom gyi 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who have understanding beforehand do not engage in doubt.

original: yang na mi dmigs pa la the tshom za ba yin te /üîΩgang la the tshom za ba de la ni ci gnod pa yod dam /
analyzed: yang na mi dmigs pa la the tshom za ba yin te / gang la the tshom za ba de la ni ci gnod pa yod dam /
translated: Or else, one would be in doubt about non-apprehension.

original: 'on te med ces bya ba phyogs gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te med ces bya ba phyogs gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is in doubt about something, then one would have two positions: is there a fault or not?

original: de la med pa nyid kyi phyogs la ni gnod pa med pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba grub par bsams nas ;
analyzed: de la med pa nyid kyi phyogs la ni gnod pa med pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba grub par bsams nas ;
translated: Regarding the position of non-existence, since there is no fault at all, one would think that the probandum is established.

original: gtan tshigs don med par dogs par sbyor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs don med par dogs par sbyor bar mi byed do //
translated: One would not apply the reason, fearing that it would be pointless.

original: de lta bas na the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate doubt,

original: gdon mi za bar gnod pa khas blangs nas gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar gnod pa khas blangs nas gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: one should definitely accept the fault and wish to apply the reason.

original: khas len pa yin na ni /
analyzed: khas len pa yin na ni /
translated: If one accepts,

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i phyogs dag khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i phyogs dag khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: then since there is no difference between the position of observation and non-observation,üîΩone should apply the reason of the fault to observation as well.

original: dmigs pa la yang gnod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byos shig / gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: dmigs pa la yang gnod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byos shig / gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating the opportunity for others‚Äô words,

original: gal te gnod pa yod na mi nus so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa yod na mi nus so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf there is a fault, it is not possible.‚Äù

original: gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If there is a fault, the reason is not able to establish the probandum.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says,

original: gal te de ltar na sbyar kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na sbyar kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, it is applied,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis mi nus na /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis mi nus na /
translated: If it is not possible due to the existence of a fault,

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: then in that case,

original: 'o na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang gnod pas byas pa'i mi nus bar 'gyur du 'ong bas ji srid du gnod pa mi srid pa gtan la ma bab pa de srid du gtan tshigs sbyor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang gnod pas byas pa'i mi nus bar 'gyur du 'ong bas ji srid du gnod pa mi srid pa gtan la ma bab pa de srid du gtan tshigs sbyor bar mi bya'o //
translated: Well then, since there is the possibility that the reason is invalidated, one should not apply the reason until one has determined that there is no possibility of invalidation.

original: 'di ltar gal te ji zhig ltar gnod pa yod pa dang de'i gtan tshigs sbyar kyang nus pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te ji zhig ltar gnod pa yod pa dang de'i gtan tshigs sbyar kyang nus pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: For, in some way or other, there is invalidation, and even if one applies the reason, it is simply not capable of establishing the thesis.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating the opponent‚Äôs rejoinder, he says,

original: gal te gnod pa mi dmigs na nus so snyam na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa mi dmigs na nus so snyam na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you think that the reason is capable of establishing the thesis when there is no perception of invalidation.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe gnod pa mi dmigs pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs nus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnod pa mi dmigs pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs nus pa kho na yin no //
translated: When there is no perception of invalidation, the reason is capable of establishing the thesis.

original: 'dis yang pha rol po'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: 'dis yang pha rol po'i bsam pa ni /
translated: This shows that the opponent thinks as follows:

original: gang na gnod pa mi dmigs pa de ni de med pa kho na'o snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang na gnod pa mi dmigs pa de ni de med pa kho na'o snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere there is no perception of invalidation, there is simply no invalidation.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the thesis says,üîΩ‚ÄúIs it the case that the perception of invalidation is pervaded by invalidation?‚Äù

original: dmigs pas gnod pa la khyab pa'am /üîΩci na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pas gnod pa la khyab pa'am /üîΩci na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or, does the perception of invalidation not entail invalidation?

original: kye dmigs pas gnod pa la khyab pa'am ci na /
analyzed: kye dmigs pas gnod pa la khyab pa'am ci na /
translated: ‚ÄúOh! Why is it that the presence of the object‚Äôs invalidation is universal?‚Äù

original: rgyu gang gis na 'di ltar de lta yin na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na 'di ltar de lta yin na /
translated: What is the reason that this is so?

original: gtan tshigs gnod pas byas pa'i nus pa med par dogs pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ba dmigs pa log na gnod pa gnod mi za bar ldog par khas len /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnod pas byas pa'i nus pa med par dogs pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ba dmigs pa log na gnod pa gnod mi za bar ldog par khas len /
translated: If the reason is that there is doubt that the capacity of the reason is impaired by the invalidation, then it is accepted that when the object is invalidated, the invalidation necessarily invalidates it.

original: de la 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du /
translated: If you think,

original: dmigs pas gnod pa la khyab par 'dod pa nyid do snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pas gnod pa la khyab par 'dod pa nyid do snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúI accept that the presence of the object‚Äôs invalidation is universal,‚Äù then the following verse is stated:

original: de lta na yang gnod pa mi dmigs pa kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa @173a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang gnod pa mi dmigs pa kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa @173a * //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so, the object of affirmation is established only from the nonobservation of the invalidation.‚Äù

original: smos te / gal te dmigs pas gnod pa la bya ba na /
analyzed: smos te / gal te dmigs pas gnod pa la bya ba na /
translated: If the invalidation of the object is universal,

original: de lta na yang 'di ltar gnod pa mi dmigs pa kho na las bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur bas gtan tshigs don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ltar gnod pa mi dmigs pa kho na las bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur bas gtan tshigs don med pa yin no //
translated: even so, the object of affirmation is established only from the nonobservation of the invalidation. Therefore the reason is pointless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs na gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs na gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because if there is no observation of the invalidation, the invalidation is impossible.

original: gang na gnod pa mi dmigs pa de na de med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang na gnod pa mi dmigs pa de na de med pa kho na'o //
translated: Where there is no observation of harm, there is only nonexistence of that.

original: de med na bsgrub par bya ba grub na de la gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de med na bsgrub par bya ba grub na de la gtan tshigs kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If that does not exist, then when the probandum is established, what does the reason do there?

original: de la 'di snyam du dmigs pa log na gnod pa ldog pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du dmigs pa log na gnod pa ldog pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think in that case, when the object of observation is reversed, harm is not reversed,

original: dmigs pa log kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa log kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:

original: gal te dmigs pa log kyang gnod pa mi ldog pa /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa log kyang gnod pa mi ldog pa /
translated: Even if the object of observation is reversed, harm is not reversed.üîΩIf, although the object of observation is reversed, harm is not reversed,

original: 'o na ni kye gtan tshigs nus pa med pa de'i so na 'dug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni kye gtan tshigs nus pa med pa de'i so na 'dug pa yin te /
translated: then, alas, the reason is ineffective.

original: de'i phyir sbyor bar mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor bar mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be used.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the conclusion, he says,

original: de lta bas na chos can la rang gi bsgrub bar bya ba yod pa dang med ba dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos can la rang gi bsgrub bar bya ba yod pa dang med ba dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, with regard to the existence and nonexistence of the probandum in the subject, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar chos can la gnod pas bsgrub par bya ba brtsal kyang gtan tshigs yod pa de'i phyir chos can la bsgrub par rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod kyang gtan tshigs med la rang gi bsgrub bar bya ba med kyang yod pa ni cung
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar chos can la gnod pas bsgrub par bya ba brtsal kyang gtan tshigs yod pa de'i phyir chos can la bsgrub par rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod kyang gtan tshigs med la rang gi bsgrub bar bya ba med kyang yod pa ni cung
translated: Because in that way, the subject is undermined, and even though the probandum is sought, the reason exists. Therefore, even though the subject has the probandum, the reason does not exist. Even though the probandum does not exist, the reason exists.üîΩ

original: zad kyang sgrub par yang me byed /
analyzed: zad kyang sgrub par yang me byed /
translated: Because the probandum is sought through refuting the subject in that way, and because the reason exists, therefore, even though the probandum exists for the subject, the reason does not exist. Even though the probandum does not exist, the reason does not establish even the slightest bit.

original: 'jig par yang mi byed 'gog par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'jig par yang mi byed 'gog par yang mi byed do //
translated: It does not make something cease, nor does it make something not cease.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs de lta bu nye bar bkod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs de lta bu nye bar bkod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, when such a reason is stated,

original: bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not able to establish the probandum.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude, he says,

original: de lta bas na gnod pa dang med pa mi 'byung ba dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnod pa dang med pa mi 'byung ba dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, the non-occurrence of refutation and non-existence,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba de dag 'gal ba de'i phyir 'di phyir 'di gnyis lhan cig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba de dag 'gal ba de'i phyir 'di phyir 'di gnyis lhan cig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because refutation and non-occurrence are contradictory in that way, therefore these two do not exist together.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa ngo bo gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po //üîΩ'di ltar gang na gnod pa yod pa de na bsgrub bar bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa ngo bo gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po // 'di ltar gang na gnod pa yod pa de na bsgrub bar bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs med la /
translated: Therefore, it is established that the absence of contradiction is not a different nature.üîΩThus, where there is contradiction, there is no reason that is invariably concomitant with the probandum.

original: gang na med na mi 'byung ba yod pa de na gnod pa med pas mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gang na med na mi 'byung ba yod pa de na gnod pa med pas mi 'gal lo //
translated: And where there is invariable concomitance, there is no contradiction.

original: 'gal bas na lhan cig med do //
analyzed: 'gal bas na lhan cig med do //
translated: Since there is contradiction, there is no co-existence.

original: de ltar gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid ngo bo gzhan pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid ngo bo gzhan pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because contradiction and invariable concomitance are mutually exclusive, the absence of contradiction excludes the very difference of nature.

original: yang tshul gzhan gyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang tshul gzhan gyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this further by another method,

original: de de las khyad par gzhan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de de las khyad par gzhan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf that which is desired as the pervasion is different from that, etc.‚Äù

original: de mngon par 'dod pa'i khyab par de las @173b khyab par gzhan gyi dngos po mtshan nyid gcig tu smos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de mngon par 'dod pa'i khyab par de las @173b khyab par gzhan gyi dngos po mtshan nyid gcig tu smos par 'gyur na /
translated: If that which is desired as the pervasion is different from that, then the characteristic of a different entity would be mentioned as a single characteristic.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par gang zhig yod bzhin du yang khyad par gzhan du 'dod ba gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par gang zhig yod bzhin du yang khyad par gzhan du 'dod ba gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Even though the specific property of the subject exists, if one asserts that the specific property is different from the subject, then the specific property would be different from the subject.

original: dper na phyogs kyi chos nyid yod bzhin kho nar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi mthong ste /
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi chos nyid yod bzhin kho nar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi mthong ste /
translated: For example, even though the property of the subject exists, one does not see the existence of the property in similar instances as being different from the property of the subject.

original: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas de las mtshan nyid gzhan du smos pa lta bu zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas de las mtshan nyid gzhan du smos pa lta bu zhig yin grang na /
translated: Therefore, it is as if the specific property is stated as being different from the subject because it exists in similar instances.

original: med na mi 'byung ba de nyid kyi khyad par yod bzhin du gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid khyad par gzhan du 'dod pa gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin na /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba de nyid kyi khyad par yod bzhin du gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid khyad par gzhan du 'dod pa gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin na /
translated: If the specific property does not exist, it does not occur. If the specific property exists, it is not asserted as being different from the subject because it is not contradicted.

original: de ji ltar ngo bo gzhan du srid par 'gyur gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji ltar ngo bo gzhan du srid par 'gyur gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: How could it be possible that it is essentially different from the subject?

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba de lta bu dag gi yul la gnod pa mi srid do //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba de lta bu dag gi yul la gnod pa mi srid do //
translated: Because that is the case, it is impossible to contradict a reason that is the nonobservation of a nature that is incompatible with the object to be affirmed.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa ni logs shig tu gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba 'di gnyis kyis mtshan nyid du brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa med pa ni logs shig tu gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba 'di gnyis kyis mtshan nyid du brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the absence of contradiction is not to be stated separately as a characteristic of the reason, by these two, contradiction and the absence of the counter-pervasion.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude,

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs sbyor ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs sbyor ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, in the application of the reason,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because contradiction is like that between the absence of contradiction and the absence of the counter-pervasion,

original: gang du gtan tshigs sbyor ba der dam bcas pa'i nyes pa rnams srid pa med do //
analyzed: gang du gtan tshigs sbyor ba der dam bcas pa'i nyes pa rnams srid pa med do //
translated: in the application of the reason, the faults of the thesis are not possible.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid gtan tshigs zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid gtan tshigs zhes bya na /
translated: In this way, that which is the absence of the counter-pervasion of the probandum is called the reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs sbyor ba de la lta gnod pa'i ngo bo'i dam bcas pa'i gnod pa rnams gal srid /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs sbyor ba de la lta gnod pa'i ngo bo'i dam bcas pa'i gnod pa rnams gal srid /
translated: In the application of the reason, the absence of the counter-pervasion of the probandum, how could the faults of the thesis, which are the nature of contradiction, be possible?

original: de la 'di snyam du dam bcas pa tsam sbyor ba la dam bcas pa'i nyes pa rnams srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du dam bcas pa tsam sbyor ba la dam bcas pa'i nyes pa rnams srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, one might think that in the application of the mere thesis, the faults of the thesis are possible.

original: snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
analyzed: snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
translated: If you think this, then in response to that,

original: dam bcas pa 'ba' zhig sbyor ba yang med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa 'ba' zhig sbyor ba yang med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúNor is there the application of a mere thesis,‚Äù and so on.

original: dam bcas pa 'ba' zhig kyang sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa 'ba' zhig kyang sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there the application of a mere thesis.

original: de lta bas na dam bcas pa'i nyes pa brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dam bcas pa'i nyes pa brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not state the faults of a thesis.

original: 'di ltar dam bcas pa tsam gyis don 'grub par mi 'gyur bas gtan tshigs dang bral ba'i dam bcas pa sbyor ba nyid med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bcas pa tsam gyis don 'grub par mi 'gyur bas gtan tshigs dang bral ba'i dam bcas pa sbyor ba nyid med do //
translated: Since an object is not established by a mere thesis, there is no application of a thesis devoid of a reason.

original: de'i phyir dam bcas pa'i nyes pa rnams kyi go skabs yod par lta gal 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bcas pa'i nyes pa rnams kyi go skabs yod par lta gal 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could there be an opportunity for the faults of a thesis?

original: de ltar gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid gsal bas /
analyzed: de ltar gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid gsal bas /
translated: Thus, since the mere subject is clarified without being harmed,

original: mtshan nyid gzhan gsal ba'i phyir /üîΩ'dis ni grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can yang gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba @174a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan gsal ba'i phyir / 'dis ni grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can yang gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba @174a * //
translated: the other characteristics are clarified.üîΩThis also clarifies the one who wishes to state the number one.

original: smos te / gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid bsal ba kho nas grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can yang gsal ba rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smos te / gnod par ma byas pa'i yul can nyid bsal ba kho nas grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can yang gsal ba rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the one who wishes to state the number one is also clarified by the mere clarification of the subject without being harmed.

original: 'di nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gcig gsal bas gnyis pa sel ba mi srid par bzung nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gcig gsal bas gnyis pa sel ba mi srid par bzung nas /
translated: Because of their difference, it is impossible to eliminate the second by the manifestation of the first.

original: ji ltar bu zhes dri'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bu zhes dri'o //
translated: Therefore, the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhich one?‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bsal ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bsal ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the method of elimination by the proponent of the conclusion,

original: gcig ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gcig ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe one is only existent by the existence of its probandum,‚Äù and so on.

original: grangs gcig brjod pa tsam gyis ni 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: grangs gcig brjod pa tsam gyis ni 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa sel bar byed do //
translated: By the mere expression of the number one, the elimination of the non-erroneous contradiction is made.

original: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa de la yang gtan tshigs gcig ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho nas yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa de la yang gtan tshigs gcig ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho nas yod pa'i phyir /
translated: And in that non-erroneous contradiction, the one reason is only existent by the existence of its probandum.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba der 'khrul pa med pa can yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba der 'khrul pa med pa can yin te /
translated: It is non-erroneous with regard to its probandum.

original: dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: For example, sound is impermanent

original: byas pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because it is produced, like sound.

original: sgra de nyid la de las gzhan pa byas pa de las gzhan pa mnyan par bya ba nyid la sogs pa de las gnod par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa rtag pa nyid yod pa kho na yang yod pa'i phyir byas pa nyidüîΩ/ de dang 'gal bas na gnod pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: sgra de nyid la de las gzhan pa byas pa de las gzhan pa mnyan par bya ba nyid la sogs pa de las gnod par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa rtag pa nyid yod pa kho na yang yod pa'i phyir byas pa nyid / de dang 'gal bas na gnod pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: Since that which is contradictory to it, impermanence, exists, it is similar to the contradiction.

original: dper na sgra ni rtag ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni rtag ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, sound is permanent because it is audible, like sound itself.

original: gnod pa ni med na mi 'byung ba yod na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnod pa ni med na mi 'byung ba yod na mi 'thad do //
translated: If there is no contradiction, then it is not untenable if it exists.

original: med na mi 'byung ba yang gnod pa yod na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba yang gnod pa yod na mi 'thad do //
translated: If there is no contradiction, then it is untenable if it does not exist.

original: 'dir yang mi rtag pa nyid med pa mi 'byung ba'i byas pa nyid srid na rtag pa nyid mi 'thad la /
analyzed: 'dir yang mi rtag pa nyid med pa mi 'byung ba'i byas pa nyid srid na rtag pa nyid mi 'thad la /
translated: Here, if impermanence exists, then it is untenable that sound is permanent because it is produced, since production is not possible without impermanence.

original: rtag pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i mnyan par bya ba nyid srid na yang mi rtag pa nyid mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i mnyan par bya ba nyid srid na yang mi rtag pa nyid mi 'thad pas /
translated: If impermanence does not exist, then it is untenable that sound is impermanent because it is audible, since audibility is not possible without impermanence.

original: gnod pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is similar to the contradiction.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan yang ci gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩci gang zhig la dngos su gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu'am bzlog pa'i rgyur 'dod dam /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan yang ci gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ci gang zhig la dngos su gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu'am bzlog pa'i rgyur 'dod dam /
translated: In order to demonstrate another reason, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, is it that the counterpart of the reason is impossible?‚Äù

original: 'on te gang zhig la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo rab tu ma bstan pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo rab tu ma bstan pa zhig yin /
translated: Is it that which is the cause of a correct consciousness or the cause of its reversal, or is it that the counterpart of the reason is not demonstrated?

original: pha rol pos gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa ma mthong nas /
analyzed: pha rol pos gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa ma mthong nas /
translated: The opponent does not see any fault in either case.

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äú What is the problem?‚Äù

original: phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa ci yod /
translated: What is the fault in either case?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩphyogs dang po la nyes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / phyogs dang po la nyes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The proponent of the thesis says:

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyi zla bo ma bstan pa zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyi zla bo ma bstan pa zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the fault in the first case, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the counterpart of the reason is not demonstrated,‚Äù and so on.

original: re zhig gal te gang @174b la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa nyid yin pa de 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs kyi zla bo med pa nyid ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: re zhig gal te gang @174b la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa nyid yin pa de 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs kyi zla bo med pa nyid ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de /
translated: If you accept that the reason is impossible, then what you accept as the definition of ‚Äúthe reason‚Äôs absence‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: is not a definition at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nges par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nges par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it cannot be ascertained.‚Äù

original: don de lta bu la ni 'di la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa kho na'o zhes nges par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: don de lta bu la ni 'di la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa kho na'o zhes nges par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: In that case, it cannot be ascertained that ‚Äúthe reason‚Äôs counterpart is impossible here.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na nyes pa ci yong ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na nyes pa ci yong ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the problem?

original: gtan tshigs med pa yang yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med pa yang yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúit would also be a reason that does not exist.‚Äù

original: de ltar yin na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: gtan tshigs med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: it would also be a reason that does not exist.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i sgo nas 'thad pa ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i sgo nas 'thad pa ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a valid reason.

original: de ltar na tshig gi don ni de'i phyir gtan tshigs med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshig gi don ni de'i phyir gtan tshigs med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words is that the reason is nonexistent.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma nges pa'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma nges pa'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, he says, ‚ÄúThe reason is not established because the property of the position is uncertain.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi srid do//
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid yin par mi srid do//
translated: The property of the position is not possible as the characteristic of the reason that establishes the cause.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: phyogs kyi chos the tshom can bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos the tshom can bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúLike the property of the position that is uncertain.‚Äù

original: dper na phyogs kyi chos the tshom can la phyogs kyi chos nyid du tha snyad mi 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi chos the tshom can la phyogs kyi chos nyid du tha snyad mi 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the property of the position that is uncertain, the property of the position is not designated.

original: gal te mtshan nyid la the tshom za bar chug na yang gtan tshigs go ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid la the tshom za bar chug na yang gtan tshigs go ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the characteristic is uncertain, why is the reason not so?

original: the tshom can gyi mtshan nyid ni gtan tshigs kyang ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: the tshom can gyi mtshan nyid ni gtan tshigs kyang ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe uncertain characteristic is not a reason.‚Äù

original: the tshom can gyi mtshan nyid ni gtan tshigs su rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: the tshom can gyi mtshan nyid ni gtan tshigs su rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: The definition of a doubtful reason is that it is not posited as a logical argument.

original: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not a logical argument.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa la /
translated: In regard to a similar definition,

original: zla bo srid pa mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi mtshan nyid du mthun pa'i gtan tshigs gcig la zla bo mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: zla bo srid pa mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi mtshan nyid du mthun pa'i gtan tshigs gcig la zla bo mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: he says, ‚Äúwhen an opponent is seen,‚Äù and so on.

original: zla bo ma mthong ba dag las yang dogs pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: zla bo ma mthong ba dag las yang dogs pa skyed par byed de /
translated: When an opponent sees a logical argument that is similar to the definition, then he generates doubt about those that are not seen.

original: gang dag la zla bo ma mthong ba de dag la yang dogs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang dag la zla bo ma mthong ba de dag la yang dogs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He generates doubt about those that are not seen by the opponent. This is what it means.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here he says, ‚Äúbecause there is no difference in the logical argument.‚Äù

original: 'dir tshul gsum pa las ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dir tshul gsum pa las ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Here, there is no difference at all in the trimodal definition.

original: brgya la pha rol po khyad par khas len par 'gyur na /
analyzed: brgya la pha rol po khyad par khas len par 'gyur na /
translated: If the opponent were to accept a difference,

original: de'i phyir khyad par yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba'i khyad par zhig yod na de'i tshe khyad par @175a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba'i khyad par zhig yod na de'i tshe khyad par @175a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf there were a difference, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a difference in the nature of the reason or its effect, then that difference would be the characteristic of the reason.

original: khyad par de nyid gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin du zad mod kyi nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: khyad par de nyid gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin du zad mod kyi nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If that difference were the characteristic of the reason, what would be wrong with that?

original: de'i phyir des gnyen po gcig tu bsal ba'i gtan tshigs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir des gnyen po gcig tu bsal ba'i gtan tshigs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBy that, the reason which is the sole antidote to the counter-reason, etc.‚Äù

original: khyad par de dang ldan pas gnyen po gcig tu bsal ba'i gtan tshigs des rang gi bsgrub par bya ba nges par byed do //
analyzed: khyad par de dang ldan pas gnyen po gcig tu bsal ba'i gtan tshigs des rang gi bsgrub par bya ba nges par byed do //
translated: By possessing that difference, the reason which is the sole antidote to the counter-reason ascertains its own probandum.

original: de'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa ma yin pa gang yin bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa ma yin pa gang yin bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is not characterized by that, i.e., which does not possess such a difference, etc.‚Äù

original: gang bla zla bo'i med pa kho na yin pa de ni gnyen po gcig tu gsal ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: gang bla zla bo'i med pa kho na yin pa de ni gnyen po gcig tu gsal ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: That which is absolutely without an opponent is called ‚Äúthe single antidote.‚Äù

original: ; de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la khyad par de'i mtshan nyid yod pas 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ; de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la khyad par de'i mtshan nyid yod pas 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot having the characteristic of that‚Äù means that this has the characteristic of that difference.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa ni de'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa ni de'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot having the characteristic of that‚Äù is having the characteristic of that.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs nyid ma yin na ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs nyid ma yin na ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not a reason that does not have the characteristic of that, what is it?

original: de'i phyir de lta na grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can don med pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
