analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can don med pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, the desire to state the single number is pointless.‚Äù

original: gal te zla bo gnyis pa de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te zla bo gnyis pa de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin no //
translated: If the second opponent does not have the characteristic of that,

original: de'i tshe 'di gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time it would not be a reason.

original: de'i phyir grangs gcig nyid brjod par 'dod pa can gyis gang zhig rnam par gcod par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs gcig nyid brjod par 'dod pa can gyis gang zhig rnam par gcod par byed de /
translated: Therefore, what does the desire to state the single number exclude?

original: grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid don med pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid don med pa yin no //
translated: But it is meaningless to assert that it is one.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa dang ldan pa gtan tshigs nyid ma yin na yang /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa dang ldan pa gtan tshigs nyid ma yin na yang /
translated: And if it is not a logical reason because it does not have the characteristic of a logical reason,

original: nyes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: then in order to demonstrate the fault,

original: 'di'i phyir 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe characteristic of non-erroneous contradiction is eliminated.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa la /
translated: When it does not have the characteristic of a logical reason,

original: gtan tshigs nyid med pa de'i tshe 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid med pa de'i tshe 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the characteristic of non-erroneous contradiction is eliminated.

original: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs dag chos can gcig la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos phan tshun 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi 'gal bar 'du na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs dag chos can gcig la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos phan tshun 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi 'gal bar 'du na /
translated: In this way, when logical reasons that have their own characteristics establish mutually contradictory properties to be proven with respect to a single subject,üîΩthey are contradictory.

original: 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde'i mtshan nyid ces bya na /
analyzed: 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ste / de'i mtshan nyid ces bya na /
translated: That is called ‚Äúnon-erroneous contradiction.‚ÄùüîΩAnd if that is said to be its characteristic,

original: de yang de lta yin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de lta yin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then that is also eliminated.

original: de la 'di snyam du gang du khyad par de yod pa der 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa yod par ma gyur du chug na yang /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gang du khyad par de yod pa der 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa yod par ma gyur du chug na yang /
translated: But if you think that even though there is no error of contradiction where there is a difference,üîΩthen who can refute the other?

original: gzhan du go su zhig gis zlog par byed ce na /
analyzed: gzhan du go su zhig gis zlog par byed ce na /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúWhat is that difference?‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚Äù

original: gang zhig rtogs nas zla bo @175b srid dam mi srid pa dag blta bar bya ba khyad par de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩngo bo gang zhig rtogs nas gtan tshigs rnams kyi zla bo srid dam mi srid pa dag blta bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig rtogs nas zla bo @175b srid dam mi srid pa dag blta bar bya ba khyad par de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ngo bo gang zhig rtogs nas gtan tshigs rnams kyi zla bo srid dam mi srid pa dag blta bar bya ba ste /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚Äù

original: 'di lta ni khyad par 'di yod de /üîΩde lta bas na 'di la ni zla bo yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ni khyad par 'di yod de / de lta bas na 'di la ni zla bo yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚Äù

original: 'di la ni khyad par med pas 'di la ni zla bo yod par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar gtan tshigs la dbab par bya ba khu tshul bcangs pa'i tshul du smras pa'i khyad par gang yin pa'i khyad par de'i rang gi ngo bo mi ston tam /üîΩmjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la ni khyad par med pas 'di la ni zla bo yod par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar gtan tshigs la dbab par bya ba khu tshul bcangs pa'i tshul du smras pa'i khyad par gang yin pa'i khyad par de'i rang gi ngo bo mi ston tam /üîΩmjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is: ‚ÄúThe difference is that which is understood.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na khyad par med pa kho na yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyad par med pa kho na yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúSince there is no difference, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar kho bo gzhan du khyad par gyi ngo bo mi ston pa de'i phyir khyad par med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar kho bo gzhan du khyad par gyi ngo bo mi ston pa de'i phyir khyad par med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since we do not teach a difference in the nature of the reason, therefore there is no difference.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no difference,

original: thams cad du zla bo yod dam med ces dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du zla bo yod dam med ces dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one would doubt whether there is or is not an example in all cases.

original: de la 'di snyam du gang la zla blo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba de nyid gtan tshigs ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gang la zla blo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba de nyid gtan tshigs ma yin gyi /
translated: If you think that the reason is seen in the example, but it is not the reason,

original: gang la ma mthong ba de nyid gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la ma mthong ba de nyid gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
translated: and that the reason is seen in the non-example, then it is the reason,

original: zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe reason is seen in the example, etc.‚Äù

original: gang la zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba de yang dang po nyid du zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba dang / lhan cig gang gi na 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: gang la zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba de yang dang po nyid du zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba dang / lhan cig gang gi na 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason is seen in the example, but at first, when the reason is seen in the example, it is not the reason.

original: 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar nges par 'gyur ba'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar nges par 'gyur ba'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: But no such distinction is observed.

original: de la 'di snyam du gang dag la zla bo'i tshigs srid pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gang dag la zla bo'i tshigs srid pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that those which have a contradictory reason are necessarily observed,

original: de'i phyir de dag kho na gtan tshig nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kho na gtan tshig nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: then only those would be the reason,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: not others.

original: de'i phyir zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúEven those which have a contradictory reason,‚Äù etc.

original: gang dag la zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid pa de dag gi yang de dag gdon mi za bar dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid pa de dag gi yang de dag gdon mi za bar dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even those which have a contradictory reason are not necessarily observed.

original: gal te mi dmigs na 'on na ni de med pa kho na yin mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs na 'on na ni de med pa kho na yin mod ce na /
translated: If they are not observed, then they do not exist.

original: de'i phyir / shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúEndowed with the highest wisdom,‚Äù etc.

original: shes rab phul du gyur ba gang yin pa de kho nas brtags nas mthong gi /
analyzed: shes rab phul du gyur ba gang yin pa de kho nas brtags nas mthong gi /
translated: Those who have the highest wisdom examine and see.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by another.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid dam mi srid pa dag nges pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid dam mi srid pa dag nges pa med do //
translated: Since this is the case, there is no certainty that a counterexample to the reason is possible or impossible.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: because the definition of a reason is uncertain,

original: @176a * // 'ga' yang gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: @176a * // 'ga' yang gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: no reason at all is possible. This is the conclusion.

original: de ltar zla bo'i gtan tshigs nyid mi srid pa bsal nas rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar zla bo'i gtan tshigs nyid mi srid pa bsal nas rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted the impossibility of a counterexample, in order to refute the second alternative,

original: 'on te zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa zhig yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'on te zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa zhig yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOr, is it that a counterexample is not taught?‚Äù

original: 'on te gong du bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te gong du bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, fearing the faults explained above,

original: zla bo'i gtan tshigs nyid ma bstan pa'i phyogs khas len par byed na'o //
analyzed: zla bo'i gtan tshigs nyid ma bstan pa'i phyogs khas len par byed na'o //
translated: one accepts the position that a counterexample is not taught.

original: phyogs 'di khas blang bar bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs 'di khas blang bar bya ba la /
translated: In accepting this position,

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po dbang por nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po dbang por nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that the master DignƒÅga is the lord,üîΩhe says,

original: ji ltar bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as it was explained.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: How was it explained?

original: 'o na ni gang gi tshe sgra nyid rtag par las len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang gi tshe sgra nyid rtag par las len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, when sound itself is accepted as permanent‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan par bya ba nyid ni /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan par bya ba nyid ni /
translated: The master DignƒÅga explained that audibilityüîΩis not a correct reason for refuting permanence.

original: ji ltar yang rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa dang / pha rol pos 'o na ni gang gi tshe brda sprod ba pa spyi'i khyad par sgra nyid rtag par khas len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar yang rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes bshad pa dang / pha rol pos 'o na ni gang gi tshe brda sprod ba pa spyi'i khyad par sgra nyid rtag par khas len pa de'i tshe /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúWell then, when the grammarians accept sound itself as permanent, in general,

original: mnyan par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di gtan tshigs yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di gtan tshigs yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: then this property of the subject, audibility, would be a correct reason.

original: sgra ni rtag pa ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: sgra ni rtag pa ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes smras so //
translated: Sound is permanent because it is audible, like sound itself.‚Äù

original: pha rol pos 'di skad du smras pa dang / slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po blo gros mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: pha rol pos 'di skad du smras pa dang / slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po blo gros mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: The opponent says: The master DignƒÅga, who was wise,

original: gal te sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can 'di la bya brag pas ma rtag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs byas pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gal te sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can 'di la bya brag pas ma rtag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs byas pa nyid dam /
translated: said, ‚ÄúIf the reason ‚Äòbecause it is impermanent‚Äô is not applied to the subject, sound,

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gcig bstan par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gcig bstan par ma gyur na ni /
translated: then the reason ‚Äòbecause it has the characteristics of being produced‚Äô or ‚Äòbecause it arises immediately after exertion‚Äô and so on is not taught.

original: de'i tshe zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa 'di gtan tshigs yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa 'di gtan tshigs yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: At that time, this reason that does not teach a countering reason would be a reason alone.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas dbang por gsol pa dang lag pa gnyis kyis mgo la btsir nas kus 'debs shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas dbang por gsol pa dang lag pa gnyis kyis mgo la btsir nas kus 'debs shing /
translated: In this way, the master DignƒÅga, who was wise, said, ‚ÄúWhen he was asked by the king, he pressed his head with both hands and cried out,

original: 'di ni de bsgrags su yang mi rung la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni de bsgrags su yang mi rung la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄòThis is not suitable to be proclaimed‚Äô and so on.

original: kye ma kyi hud bla ma rnams kyi nyes pa bsgrags par rigs pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: kye ma kyi hud bla ma rnams kyi nyes pa bsgrags par rigs pa ma yin pas na /
translated: ‚ÄòAlas! It is not right to proclaim the faults of the gurus.‚Äô

original: bla mas smras pa'i phyir bsgrags su yang mi rung la /
analyzed: bla mas smras pa'i phyir bsgrags su yang mi rung la /
translated: It is also not suitable to proclaim it because of the guru‚Äôs statement.

original: ha cang rngams po tshe bcab par mi nus pas na ha cang rnams che ba'i phyir /üîΩbcab tu yang mi rung bas ci bla ma sun dbyung ngam /
analyzed: ha cang rngams po tshe bcab par mi nus pas na ha cang rnams che ba'i phyir / bcab tu yang mi rung bas ci bla ma sun dbyung ngam /
translated: Since it is not possible to conceal the great shame,

original: 'on te rigs pa la yal bar dor /
analyzed: 'on te rigs pa la yal bar dor /
translated: it is not suitable to conceal it. What should one do‚Äîdisplease the guru or abandon reasoning?

original: ji ltar bya gtol med pa shin tu skobs chen por chud pa yin na ji lta zhig tu rgol bar nus /
analyzed: ji ltar bya gtol med pa shin tu skobs chen por chud pa yin na ji lta zhig tu rgol bar nus /
translated: If one is in a very difficult situation, not knowing what to do, how can one argue?

original: ma shes so //
analyzed: ma shes so //
translated: I do not understand.

original: 'di la nyes pa ci zhig yod na /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa ci zhig yod na /
translated: What is the fault here?

original: gang gis na 'di mi bzad ce na /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di mi bzad ce na /
translated: By what is it unbearable?

original: gtan tshigs 'dis je zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis je zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This reason is stated in ‚ÄúBy this reason . . .‚Äù

original: @176b mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa 'dis so //
analyzed: @176b mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa 'dis so //
translated: By this reason, which is the reason that it is to be heard.

original: dngos po rnams kyang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i de nyid kyi rang bzhin du byas shing zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa dngos po rnams rtag pa'i rang gi ngo bor bsgrubs shing ngo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i de nyid kyi rang bzhin du byas shing zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa dngos po rnams rtag pa'i rang gi ngo bor bsgrubs shing ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThings are also made into the nature of their own objects of affirmation‚Äù means that things such as sound are established as having the nature of permanence.

original: de'i tshad ma can gyi skyes bu rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spyod pa dang / brda' sprod pa la sogs pa skyes bu gang dag la mnyan par bya ba nyid de'i tshad ma yod pa de dag ni de'i tshad ma can rnams te de dag mngon par mtho ba mtho ris dang /
analyzed: de'i tshad ma can gyi skyes bu rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spyod pa dang / brda' sprod pa la sogs pa skyes bu gang dag la mnyan par bya ba nyid de'i tshad ma yod pa de dag ni de'i tshad ma can rnams te de dag mngon par mtho ba mtho ris dang /
translated: Those who are authoritative personsüîΩare those who are to be listened to.üîΩThose who are authoritative persons are those who are to be listened to.üîΩ

original: nges par legs par byang grol bar sbyar nas so //
analyzed: nges par legs par byang grol bar sbyar nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are authoritative with regard to that‚Äù and so on. Those who are authoritative with regard to that are those who are authoritative with regard to the study of grammar and so on. They are connected to the higher realms and definite goodness.

original: 'di ltar dngos po de nyid bsgom pa na ji srid du nyon mongs pa rnams la mi spong ba de srid du ni mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po de nyid bsgom pa na ji srid du nyon mongs pa rnams la mi spong ba de srid du ni mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when one meditates on that thing, for as long as one does not abandon the afflictions, one will go to the higher realms.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams spong na ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams spong na ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: But if one abandons the afflictions, one will go to nirvana.

original: khyod kyis skyes bus gtan tshigs gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dus gzhan phyir khyod kyis skyes bu shes rab kyi rang bzhin can bye brag pas gtan tshigs gzhan byas pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: khyod kyis skyes bus gtan tshigs gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dus gzhan phyir khyod kyis skyes bu shes rab kyi rang bzhin can bye brag pas gtan tshigs gzhan byas pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: ‚ÄúYou have stated another reason‚Äù and so on. You, the wise one, have stated another reason, namely, ‚Äúbecause of being produced.‚Äù

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs bsgrub pa'i nus pa la gags byas pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs bsgrub pa'i nus pa la gags byas pa yin no //
translated: The reason, which has the characteristic of being heard, is obstructed from the ability to prove.

original: dngos po de dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po de dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Those things, etc.

original: sgra la sogs pa dngos po de dag dang / de'i tshad ma can gyi skyes bu de dag kyang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa las bskyed nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa dngos po de dag dang / de'i tshad ma can gyi skyes bu de dag kyang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa las bskyed nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those things, such as sound, and those persons who are the possessors of their valid cognitions, are generated from the excellence of high status and definite goodness. This is the meaning of ‚Äúhaving generated.‚Äù

original: rgyal po rgyal srid shor ba ltar //
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal srid shor ba ltar //
translated: Like a king who has lost his kingdom,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: etc.

original: gang gi tshe rgyal po dbang shor ba yin pa de'i tshe dka' thub kyi nags tshal la kun du rten par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyal po dbang shor ba yin pa de'i tshe dka' thub kyi nags tshal la kun du rten par byed do //
translated: When a king has lost his power, then he resorts to the forest of ascetics.

original: de bzhin du mnyan par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'di yang gang gi tshe bsgrub pa'i nus pa med par byas pa yin pa de'i tshe 'di ltar bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dngos po de dag dang / de'i tshad ma can gyi skyes bu de dag kyang dngos po nyid dang mtho ris dang byang grol dag las 'dren par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du mnyan par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'di yang gang gi tshe bsgrub pa'i nus pa med par byas pa yin pa de'i tshe 'di ltar bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dngos po de dag dang / de'i tshad ma can gyi skyes bu de dag kyang dngos po nyid dang mtho ris dang byang grol dag las 'dren par byed /
translated: So too, when this reason that has the characteristic of being heard renders the object of affirmation powerless, then just like that, those things such as sound and those people who possess the valid knowledge of those things are drawn from things, high rebirth, and liberation.

original: de dag gis kyang lag pa brkyang ste mnyan du rung ba nyid skyobs shig mnyan du rung ba nyid skyobs shig ces 'o dod 'bod par byed la /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang lag pa brkyang ste mnyan du rung ba nyid skyobs shig mnyan du rung ba nyid skyobs shig ces 'o dod 'bod par byed la /
translated: They too, with outstretched arms, cry out, ‚ÄúSave me from being heard! Save me from being heard!‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs des kyang de dag yongs su bskyab par mi nus te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des kyang de dag yongs su bskyab par mi nus te /
translated: But that reason is unable to protect them.

original: rang gi nyes par spyad pa dag gis dbang gis dbang shor ba'i phyir dka' thub kyi nags tshal du 'gro bas 'dir kho bos ji skad du smra bar bya /
analyzed: rang gi nyes par spyad pa dag gis dbang gis dbang shor ba'i phyir dka' thub kyi nags tshal du 'gro bas 'dir kho bos ji skad du smra bar bya /
translated: Because they are powerless due to their own misdeeds, they go to the forest of austerities. So what can I say here?

original: @177a * // de ltar co dris pa'i phyogs 'di la nyes pa nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @177a * // de ltar co dris pa'i phyogs 'di la nyes pa nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the faults of this position of contradiction,

original: sgrub pa nyid skyes bu'i spobs pas byas pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid skyes bu'i spobs pas byas pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe proof itself would be created by the person‚Äôs eloquence.‚Äù

original: zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na gtan tshigs kyi sgrub pa nyid skyes bu'i spobs pas byas par 'gyur te /üîΩde'i phyir dngos su na chung zad kyang sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na gtan tshigs kyi sgrub pa nyid skyes bu'i spobs pas byas par 'gyur te / de'i phyir dngos su na chung zad kyang sgrub pa'am /
translated: If the reason that does not teach the countering reason is accepted as a reason, then the proof of the reason would be created by the person‚Äôs eloquence.

original: sgrub pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in reality, it would not be a proof or nonproof at all.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe zla bo'i gtan tshigs nye bar mi ston pa de'i tshe ni sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe zla bo'i gtan tshigs nye bar mi ston pa de'i tshe ni sgrub pa yin la /
translated: Thus, when the countering reason is not taught, it is a proof.

original: gang gi tshe nye bar ston pa de'i tshe ni sgrub pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nye bar ston pa de'i tshe ni sgrub pa ma yin pas /
translated: When it is taught, it is not a proof.

original: sgrub pa nyid skyes bu'i spobs pas byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid skyes bu'i spobs pas byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore the proof itself would be created by the person‚Äôs eloquence.

original: zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na /üîΩcig gtan tshigs de dngos po chos su chos de yod pa can zhig gam /
analyzed: zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na / cig gtan tshigs de dngos po chos su chos de yod pa can zhig gam /
translated: If you accept the reason that is not stated as a reason,üîΩthen the reason is either a thing that has the property of the probandum or it is not a thing that has the property of the probandum.

original: 'on te chos de yod pa can ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba rnams par brtag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te chos de yod pa can ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba rnams par brtag pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two alternatives.

original: rnam par brtag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the first alternative,

original: gtan tshigs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf the reason is a thing that has the property of the probandum,‚Äù and so on.

original: dang por gtan tshigs su bzung ba gang yin pa de gal te ngo bo nyid kho nas /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos de yod pa kho nas yod pa'am /
analyzed: dang por gtan tshigs su bzung ba gang yin pa de gal te ngo bo nyid kho nas / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de yod pa kho nas yod pa'am /
translated: If the reason that is first taken to be a reason is a thing that has the property of the probandum,üîΩthen it is only by its own nature that it exists, or it is a producer of the property of the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de yod par byed pa bsgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i ngang tshul can zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de yod par byed pa bsgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i ngang tshul can zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it has such a character,

original: de'i tshe rgyu gang gis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par yang yod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu gang gis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par yang yod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then by what cause would the property of the probandum exist even when it does not exist?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par mi 'gyur ba gtan tshigs gzhan gyis gzhan du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par mi 'gyur ba gtan tshigs gzhan gyis gzhan du byed par 'gyur /
translated: The other reason would make the probandum into something else.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan nyid du mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan nyid du mi byed ce na /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt it make it into something else?

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe intrinsic reality of things would not transform into something else, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang gzhan du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang gzhan du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the intrinsic reality of things would not transform into something else.

original: ngo bo nyid 'gal ba gnyis gang yin pa de yang dngos po rnams kyi re re la yod par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di skad du gal te gtan tshigs don dam par bsgrub pa'i chos med na mi 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'gal ba gnyis gang yin pa de yang dngos po rnams kyi re re la yod par mi 'gyur ro // 'di skad du gal te gtan tshigs don dam par bsgrub pa'i chos med na mi 'byung ba yin na /
translated: And the intrinsic reality of things would not exist in each thing that has two contradictory intrinsic realities.

original: de ji ltar gtan tshigs gzhan gyis gzhan du byed par 'gyur zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩrnam par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji ltar gtan tshigs gzhan gyis gzhan du byed par 'gyur zhes bshad pa yin no // rnam par brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, he explains that if the reason is not a non-observation of something that does not exist ultimately, then how could the other reason make it into something else?

original: chos de yod pa can ma yin pa zhig yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos de yod pa can ma yin pa zhig yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to present a second analysis, he says, ‚ÄúEven if that property does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gtan tshigs chos de yod pa can ma yin pa zhig tu 'dod na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs chos de yod pa can ma yin pa zhig tu 'dod na de'i tshe /
translated: If you assert that the reason is not something that exists,

original: gzhan du yang ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig gis sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan du yang ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig gis sgrub pa yin /
translated: then how could it establish anything else?

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa na yang @177b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa na yang @177b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Anything else‚Äù means that even when the reason that is the opposite of the reason is not stated.

original: 'di skad du gal te gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa yang yod na ni de'i tshe zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa yang 'di ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi sgrub pa yin zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa yang yod na ni de'i tshe zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa yang 'di ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi sgrub pa yin zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In other words, if the reason is not something that exists, then how could it establish anything else?

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude, he says,

original: de lta bas na ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, by its very essence . . . ‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus la /
translated: Because in that case, the essence of things cannot be made otherwise,

original: ngo bo nyid 'gal ba gnyis gcig tu mi srid pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'gal ba gnyis gcig tu mi srid pa de'i phyir /
translated: and two contradictory essences cannot possibly be one,üîΩtherefore . . .

original: don dam par na rang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gi de'i mtshan nyid la 'bras bu rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la /üîΩzla bo'i gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can ni mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na rang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gi de'i mtshan nyid la 'bras bu rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la / zla bo'i gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can ni mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: In reality, the definition of an effect and of a nature is that they are not produced without their own object to be established.üîΩSince a reason that is a counter-correlate is impossible in the definition of an effect and of a nature, the desire to state a single number is not the definition.

original: grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid kyi mtshan nyid gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid kyi mtshan nyid gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the desire to state a single number is not the reason.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because there is no object of exclusion.

original: 'dis rnam par gcad par bya ba cung zad kyang med do //üîΩphyogs kyi chos nyid kyis ni ma grub pa rnam par gcod par byed /
analyzed: 'dis rnam par gcad par bya ba cung zad kyang med do // phyogs kyi chos nyid kyis ni ma grub pa rnam par gcod par byed /
translated: This means that there is not even the slightest object of exclusion.üîΩThe property of the subject excludes non-establishment.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyis ni 'gal ba dang thun mongs ma yin pa sel bar byed /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyis ni 'gal ba dang thun mongs ma yin pa sel bar byed /
translated: The presence in similar instances excludes contradiction and non-pervasion.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las log pas ni thun mongs ma yin pa'i ma nges pa sel bar byed na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las log pas ni thun mongs ma yin pa'i ma nges pa sel bar byed na /
translated: Since it is the opposite of the discordant side, it eliminates the uncommon indecision.

original: grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid kyis rnam par gcad par bya ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa can nyid kyis rnam par gcad par bya ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But if one wishes to state the number one, there is nothing at all to be eliminated.

original: 'gal bar 'khrul par med ba zhig rnam par gcod par 'gyur du ni /
analyzed: 'gal bar 'khrul par med ba zhig rnam par gcod par 'gyur du ni /
translated: If there were no error in contradiction, there would be elimination.

original: de ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis na dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mi srid pas de lta bas na grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis na dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la mi srid pas de lta bas na grangs gcig brjod par 'dod pa ni don med pa yin no //
translated: But that is impossible in an inference that proceeds by the power of fact, in the manner that has been explained. Therefore, the desire to state the number one is pointless.

original: shes pa nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate consciousness itself,

original: shes pa nyid ni rtags kyi chos ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid ni rtags kyi chos ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúConsciousness itself is not the property of the reason,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa ni rtog par byed pa'i chos yin gyi rtags kyi chos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni rtog par byed pa'i chos yin gyi rtags kyi chos ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is the property of the object of knowledge, but it is not the property of the reason.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could it be the definition of the reason?

original: rtags kyi chos kho na rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os so snyam du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyi chos kho na rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os so snyam du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is fitting that only the property of the reason be the definition of the reason.

original: rtags kyi chos kho na rtags kyi mtshan nyid du rigs pa'i ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtags kyi chos kho na rtags kyi mtshan nyid du rigs pa'i ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of what is fitting, that only the property of the reason is the definition of the reason,

original: rtags kyi ngo bo ji lta bu zhig las don rtogs par bya zhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtags kyi ngo bo ji lta bu zhig las don rtogs par bya zhes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhat kind of nature of the reason is the object to be understood?‚Äù and so on.

original: rtags ngo bo ji lta bu zhig las gzhal bya'i don rtogs par bya zhes bsam par bya ba la skabs su bang @178a * //
analyzed: rtags ngo bo ji lta bu zhig las gzhal bya'i don rtogs par bya zhes bsam par bya ba la skabs su bang @178a * //
translated: With regard to the thought, ‚ÄúWhat kind of nature of the reason is the object to be understood?‚Äù

original: pa la rtogs par byed pa lha sbyin la sogs pa la slu bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de'i ngo bo la rtags de'i ngo bo 'di lta bu yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa la rtogs par byed pa lha sbyin la sogs pa la slu bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de'i ngo bo la rtags de'i ngo bo 'di lta bu yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: in this context, that which does not deceive the cognizer, Devadatta, and so on, with regard to the object to be comprehended, fire, is the nature of that reason. The nature of that reason is like this.

original: ngo bo gang zhig mthong nas rtogs par byed pa 'dis 'di bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gang zhig mthong nas rtogs par byed pa 'dis 'di bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: Having seen that nature, the cognizer thinks, ‚ÄúThis proves that.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis is not a proof.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes rab tu rnam par phye ste bzhag nas /
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes rab tu rnam par phye ste bzhag nas /
translated: Having distinguished it in that way, it is posited.

original: de la 'dod pa'i don nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i bsgrub pa gang yin pa'i bsgrub pa de 'dod pa'i don nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin par yid ches nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i don nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i bsgrub pa gang yin pa'i bsgrub pa de 'dod pa'i don nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin par yid ches nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One engages in the proof that is the means of establishing the desired object, having confidence that that proof is the means of establishing the desired object.

original: tshul de lta bur rnam par gnas pa de la rtags 'di'i bdag gi ngo bo gang yin pa de rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os kyi /
analyzed: tshul de lta bur rnam par gnas pa de la rtags 'di'i bdag gi ngo bo gang yin pa de rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar 'os kyi /
translated: In that case, the nature of this reason is suitable to be the definition of a reason.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: But the nature of something else is not.

original: de la 'di snyam du shes pa ni rtags shes pa'i shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du shes pa ni rtags shes pa'i shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you think that because cognition is the means of knowing the reason,

original: bsgrub par bya ba grub par bya ba la nye bar sbyor te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba grub par bya ba la nye bar sbyor te /
translated: it is applied to the establishment of the probandum,

original: de'i phyir 'di rtags kyi mtshan nyid du rigs so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rtags kyi mtshan nyid du rigs so snyam du sems na /
translated: and therefore it is suitable to be the definition of a reason,

original: de'i phyir rtog pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it says, ‚ÄúIt is merely applied to the arising of the conception,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is a reason because it is cognition,

original: gzhal bya rtog pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba de tsam gyis rtags su 'dod na de'i tshe hang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtog pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba de tsam gyis rtags su 'dod na de'i tshe hang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asserts that a reason is merely that which connects the object of comprehension to the arising of a conception, then it would follow that the absurd consequence would ensue.

original: ha cang thal ba de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very absurd consequence, he says,

original: de ltar na ni gzhal bya dang skyes bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni gzhal bya dang skyes bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, the object of comprehension, person, and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: gzhal bya don dang skyes bu 'jal bar byed pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras ldan pa dang / 'du ba la sogs pa dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang rtags kyi mtshan nyid nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya don dang skyes bu 'jal bar byed pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras ldan pa dang / 'du ba la sogs pa dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang rtags kyi mtshan nyid nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of comprehension, the person who comprehends, and so on, and the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that possession, inherence, and so on, as well as illumination, mental activity, and so on, would also be the definition of a reason.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su de dag med par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su de dag med par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, in order to demonstrate that they are not reasons, he says, ‚ÄúWithout them,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhal bya la sogs pa med par ni rtags can la res 'ga' yang shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya la sogs pa med par ni rtags can la res 'ga' yang shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without the object of comprehension and so on, a cognition never arises in the one who possesses the reason.

original: shes pa la ltos pa'i las kyi ngo bo'i shes pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa la ltos pa'i las kyi ngo bo'i shes pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the nature of the action that depends on cognition just cognition?

original: de yang rtags kyi chos kho na yin na /
analyzed: de yang rtags kyi chos kho na yin na /
translated: And if that is the property of the reason,

original: ji ste gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is called ‚Äúthe nature of another,‚Äù

original: de lta yin mod kyi 'on kyang shes pa'i dbang gis 'di'i chos 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi 'on kyang shes pa'i dbang gis 'di'i chos 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: that is so, but still, by the power of consciousness, this is its property,

original: rang gis ni ma yin te 'di ltar gang gi tshe shes pas yul du byas pa de'i tshe de'i chos su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang gis ni ma yin te 'di ltar gang gi tshe shes pas yul du byas pa de'i tshe de'i chos su 'gyur gyi /
translated: but not by itself, because when an object is made into an object of consciousness, at that time it becomes its property.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu dag las 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur gyi phyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no gang zhig gang gi chos yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu dag las 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur gyi phyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise. Whatever is the property of something is only established from its own causes, not later.

original: 'dir pha rol pos /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol pos /
translated: Here the opponent says,

original: 'o na ni nges pa smos par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ni nges pa smos par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, you should not mention ascertainment.‚Äù

original: shes pa nyid ngo bo gzhan du mi 'dod na /
analyzed: shes pa nyid ngo bo gzhan du mi 'dod na /
translated: If consciousness itself is not asserted to be a different nature,

original: 'o na ni kye bstan bcos las nges pa smos pa byas pa gang @178b yin pa de mi bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni kye bstan bcos las nges pa smos pa byas pa gang @178b yin pa de mi bya dgos so //
translated: then in that case, you should not do what the treatise mentions, namely, ascertainment.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: mi bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not that you should not do it.‚Äù

original: de ni gzhan gyi don kho nar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi don kho nar byed pa yin no //
translated: That is only done for the sake of others.

original: gzhan gyi don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning for others,

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause of seeing and not seeing,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong bas gtan tshigs shes par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag gi mthong ba dang ma mthong bas gtan tshigs nus pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nges pa
analyzed: gang dag mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong bas gtan tshigs shes par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag gi mthong ba dang ma mthong bas gtan tshigs nus pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nges pa
translated: Those who assert that a reason is known by seeing it in a concordant class and not seeing it in a discordant class, in order to make them understand that ‚Äúbecause of seeing and not seeing‚Äù a reason is not capable, he says,

original: smos pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: smos pa byas pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of seeing and not seeing.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag yod bzhin du yang gtan tshigs shes par byed pa nyid ma yin pa mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag yod bzhin du yang gtan tshigs shes par byed pa nyid ma yin pa mthong ste /
translated: Thus, although seeing and not seeing exist, one sees that they are not a reason that is known.

original: log pa'i shes pas kyang de'i bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pas kyang de'i bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because of a wrong consciousness, one says, ‚ÄúHe is dark because he is his son,‚Äù and so on.

original: sngo bsangs yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba yang yod /
analyzed: sngo bsangs yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba yang yod /
translated: There is seeing in a concordant class,

original: sngo bsangs ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: sngo bsangs ma yin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yang yod mod kyi /
translated: There is indeed non-observation of the dissimilar class, but not of the similar class.

original: tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs shes par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs shes par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But this alone does not make it a proof.

original: de bas na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pas gtan tshigs shes par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pas gtan tshigs shes par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand the meaning that a proof is that which exists in the similar class and does not exist in the dissimilar class,
